loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
 
Edwin has a barber shop that provides hair cutting services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for hair cutting.

Edwin has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Edwin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for his barber shop

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 36 years old and married. She lives in Culo Molave Zamboanga del Sur. Rosita has a general store, which she has had for almost one year. She earns 1,200 PHP a month.

Rosita is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase stock for her general store. Rosita has been a member of PMPC for almost nine months. In the future, she hopes to earn 2,000 PHP a month.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase various goods such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rosavilla

texts.en:
Rosavilla is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Rosavilla has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Rosavilla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosavilla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: 03.08.120.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Hương is 31 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 03.08.120.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives with 1 dependent in Thieu Hoa district, Thanh Hoa province, a countryside region.

In 2010, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hương has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardships that Hương faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to buy land of her own for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Kibet

texts.en:
Kibet is still married to Hellen and their four children are growing well. He is still in the livestock business and right now he has asked for a higher loan that he plans to use to purchase a solar kit.

This will be second loan after repaying the previous loan well. The solar kit can be used to charge phones, which will increase his income, to listen to the radio and also for lighting, which will be beneficial in saving on the cost of buying paraffin. He plans to use the additional profits to repay the loan and grow the numbers of his livestock.

His still hopes to build houses for rental on his plot as he was not able to achieve that with the previous loan.

loans.use: To purchase a solar kit.

loans.name: Majdiya

texts.en: Majdiya is 23 years old and one of nine brothers and sisters. She is a student at a Jordanian college. Majdiya would like to have the opportunity to finish her studies and graduate so she can contribute to the family's income by having a job in the field in which she is majoring. In order to do so, Majdiya has applied for a loan to pay her semester's fees.

loans.use: pay her semester's fees.

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Mr. Hok, age 39, is the father of two single children. He sells firewood, which he collects from the forest and buys in bulk from his frequent suppliers. He uses an old trailer hauled by buffaloes. He typically earns around $5.60 per day. In order to satisfy their needs, Hok’s wife helps him earn income by raising some piglets in a wooden piggery at home. 

Now Hok would like to borrow his first loan from Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle for household usage because he doesn’t have a motorbike yet. As a result, he always walks to near distant places and takes a motor-taxi to far distant areas. For his business plan, Hok wants to expand his farming business and buy additional farming machines like a threshing machine, plowing machine, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for household usage.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 
Teresita is engaged in rice dealing and retailing business and earns approximately PHP5,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional sacks of rice for retailing and dealing business. 
Tereista has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Teresita hopes to engage in other type of business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Katia

texts.en:
Katia K. keeps a small grocery on the ground floor of the block she lives in. She is 54 years old and is divorced from 20 years. She has a son who lives in the capital city - Sofia.

Katia runs her business for 15 years. The grocery is very good supplied and has many regular customers. Katia’s son sometimes helps her in her business and makes some delivery when he is in Vratza.

Katia K. needs to buy a special refrigerator to keep milk products in it so she applies for a $2 000 loan.

loans.use: To buy a special refrigerator for milk products

loans.name: Lise

texts.en: Lise is a talented mother who decided to put her fishing skills to good use by starting a fishing business to cater to people from her village. She built a business with help from the South Pacific Business Development. However, Lise wants to expand and better develop her fishing tools to catch bigger fish and to go out for longer periods to fish. She has been in this line of business since she started with SPBD. A mother of four her business is the sole bread winner for her family as her husband is unemployed.

loans.use: Fishing nets

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en: Nurhayati is 27 years old, and is married with three children; two of them are girls and the other is a boy. Nurhayati and her husband, Amad, buy waste material like plastic cups, plastic bottles, cardboard, and paper from her neighbors and other houses in the village. Her husband uses a cart to collect scrap metal and other waste material. Households do not just give away waste material, because there is demand and therefore economic value in recycling. So the more working capital they have, the more scrap they can collect and recycle. Their own working capital is limited. Having heard from her friends about MBK, Nurhayati has now applied to MBK to add to her working capital. Since this is the first time Nurhayati can only borrow a maximum of $500 from MBK. Every three days, Nurhayati sells the waste materials to intermediate dealer and she can earn profit of $5.

loans.use: To buy more waste materials

loans.name: Sarya

texts.en: Sarya lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married, and she lives with all the members of her family. She is a tailor. She wants to expand her business to support her family. She took her 3rd cycle group loan and bought new sewing machines and did good business. Now she wants to take anther loan to buy extra materials to attract more clients and make a good income to help her husband and make a better economic situation for her family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: John

texts.en: "I was trained how to make furniture for 3 years, and I opened my own business 2 years later," says Mr. John E.. He is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He is a leader in the LAPO union, and he looks forward to receiving the above loan to enable him to buy more materials to make furniture.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make furniture

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Mr. Dionisio, 48, and his wife, Angela Isasi, 47, work together to care for their four children. Their two daughters are in college and the two boys attend high school. Angela works as a caretaker for retired persons. Mr. Dionisio has been selling electronics and other high demand items for the last 6 years. He works out of a small store located on the main street in the town of Quiindy. Before opening this store he made frames. When this work was no longer profitable he decided to sell electronics instead.

His business has been well accepted and is constantly growing thanks to a strong demand in the community and Mr Dionisio's good management skills. He hopes to expand his business by enlarging the range of products and services he offers in his store. In this way he hopes to provide a better life for his children.

Mr. Dionisio has asked for a loan to buy merchandise for his store, including: sunglasses, wallets, calculators and belts that have been demanded by his clients.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sunglasses, wallets and calculators.

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.id:
While Ni Ketut R. is no longer young, she is still diligent in pursuing her business to trade red sugar. She obtains her merchandise by going around the neighborhood helped by her husband, I Made Ronten. This business was used to support her family. She found DINARI through her local women's organization. She sought to get a loan from DINARI to trade coconut sugar. She gets 5 cents per 1 kg coconut. She can sell about 60kg daily, so she nets $3 daily profit. Demand for red sugar increases around Hindu festivals, so she earns more during those days. She has been involved in coconut sugar trading business for the past 20 years. She hopes the loan would help her expand her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Ketut R. di usia yang sudah tidak muda lagi masih tetap giat menekuni usahanya berjual beli gula kelapa. Barang dagangannya diperoleh dengan mencari secara keliling pada pelanggannya dan dibantu oleh suaminya, I Made Ronten . Usaha inilah yang dapat dilakukan untuk menopang keperluan dalam keluarganya. Melalui Tempek ( kumpulan ibu – ibu dalam satu wilayah ) yang ada desanya, Ni Ketut R. mengenal DINARI dan diberi kepercayaan dan mendapat dana pinjaman. Dana tersebut dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya dalam berjual beli gula kelapa. Keuntungan yang didapat dalam setiap 1 kilogram gula kelapa hanya Rp. 500,- . Dalam sehari Ni Ketut R. dapat memperoleh dagangan paling sedikit sebanyak 60 kg. Jadi keuntungan bersih yang didapat dapat sehari mencapai Rp.30.000,- Permintaan gula merah meningkat apabila sudah mendekati hari raya-hari raya umat Hindhu, sehingga keuntungan lebih meningkat lagi. Usaha gula kelapa ini sudah ditekuni selalu 20 tahun yang lalu. Dengan harapan kedepannya usaha akan semakin meningkat sehingga taraf kehidupan ekonominya akan lebih meningkat lagi.

loans.use: Purchase Red Sugar to be sold

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Regina H. is an owner of a little convenience store. She's had this store for more than 19 years. She was able to purchase her merchandise with the loans she obtained from Pro Mujer. Señora Regina is married and has 9 children. Her children are all married and some already have kids of their own.

Señora Regina gets her merchandise from Santa Cruz at a wholesale price which she then sells at a profit. She's also a great cook and she prepares special dishes at request only. This gives her the opportunity to make a little extra cash on the side.

At this time, she would like to purchase more merchandise for her convenience store since business is going great. She would like to continue buying at whole sale prices so that she can make more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Regina H., es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes, misma que la tiene hace mas de 19 años, iniciando sus primeras compras gracias a los créditos otorgados por Pro Mujer. La Señora Regina, esta casada y es madre de 9 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y en algunos casos casados y con hijos. Regina aprovecha el tiempo para vender de forma paralela todo tipo de mercadería que le traen de forma directa desde Santa Cruz. Asi también Regina tiene mucha habilidad para la preparación de platos especiales, por tal motivo se ha dedicado a la preparación de comida a contrato, lo que siempre le representa un ingreso extra para su sustento. Actualmente el comercio de mercadería es lo que más le ha rendido a Regina, por lo que ella precisa de capital para poder comprar mercadería en mayor cantidad, lo que permite rebajar el costo e incrementar las ganancias, tomando en cuenta que ella no tiene un puesto de venta exclusivo para esta mercadería.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for store

loans.name: Donier

texts.en:
A. Donier is 31 years old. He is married with two children. Except for his children and wife, the housekeeper, Donier is also supporting his parents.

Donier videotapes wedding parties and other family occasions. He has been in this business for about 15 years already. Donier tries to be creative about his job and when shooting the event and preparing the tape, as if he is making a cinema. In the neighborhood Donier is known as a very hard-working and diligent operator. He has many clients that make the business successful and brings stable income to the large family.

Today Donier requests 1 450.00 Somoni (425 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Donier is planning to purchase a computer for his business. This is Donier's first loan and he would like to assure everyone supporting him the he shall pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing  of computer

loans.name: Siwasahau's Mtanzania Group

texts.en:
Siwasahau, the group leader, is 27 years old and is married with children, ages 4 and 1 years. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 30 years. Siwasahau has been selling clothes and soap since 2007. She works daily from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales. Siwasahau now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Zamza and Time.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutuA. guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Clorinda Isidora

texts.es:
Clorinda Isidora G. L. is 47 years old, she studied up to fifth grade in secondary school. She has three children but only one still is dependent on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She sells lamb stew, chicken stew and fried fish during the mornings, in the afternoons she sells a fixed menu or a la carte, and in the evenings she sells a traditional Peruvian soup. When she lived in the district of Carabamba she had a small house where she had a store, but the business did not go well and she decided to go to Otuzco. There she started off selling candy from a small stand selling candy, later she rented a commercial space where she set up her restaurant.

Clorinda has been working since she was 12 years old when she sold fruit every morning at the market and studied in the afternoons. She also has a van with which she provides transportation service to the town of El Sauco.

She belongs for the "Luchando por el Progreso" community bank, where she got her first loan which she invested in the purchase of basic products for her store. With another loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy ingredients to make some of her stews and part of the money will be used to buy a tire for her van.

Her greatest dream is to buy a house in the city of Trujillo and reopen her general store there.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Clorinda Isidora G. L. tiene 47 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Tiene tres hijos pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad , Perú.

Vende caldo de carnero, caldo de gallina, pescado frito por las mañanas; por las tardes vende menú variado y platos a la carta y por las noches vende aguadito. Cuando vivía en el distrito de Carabamba tenia una pequeña casa en la que había instalado una tiendita, el negocio no iba bien, tomo la decisión de viajar a Otuzco, en un pequeño puesto empezó vendiendo golosinas, posteriormente alquilo un local en la que instalo su restaurante.

La señora Clorinda trabaja desde la edad de 12 años, por las mañanas vendía frutas en el mercado y por las tardes estudiaba. Actualmente también tiene una combi que hace servicio de transporte al caserío El Sauco.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Luchando por el Progreso” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirtió para comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda. Con el préstamo de S/. 1100.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses lo invertirá para comprar los ingredientes para preparar algunos potajes y otra parte del dinero para comprar una llanta para su combi.

Su mayor sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Trujillo y allí reabrir su bodega.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for making stews and soups.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary C. owns a provision store and also sells clothing. She is married and has three children. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She wants to increase her income, but she is running out of stock.

She is asking for $425 additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Three years ago, Vicenta noticed the huge demand for internet services in her community and didn’t hesitate to invest her husband’s retirement money in order to set-up this large family business: with the help of all the family they have been able to harvest the fruits of this investment. Now her dream is to improve still further the business’ environment, as a result for the demand for innovation from her youthful customers who have converted this space into one of their favourite afternoon hang-outs.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Hace tres años Vicenta, observó la gran demanda de los servicios de internet en su comunidad y no dudó en invertir el dinero de la jubilación de su esposo para iniciar este gran negocio familia, con ayuda de toda su familia han podido cosechar los frutos de esta inversión. Y su deseo es mejorar aún más su ambiente por la demanda de novedosos artículos de los jóvenes que han convertido a este espacio en uno de sus favoritos por las tardes.

loans.use: Installation and renovation of the business' space

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Mrs. Sima H. is a farmer in Kandal Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, she is also a coal seller. Since her coal selling business activity has improved, Mrs. Sima H. would like to expand it. Thus, she asked for a loan to buy more coal to re-sell for a profit. Her husband, Mr. Chanbarith Khun, assists his wife in both business activities.

Mrs. Sima H. is 25 and the mother of a child who is too young to work or attend school. Mrs. Sima H. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more coal to re-sell for a profit.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca I. is 37 years old and married with four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She has been in this business since 2003. She needs the loan amount of US$ 600 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Rosaura Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosaura is 30-years-old and lives with her husband and one-year-old son.

This woman has always been in search of opportunities to generate her own sources of income. This is how she found the way to do it, which is selling all types of sweets outside of an elementary school. Years ago, she and her sister attended to a cafe, where she learned all about the movement of the business. Now she works outside of the school every day, except on weekends, when she is dedicated to raising and selling pigs. She has noticed that this brings her good profits. This is why she continues dedicating herself to this business.

Her constant motive is to improve the quality of life for her family.

Rosaura will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise: sweets for her business and acquiring more pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Rosaura tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de un año.

Esta mujer, siempre ha estado en búsqueda de oportunidades para generarse sus propias fuentes de ingreso, tal es así, que encontró la forma de hacerlo, la cual es vendiendo todo tipo de golosinas en la puerta de una escuela primaria, años anteriores, junto a su hermana atendían en un cafetín, ahí aprendió todo el movimiento del negocio, que hoy Rosaura desempeña vendiendo en la puerta de la escuela, todos los días, excepto los fines de semana, donde se dedica criar y vender cerdos, ella se ha dado cuenta que esto le trae buenas ganancias, por ello continuará dedicándose a este negocio.

Su motivo constante es mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos.

Rosaura invertirá este préstamo en la compra de mercadería, de golosinas para su negocio y en adquirir más cerdos.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise (sweets) and to purchase more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora por su negocio, vende productos de dulcería (rosquillas, suspiros, pan casero, entre otros), ella los prepara en su domicilio, su esposo Javier la apoya mucho y es él quien se encarga de hornear estos dulces. A sus 45 años, es madre de 8 hijos, de los cuales 3 son independientes, quedando a su cargo 5 de ellos, que estudian y son sus ganas de seguir adelante, diariamente ruega al Todo Poderoso que siempre los proteja y los guíe por el buen camino.Doña Julia quiere seguir superándose, y mandar a construir habitaciones en su casa para alquiler, es por eso que requiere del préstamo que solicita para cumplir con su propósito.
texts.en:
Juliana is an enterprising woman and works hard in her business of selling candies and baked goods. She prepares these in her home with the help of her husband who is in charge of baking. At her 45 years of age, she is the mother of eight children three of whom are independent and five of whom are in her charge and in school hoping to get ahead. She prays daily that they be protected and be guided down the right path. Julia wants to keep getting ahead and wants to build rooms in her home to rent out which is why she needs the loan she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build rooms in her home to rent out.

loans.name: Clarial

texts.es:
La venta de ropa y calzado es el negocio al cual se desempeña la señora Clarial P. C. en el mercado Central de Chinandega. Es importante destacar que día a día este mercado es muy visitado por los habitantes de la ciudad de Chinandega y es por este motivo que ella se esfuerza día a día para ofrecer su mercadería a sus clientes.

Para la señora Clarial este es el único ingreso que percibe por lo que tiene que mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos ya que es madre soltera y de igual forma tiene que mantener a su anciana madre que necesita de su apoyo. La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito oportuno que le permita la compra de calzado y de ropa para ofrecerla. Por eso espera que su crédito le sea otorgado para beneficio propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
Clarial P. C. sells clothing and shoes in the Central market of Chinandega. It is important to note that every day this marked is frequented by the inhabitants of Chinandega and it is for this reason that she works everyday to offer her merchandise to her customers. For Clarial this is her only income that she receives to support her two small children as she is a single mother and she also supports her elderly mother who needs her assistance. The reason she has approached Ceprodel is to obtain a loan that will enable her to buy shoes and clothing to sell. Therefore she hopes that her loan will be granted for her benefit and that of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Pech Theary's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Pech Theary E. is a group leader of nine members who all live in Chrouy Dang village in Kandal Province. She is 27 years old and she is single. She is a bookseller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she requests a loan to buy more inventory for her consumers. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more books for her consumers.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah S. is a trader. He operates a cassava milling machine. Gari producers bring their cassava to him for milling. He also sells gari - roasted cassava flour - at Abrobeano near Elmina, which he has been doing since 1998. He is married and has five dependents and his wife is also a trader. He has received no formal education.

Abdullah will use this loan to purchase more cassava to increase his gari production. He will then use the profit he gets to cater for his family and to educate his children.

In the picture you can see Abdullah standing by one of his milling machines.

loans.use: To buy more cassava for gari production.

loans.name: Maria E.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Maria M. from Mbeya. She is married with three children, between the ages of 9 and 13. Maria has been running a "kuku" business since 2004. Raising "kuku" is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on Kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about "kuku".

Who or what are "kuku", you may ask. "Kuku" means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising "kuku" is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

Maria works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Maria currently earns about 70 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 450 USD in order to purchase more chickens ("kuku") for re-selling. In the future, she plans to open another business. Maria thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens (kuku) for re-selling

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 27-years-old and is married with three children. She sells rechargeable phone cards and she also rents music videos. Faith is requesting a loan amount of $ 275 (N40, 000) to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and music videos.  She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and music videos.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị T. 33 tuổi, chị đang sống tại  xã phú Cường huyện Kim động tỉnh Hưng Yên cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ. Năm 2000 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Đến nay sau 8 năm tham gia Quỹ  công việc chăn nuôi, trồng trọt của gia đình chị đã ngày càng được mở rộng và cho thu nhập khoảng 30.000.000/ năm. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 100 cây nhãn giống về trồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi T. is 33 years old. She lives at Phu Cuong Village, Kim Dong District, Hung Yen Province with her husband and two small children. in 2000 she joined TYM Fund to borrow loans to invest in livestock raising. After 8 years with TYM Fund, her livestock and orchard business expands and brings her an income of 30,000,000 VND per year. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in 100 seedlings to grow.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela began her business to take an activity and in some way help with household expenses. She started the business in June 2005 when a friend lent her some catalogs, and she told her the profits earned with the sales. So, Marcela began to sell shoes by catalog. She started selling to friends, then neighbors and relatives who made it possible to grow her sales. 

She needs a loan of $3,000 MXN that she will repay in 6 installments. With this credit, she is going to buy merchandise and deliver orders of shoes that are pending.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Asenati

texts.en:
Asenati M., 34, is married with 3 children. She has five years of experience in the ice cake and cigarette business. She sells to the village people and public seven days per week. This is her second loan for 1500 with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala.  Asenati plans to renovate her home with this loan.

SPBD loans are Asenati's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase timber, cement, paint, tools, nails, and iron roofing to renovate her home.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 25 años, es soltera, vive con su pequeña Estefany de 8 años en su casa propia, la cual le costó mucho obtener. Ella es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado mucho para lograr cubrir todos sus gastos, ejerciendo diferentes oficios como el lavar ropa, limpieza de casa, etc. Hoy en día se dedica a la venta de golosinas y espera con este negocio pueda lograr cosas mucho más grandes. Ahora quiere arreglar su casa para que en un futuro implemente un locutorio o unas cabinas de Internet, lamentablemente sabe que esto debe hacerse poco a poco y dedicarle mucho esfuerzo. Ana tiene muchas metas futuras y quiere hacerlas realidad por el bien de su pequeña Estefany, en la cual tiene plasmadas todas sus esperanzas y es por eso que siempre está pensando en brindarle lo mejor, con cada meta que persigue. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, fue aconsejada por una vecina a la cual le fue muy bien en esta institución, y ella espera que le suceda lo mismo, para invertir sabiamente en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas y también materiales de construcción para adecuar su casa para su posterior negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 25, is single. She lives with her little 8 year old Estefany in her own home, which she obtained at great cost. She is a woman who has always worked hard to be able to cover her expenses. She has done different jobs like washing clothes, cleaning houses, etc. Now she sells sweets, and she hopes that through this business she can achieve greater things. She would like to set up her house to have a phone shop or Internet café in the future. Sadly, she knows that she needs to do this little by little and with much effort. Ana has a lot of future goals, and she wants to make these a reality for her little Estefany. All of her hopes are centered on Estefany. With every goal Ana pursues she is always thinking about giving Estefany the best. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. A neighbor who did very well with Prisma advised Ana to get involved with them. Ana hopes she does as well as her neighbor in order to invest wisely in her business. With the loan she will buy larger quantities of sweets. She will also buy construction materials for her house for her projected business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael sells building materials. She is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Алиев Шариф проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 52 года.  Шариф со своей семьей занимается земледелием. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 20 лет. Шариф собрав свой урожай продает его на рынке. Он в основном сажает рис и кукрузу. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы собрать урожай и удовлетворить  потребности своей семьи, а потом посеить  второй урожай  риса и кукурузы, и в зимний период продать его.
texts.en:
Sharif A. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 52 years old. Sharif and his family work in agriculture. They have been in this business for more than 20 years. Sharif after collecting the harvest sells it at the market. He mostly plants rice and corn. The client is asking for credit in order to collect the harvest and satisfy his family’s needs, and to then plant a second harvest of rice and corn and to sell it in the winter season.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Collect and plant harvest

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 33-year-old Palestinian woman. She is married and has three children, a three-year-old daughter and two sons aged nine and ten.

Mai has been working in agriculture since she finished school. She has considerable experience in cultivation and planting. Her business grew dramatically, and Mai now owns a greenhouse, where she grows cucumbers, peas, and beans.

Mai is a very active woman and has other businesses in addition to the greenhouse. She raises rabbits and runs a small day care, where she currently has eight children. Mai says that she will do everything she can to ensure a better life for her children.
 
Mai's husband is a government employee but he helps in the greenhouse and sells the products at the vegetable market. Her mother-in-law helps to manage the day care and take care of the children. 

Mai has been a client at FATEN for more than eight years. She has received more than ten loans, all of which were fully repaid on time.

(The picture shows Mai in her greenhouse.)

loans.use: buy seedings, ferilizer

location.town: Biet Ommar Village, Hebron Destrict/West Bank

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Азиза девушка - 28 лет. Не замужем образование неполное. Азиза занимается торговлей мужского белья. Товар привозит поставщик. Она оплачивает транспортные расходы и даёт деньги за товар иногда она сама ездит за товаром. Она торгует на рынке более 5 лет. Азиза накапливает деньги на приданное. Её родители также раньше торговали на рынке. С годами стало труднее и бизнес она взяла в свои руки.
texts.en:
Aziza is a 28-year-old young woman. She is single. Her education is incomplete. Aziza sells men’s undergarments. The supplier delivers the merchandise. Aziza pays for travel expenses and gives money for the merchandise, and sometimes travels for the merchandise herself. She has been selling at the market for over 5 years. Aziza is saving money for the dowry. Her parents used to sell at the market too. However, it became harder for them as they grew older, and Aziza took over the business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's undergarments

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita M. is from the village of Camanga, Dumalinao. She is 57, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business venture raising livestock; her main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 38 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Oscar Carlos

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es el Sr. Oscar Carlos, el es natural de Cusco y vive en la calle pamtipata, el al igual que su esposa la Sr. Elvira, son socios del banco comunal choquequirao.

Nuestro socio es casado, y actualmente es jubilado, dedicándose al comercio minorista, el realiza todo tipo de trabajos, nuestro socio entró a formar parte del banco a insistencia de su esposa, desde entonces el ya es un miembro activo y participa de todas la s reuniones y actividades que se realizan dentro del banco, él normalmente realiza diferentes actividades en torno a l comercio minorista, enfocándose en el turismo, nuestro socio, requiere el préstamo para uso personal, generalmente el ve en cual de sus negocios invertir y lo hace, alternando en todos.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our client Oscar is a native of Cusco, where he lives on Pamptipata Street with his wife Elvira. Oscar and his wife are members of the Choquequirao Community Bank. Oscar is retired, but he still spends a lot of time on business. He joined the community bank at his wife's insistence. Since then he has become an active member; he participates in all of the bank's meetings and activities. Oscar is involved in all kinds of business, but he usually focuses on tourism. This loan is for Oscar's personal use; once he sees a business that interests him, he will make an investment. Our client Oscar appreciates and values this loan; he has agreed to abide by the repayment terms and make all his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Irma Yanira

texts.es: Irma Yanira O. D. L. vive en el departamento D. La Libertad.  Junto a su esposo han puesto una tienda en su casa ademas Irma tiene una venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo. A sus cortos 30 años, Yanira tiene ya tres hijos, todos menores D. edad que estudian en el colegio. Lo difícil D. la situación económica y los crecientes gastos del colegio D. sus hijos, llenan a Yanira D. un enorme deseo D. superación, y es por eso que solicita un préstamo para ampliar su negocio y comprar nuevos productos que potencien su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
Irma Yanira O. D. L. lives in the district of La Libertad. Together with her husband, they manage a store out of their home. Yanira also sells beauty products by catalog. At 30 years of age, Yanira already has 3 children who attend school. The difficult economic situation and the rising cost of her children’s education have motivated Yanira to excel in her businesses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can expand her business and buy new products to help generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat R. is 65 years old and a resident of Kandal Province. She is married with eight children, six of whom are single and two of whom are married and live separately. To help meet the family's needs, two of her daughters are employed as garment workers, earning salaries of $160 per month. Her husband is a local teacher, as well as a fisherman.

Sat R. makes a living selling fresh fish and fish paste in the local market. She started the business over twenty years ago and currently earns an income of approximately of $7 per day.

Sat R. will be using her second loan on Kiva in order to purchase cows to raise their offspring. In addition, she will rent them out to farmers for fees.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise their offspring and to rent them to farmers

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora V. is known by her nickname, “Noring.” She is from the barangay (village) of Lactawan Solano in Nueva Vizcaya. She is 60 years old and the mother of three children. Her husband, Romeo, is a tricycle driver in their barangay. Two of their children have finished their college studies and have their own families. Their youngest child is still studying in the tertiary level of education. 

Leonora is a market vendor. She sells smoked fish and vegetables, which helps her to earn an income. Despite her age, Leonora is still strong and determined to work hard to further improve her business. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva lenders. She believes that the more products she sells, the more income she will earn. She hopes that, with the continuous support of KIVA lenders, she will help to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: F. Françoise est née le 04 Juin 1967 et vit depuis huit ans au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ADE Victorin, Françoise est mère d'un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille.  N'ayant pas eu la chance d'aller à l'école, Françoise vend depuis douze ans de l'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) en gros, ainsi que des divers (tomates, riz, pâte alimentaire, etc.) dans son quartier. Françoise fait ses emplettes à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Françoise est un ancien client de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d'étendre son activité pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et réaliser plus d'économies, Françoise sollicite à nouveau auprès de ALIDé un crédit.
texts.en:
Françoise F. was born on 4 June 1967 and has lived for eight years in the Cadjèhoun district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Victorin Ade, Françoise has one child who is not yet in school. The couple provides for the family together. Not having had the chance to go to school, Françoise has sold akassa (a local food made from corn starch) in bulk, as well as other items (tomatoes, rice, food pastes, etc.) for twelve years in her locality. Françoise makes her purchases at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Françoise is a longstanding client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) and has repaid her loans properly. With a view to extend her business so as to satisfy the demands of her clientele and to realize more savings, Françoise is seeking a new loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items (canned food, food paste, rice, tomatoes)

loans.name: Karmen

texts.en:
Karmen is a young Palestinian women living in Bethlehem; she is married with two young children.

She has newly opened a grocery store to help her husband to have better income for the family. Her husband has an olive wood workshop; this workshop has been a family business for thirty years, and he inherited the skill and the workshop from his father). He makes a lot of souvenirs out of olive wood for tourists visiting Bethlehem, in addition to selling them to wholesalers who export these products to the USA and Europe.

Karmen has requested two thousand US dollars as a loan from FATEN for two things, first to enhance her newly opened grocery store, and also to buy olive wood for her husband's workshop.

Karmen appears in the picture at her shop.

loans.use: products for the grocery store and wood for her husband's workshop

loans.name: Itive

texts.en: Itive sells drinks, fried beef and pepper soup in his stall to make a living. He works long hours to enable him to meet the basic needs and necessities of his family. He hopes to own a big restaurant in the future. Itive is 50 years old and married with five children. His eldest child is 30 years old and the youngest is 12 years old. He lives in Ughelli, Delta state, Nigeria. Itive hopes for a loan of 60,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. This is the high season for sales, and he hopes to be able to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem V. is 35 years old and is a resident of the rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She is a divorced woman who currently works as a garment worker. She lives with 5 children; two are employed, and the others are going to school.

Beside her current work, Yem V. plants a rice crop for extra income when the rice season arrives. Yem V. is requesting a loan to buy a cow, which will alleviate her hard labor on the farm.

loans.use: To buy a cow for farmwork

loans.name: Tani Elena

texts.en:
Tani Elena V., aged 67, has been running a grocery store in the Central Market in the City of Leon for 16 years. She originally started the business with C$4000 (US$200) that her husband gave her. Though it has always been in the same spot, it has grown a lot. She is requesting this loan to buy products for her store. She would like to buy a little bit of all of her most popular grocery products.

Everyday Tani’s store is open from 9am – 5pm. Her customers all come to her stall in the market to make their purchases. Her stall is a very secure structure made of concrete and wrought iron. Tani has been working with CEPRODEL for five years. In that time she has had 55 loans. The loans have helped her expand her business little by little and also have improved her quality of life.

loans.use: To stock her store with its most popular grocery products

loans.name: Sinet

texts.en:
Miss Sinet R. (pictured here), 20, is single and lives with her sisters, brothers and widowed mother on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
 
Sinet has been a silk weaver for two years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market.  She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. She also will use a part of her loan to purchase construction materials for her brother’s business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and construction materials for her brother’s business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros A. is from the village of Barangay Dos. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Milagros owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns an average of approximately 2,000 PHP per month. In 2006, Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 5,500 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to support the education of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es casada, tiene 32 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco menores hijos en el caserío San Bernardino, distrito de Túcume, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de costura desde hace 15 años. Ella realiza su trabajo en su vivienda, donde tiene instalado un pequeño taller. Allí atiende los pedidos de los clientes que usualmente recurren a su negocio ya que los trabajos que realiza son de muy buena calidad.

Ella nos comenta que este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su hogar, ya que su esposo trabaja como agricultor y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para mantener el hogar. Juana se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantemiento de su máquina de coser, así como en la compra de material para comenzar a confeccionar prendas de manera independiente.

Juana es una mujer creativa, laboriosa y que gusta mucho de su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es poder instalar una bodega en su casa con la que pueda seguir apoyando a los suyos.
texts.en:
Juana is 32 and married. She lives with her husband and their five minor children in the San Bernardino neighborhood of the Túcume district. It is located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has devoted herself to sewing services since she was 15. She works in her house, where she has a small, well equipped shop. She takes care of her customers’ orders; they usually turn to her because she does very good quality work. She tells us that this business is a big help to their household economy. Her husband works as a farmer, but his income is not enough to support the household. For the first time Juana is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,000 PEN. She plans on using it for maintenance on her sewing machine. She will also buy material to start making clothes independently. Juana is a hard-working and creative woman who really likes her work. Her greatest desire is to be able to set up a convenience store in her house. That way she would be able to continue supporting her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine maintenance and to buy material

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Edgar, pertenecen al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 34 años de edad, é es conviviente con la Sra. La socia Francisca, juntos tiene  2 hijos de  5 y 1 años, nuestro socio es técnico agropecuario estudio 3 años en la academia taller  de arariwa, nuestro socio comprarte una agro veterinaria con su pareja y él aparte trabaja socio como proveedor de  plantones, semillas, fertilizantes, al municipio de Urubamba, nuestro socio también alquila el transporte que es para estos trabajos un volquete, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para  alquilar un volquete para llevar todos los pedidos que le hicieron del municipio, cuando el entregue toda la mercadería el municipio le pagará.
 
Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our group member, Edgar, belongs to the 'Nueva Vision de Urubamba' (New Vision of Urubamba) Community Bank. He lives in the heart of the holy Incan valley. Urubamba is 1 hour and 10 minutes from the city of Cuzco.

He is 34 years old and lives with Mrs. Francisca. Together they have two children who are 5 and 1. He is an agricultural technician and studied three years at a technical school in Arariwa. He and his wife run a farm veterinary business, and he also works selling seedlings, seeds, and fertilizers to the town of Urubamba. He rents a dump truck to transport these goods and is asking for a loan to buy a dump truck to deliver his items. After delivering all the merchandise he will be able to repay the loan.

He is thankful for the opportunity provided to him and promises to be responsible and make the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dumptruck for transporting merchandise

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 39-year-old mother of two children who attend school. Her husband is a farmer while she runs a retail shop where she sells cereals and other consumer goods. She has been in this business for 18 years.

She is an active member of Faulu Kenya and has previously taken out five loans worth Kes. 140,000. She plans to take out a loan of Kes. 80,000 to buy cereals and retail goods for sale. She hopes to improve her living standards and open up other business outlets for selling consumer goods. She describes herself as a confident and determined lady.

loans.use: To buy cereals and retail goods for sale

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de  Dioni, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments.
Ces femmes sont à leur première expérience Soro Yiriwaso.
Elle compte utiliser leur prêt  pour acheter, des paquets de différentes sortes de condiments alimentaires.
Elles s’approvisionnent à Barouéli  et Konobougou auprès des grossistes et producteurs et effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Barouéli, Konobougou, dans les foires environnantes et sur place à Dioni, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000FCFA  qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Danaya group are all married, and on average are 40 years old, have two children and all live in traditional extended families in the village of Dioni, in the Barouéli Prefecture, part of Ségou Region (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through family ties and they retail food condiments. These women are experiencing their first credit loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The loan will be used to buy packages of various types of food condiments. They get their supplies from wholesalers and producers in Barouéli and Konobougou. They sell their products at the Barouéli and Konobougou markets, at market fairs in the area and locally in Dioni, for cash, retail and on credit, to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 25,000 FCFA each, which will be used for daily family expenses, and the rest reinvested in the commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pea seed.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en: Zam is married and her husband is a machine operator in a coffee factory at Kawempe.  The family resides in and owns a house. Zam doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  Zam owns a stall selling bananas. She also has other jobs including a fish and a charcoal stall. She works seven days week and sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, fish and charcoal. She aspires to see her business grow big and build commercial houses. She has access to electricity and piped water and her monthly ??? include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, fish and charcoal

loans.name: Jeanna

texts.en:
Jeanna E. is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Buenavista, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her general store and rice-retailing business.

Her husband, Vicente, is a truck driver who delivers sugarcane to a milling site, and they have five children who are between the ages of 7 and 19 years old.  The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Jeanna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store and rice-retailing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of $335 from her business activities.

She is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 26,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her general store and rice-retailing business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 13th cycle loan the amount of 28,000 PHP, which she intends to use on her general store and rice-retailing business. Jeanna is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado T. tiene 64 años de edad, está casado con  DelRosario Denis, tienen 3 hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes. 
Viven en una compañía muy conocida de la ciudad de Itá, donde poseen una despensa bien surtida hace mas de 30 años de donde provee a vecinos y amigos de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar como: carne, verduras, leche, carbón, bebidas en general, embutidos y otras mercaderías. Además alquila varias hectáreas de tierra donde realiza plantación de caña dulce hace varios años. 
El señor Amado solicita el préstamo para la compra de diversos tipos de mercaderías para la despensa como: harina, arroz, fideo, azúcar, bebidas, etc. a modo de aumentar su stock de mercaderías y pueda generar mayores ingresos familiares y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Amado T. is 64 and is married to Del Rosario Denis. They have three adult children who live independently. They live in a well-known area in the city of Itá, where they have owned a well-stocked grocery store for more than 30 years. He provides his friends and neighbors all kinds of basic supplies for the home like: meat, vegetables, charcoal, beverages, sausages, and other merchandise. He also rents several hectares of land where he has grown sugar cane for several years. Señor Amado is requesting this loan to buy different kinds of merchandise for his store like: flour, rice, noodles, sugar, drinks, etc. In this way, he can increase his stock of merchandise and will be able to earn more income for his family and will improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, rice, noodles, sugar, and beverages.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen has applied for a loan for her husband who wants to expand his fruit selling business by purchasing more seasonal fruits to sell, which will help him improve sales and income. 
Perveen lives in the city of Multan with her husband and seven children. She makes embroidered dresses and sells them in different areas of the city. 
She couldn’t educate her children due to financial reasons but now she is hopeful that investment in her husband’s business will enable him to increase his income and hopefully allow them to send a few of her children to school.

loans.use: Purchase fruits for reselling

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old. She is married and has seven children who range from 1 to 22 years old. Four of her children are in school, two have graduated, and the youngest child is not yet of school age. 

Beatrice and her husband have a hardware store in the market where they sell charcoal stoves, knives, and other metal and plastic equipment. She has been in this business for 24 years and her business is doing well.

Beatrice is requesting this loan to buy more equipment.  She says that she has a large clientele because of her good customer care.

loans.use: Buying more hardware such as knives,metal charcoal stoves, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI II  sont de femmes mariées du village de  Ziekan dans la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du MA.) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, ont en moyenne 34 ans, au moins 5 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ziekan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les deux prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
DJENEBA H. compte utiliser pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana, M’peresso et  dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Tandis que les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille, DJENEBA H., elle espère sur 95.000 FCFA.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi II is made up of married women from the village of Ziekan in the San prefecture of the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of MA.). They live with their traditional extended families, have an average age of 34 years old, at least five children and cultivate peanuts. In the effort to make their agricltural businesses profitable, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. After having fully paid back their previous loans, they are on their third farming loan. Djeneba H. expects to use the loan to buy a sufficient amount of peanut seed, small tools and input materials, exclusively on the big market at Kimparana. After the rainy season, her harvest is stockpiled for a time so that she can know the value before selling it at big markets in Kimparana and M’peresso and in the surrounding markets at retail and wholesale to a customer base made up of resellers usually coming from large cities. While the group members each expect to make between 25,000 and 35,000 FCFA after the distribution of their agricultural products, which will used to pay back the interest on the loan and the everyday expenses of the family, Djeneba H. hopes to make 95,000 FCFA.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of input materials, seeds and small tools.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina C. is 62 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. She is from the village of Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. To make a living, Avelina owns and operates a business venture weaving nipa (to make a thatched roof from the leaves of the nipa palm). She has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month.
In 2006, Avelina joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,500 PHP from PMPC. Avelina is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital for her business. This loan will be her seventh from PMPC.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional working capital for her business

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
The middle-aged woman in the photograph is Ngin S., age 37. She lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang, which is the best territory for farming. Ngin S. is a married mother who is devoted to her three young children. One of her daughters is no longer in school and currently works in the garment industry. 

Ngin S. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. She also relies on the income from her husband, who works in the building field. Ngin S. will be using part of the loan to support her husband for buying construction tools and the rest to buy rice in bulk to resell for extra income.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk to resell for extra income

loans.name: Zela Yamileth

texts.es: La Sra. Zela Yamileth H.   ella se desempeña  como coordinadora técnica en la delegación del MINED, tiene  dieciocho años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente, tiene dos niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materiales de construcción y medicamentos para un familiar enfermo, los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Zela Yamileth H. works as technical coordinator at the delegation of MINED (Ministry of Education) and has being working for the institution for eighteen years. She is currently married and has two school-aged children. She has had six loans through CEPRODEL and she has used them to purchase construction materials to make housing improvements. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of construction materials and medicine for a sick family member. The loans with CEPRODEL have been of great benefit to her since, as a result, she has improved her living condition and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for a new roof: zinc, beams, sand, cement, and the purchase of agricultural products

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a husband and a father of four children from Bethlehem, Tareq works in tourism and transportation, he owns a bus which he uses for organized trips in Bethlehem city- a city which is famous of its religious and tourism attractions in Palestine.

Tareq is an old client of FATEN, he has received many loans to help him in his work and repaid them completely before receiving the last $500 loan which he will use for fixing and applying maintenance on his bus.
Carrying out tours around the city with his bus he is standing next to in the picture here is the only source of income for the family for the last 10 years.

loans.use: Cover maintenance expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fund operations

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah N. lives in the Kanyanya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children, three of whom are in school.  She changed her business enterprise from selling fruits and vegetables to bananas. She has been in this business for a few months and she works 7 days out of every week. Deborah sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Deborah has requested for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Deborah include transportation and market dues. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also start selling on wholesale only. Deborah lives in a home where she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Liberia Silvia

texts.es:
Esta clienta cuenta con un pequeño negocio que se ha venido superando con los créditos que se le han otorgado , en eta ocasión solicita le crédito para surtir su negocio ya que las mejores ventas del año están por llegar que es la temporada de navidad y fin de año 
Por lo que necesita el crédito para invertir en el negocio
Ya que de esta manera es que mantiene a sus 3 nietos que tiene a su cargo
texts.en:
Liberia has a small business which she has been maintaining with loans she received. On this occasion, she is soliciting a loan to resupply her business, since the best sales of the year are coming up, which is the Christmas season and the end of the year.

She needs a loan to invest in her business to help support the 3 grandchildren that she has under her care.

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE SUCH AS CANDY AND COSTUME JEWELRY

loans.name: Cecilia Monica

texts.es:
Cecilia de 31 años, tiene una pequeña papelería muy variada con juguetes y ropa. Vive con su esposo e hijos en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

Comenzó con un pequeño capital que su cuñada le presto para tener su propio negocio. Compro cuadernos, plumas, papelería y los comenzó a vender en un local. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm en su papelería. Vende los juguetes a $ 5.00, zapatos a $ 3.00, cuadernos a $ 1.00 c/u. Ella tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio porque quiere darles una buena vida a sus hijos que aun están pequeños. 

 Con el préstamo quiere comprar juguetes y artículos para la temporada de navidad. En el futuro quiere tener otra papelería en un lugar bien transitado.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 31, has a small, varied stationery shop where she also stocks toys and clothes.  She lives with her husband and children in an urban zone, called Orquídeas, because when it was discovered there were lots of flowers there and currently there is a park with these flowers.

She started with a small amount of capital that her sister-in-law lent her so that she could have her own business.  She bought notebooks, pens and paper goods and started to sell in a locale.  She is open from 7am until 10pm.  She sells the toys for $5.00, the shoes for $3.00 and notebooks for $1.00 a piece.  She has a lot of hopes for her store because she wants to provide her children, who are still little, with a good life.

She will use the loan to buy toys and Christmas items.  In the future she’d like to have a stationery shop in a well traveled area.

loans.use: For toys and shoes.

loans.name: Vivian Del Socorro

texts.es: Vivian del Socorro tiene 67 años su actividad económica es la panadería y venta de repostería. Hace más 28 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido de gran beneficio obtener este medio de vida, es una mujer muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de trabajar. Tiene su negocio que es una repostería ubicada en su vivienda, tiene bastante clientes ya establecidos. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como azúcar, harina, huevo, mantequilla y queso. Sueña con mantener el negocio y a su familia en general.
texts.en:
Vivian del Socorro is 67 years old and manages a bakery and pastry shop. She has been in business for more than 28 years. This business has been of great benefit to her as she has tried to earn a living. Vivian is an enterprising woman who is very eager to work.

Her business is located in her home and she has many established customers. She is requesting this loan in order to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour, eggs, butter, and cheese. Her dream is to maintain both her business and her family.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients such as sugar, flour, eggs, butter, and cheese

loans.name: Luzmilda

texts.es:
Luzmilda  V. V.  es conocida por hacer las mejores rosquillas (galletas de Maiz) de Guaitil en Guanacaste.
Ella ha participado en diferentes  ferias de comida debido a sus sabrosas rosquillas, pero en este momento  necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de materiales e ingredientes de producción, donde va a hacer  y vender su producto, Con el fin de  hacer de sus galletas un negocio sostenible que le brinde  bienestar a su Familia.
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Guaitil, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en: Luzmilda  V. V. is known for making the best roquillas (corn pastries similar to donuts) in Guaitil, Guanacaste. She has participated in different food fairs due to her delicious rosquillas, but at this moment she needs a loan of 500,000 colones ($1,000 USD) to buy materials and ingredients for baking and selling her product. She wants to make her pastry business sustainable and provide well-being for her family. She's a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Guaitil (Communal Credit Company Guaitil), one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: 0307013 Tay Xuan Vi -Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Nghiem C. T. (307013083) is a 62-year-old female living in the town of Hoang hoa. Nghiem is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 0307013 Tay xuan vi -Hoang Hoa (0307013 Tay xuan vi -Hoang Hoa).
Nghiem is widowed and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Nghiem operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Nghiem has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND per month from these activities.
In 2010, Nghiem joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her first from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Nghiem plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group
1. N. T. Loi (84) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her service-based business. 2. L. T. Thuy (85) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her service-based business. 3. D. T. Hong (86) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Nghiem C. T. (307013083) là 62 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang hoa. Nghiem là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0307013 Tay xuan vi -Hoang Hoa (0307013 Tay xuan vi -Hoang Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán cả hai loại thức ăn & các nhu yếu phẩm trong cộng đồng địa phương. Nghiem thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Nghiem kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND. Vào 2010, Nghiem đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. 0 Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. T. Loi (84) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.
