Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 2. L. T. Thuy (85) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 3. D. T. Hong (86) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati F. is married and has four children. She received a primary school education and has, for the last eight years, made a living selling banku, a local dish which is made from fermented corn and cassava dough. She sells her banku with fish in the town of Abrafo, which is located near the larger town of Abura. Her husband makes a living as a farmer. Fati uses most of her income to pay for her children's school fees and school supplies. She has applied for this loan to expand her small business by buying more corn and cassava to make into banku. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fati plans to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy more corn and cassava to make into banku, a local delicacy.

loans.name: Nozanin

texts.ru: Мирватаниева Нозанин проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ей 25 лет. Вдова, имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее. Живет вместе с родителями и братом. После смерти мужа она была вынуждена работать, и обеспечивать детей. Сейчас Нозанин работает официанткой в столовой своего брата. В этой области уже два года. Кредит просит для расширения бизнеса. Она хочет открыть свою собственную столовую.
texts.en: M. Nozanin lives in the J. Rumy region. She's twenty-five years old, widowed and has two children. She has a high school level of education and lives with her family. She had to support her family after her brothers' death. She's been working as a waitress in her brother's cafe for the past two years. She's asking for a loan in order to open and expand her own cafe.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fanny Miryan

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC AYLLU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fanny Miryan; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como contadora, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento y yeso.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fanny Miryan is a member of the communal bank “SUMAC AYLLU”, which is located in the Cusco District and Province, in the Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, single, and has one child.  She works as an accountant every day, from 8am until 7pm.  Through this job, she has been able to provide a better life for her son.  The reason for her loan is because she would like to construct her home.  She plans to use it to purchase construction materials, such as cement and plaster. 

She is happy about the loan and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials, such as cement and plaster.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres A. is from the village of Rang-Ayan, Mallig, Isabela. He is 58 years old. Andres is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Andres owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Andres has been engaged in his business for over 38 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Andres joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Andres has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Andres is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to renovate an existing shelter for his pigs. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Andres from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to renovate a shelter for his pigs

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos, de 64 años, es un hombre que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Natalia de 71 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para poder vivir junto a su esposa una vejez tranquila. Los largos días de trabajo que Santos tiene en sus chacras, le han hecho ver que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograr una buena calidad en sus cultivos. Todas las mañanas, junto a los primeros rayos de sol, camina hasta sus chacras de café, plátano, yuca y fréjoles, las  cuales están a una hora aproximadamente Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 44 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, por las sustancias que puede perjudicar su salud. En  adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los trescientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Santos is 64 years old. He is a man who has always striven to excel in life. He lives in his own house with his wife Natalia, 71, and what her desires the most is to work really hard in order to quietly spend his later years next to his wife. Santo's long working days in his fields have proven to him that he has to work really hard to obtain good quality products form his crops. Every morning, at the light of dawn, he walks for about an hour from his home to reach the fields where he grows coffee, plantain, yucca and beans. The part of his job he enjoys the most is farming his lands, something he does with very carefully. He has been engaging in this activity for 44 years, and he thinks the most difficult task is to spray his lands, because the substances he uses can compromise his health. In the future, he hopes to buy new farmlands in order to increase his crops. This is his fourth loan with MFP: he knows he has to promptly pay his dues if he wishes to be granted other loans in the future. He is a very participative member of his communal bank. With the 300 PEN he requested he will buy more manure for his crops.

loans.use: To buy more bags of manure.

loans.name: Patricia Jakeline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Patricia, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de  dos hijos de 5 y 3  años, el mayor este año empieza su primer año de escuela. Vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal  seis años  y le gusta por los créditos adicionales que brinda la institución.

Tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres, la misma que es  en sociedad con su mamá, además de vender productos de primera necesidad también vende artículos de bazar, útiles escolares, ciertas medicinas  entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que llevan con este negocio 8 años y que le ha ido muy bien, los productos los compran en Manta ya que allá le salen más baratos y encuentra más variedad.

Con este crédito va a comprar útiles escolares ya esta es la época de entrada a clases y es lo que más necesitan  sus clientes.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio  y que este crezca cada dia mas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. It is also where the famous Panama hats are made.

One can meet Sra. Patricia in this place. She is 32 years old and a single mother of two children (ages 5 and 3). The older child is starting his first year of school. Patricia lives at her parents’ house. She has been with the Communal Bank for six years and enjoys the additional loans that Fundación ESPOIR has provided for her.

Patricia has a store in her parents’ home that she manages with her mother. In addition to selling basic necessities, they also offer bazaar items, school supplies, certain medicines, and other products. Patricia works every day from 6:30am to 7pm. She says that she has been in this business for eight years and has done very well. Her products are purchased in Manta because the prices are lower and a greater variety is available.

This loan will be used to buy school supplies since classes have started and her customers have a greater need for these items. Her goal is to move forward in her business and grow more each day.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en: Ashkhen Bedeyan lives in the village of Bara, which is located in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married and has five daughters who range in age from nine to 27. In addition to raising her daughters, she has worked on the family farm for the past 30 years. Her goals are to continue supporting her family and raise money to renovate her family's home. She is applying for this loan to buy enough livestock to increase her family's income by 25 percent. She is very happy to have access to microfinance loans and an opportunity to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her income by buying more livestock.

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn L. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old and is married. To make a living, Emilyn owns & operates a fish business, buying and selling fish in the local community.  She is just starting this business.

In 2011, Emilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emilyn is requesting a loan of 40000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches and three  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Vivian is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, candies, shampoo, soap & detergents in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vivian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Vivian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. QOYLLORITY D. LUCRE”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Lucre en la provincia D. Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Ubaldina tiene 68 años D. edad y La socia es casada, la socia tiene 8 hijos D. los cuales  solo está con ella uno D. sus hijos D. 30 años; la socia tiene un stand en el mercado ella compra al por mayor carne D. vacuno y lo venD. al por menor en el mercado, la socia también venD. verduras, la socia requiere el crédito para poder hacer D. el un capital D. negocio esto significa ella con el crédito comprara 2 vacas enteras muertas, la socia ya se encargara D. trozarlas para la venta, ella también desea comprar carne D. cordero y aumentar verduras para su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. carne D. vacuno y verduras para implementar su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Ubaldina, 68, is a member of the “SEÑOR D. QOYLLORITY D. LUCRE” communal bank.  She lives in Lucre District in Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.

She is married and has 8 children of which only a 30-year-old son still lives with her.  She has a stand in the market.  She buys beef at wholesale and sells it at retail in the market.  She also sells vegetables.  She needs the loan to use as business capital, which means she’ll buy two whole slaughtered cows that she, herself, will butcher to sell.  She also plans to buy lamb and increase the vegetables for her business.  She is asking for the loan to buy beef and vegetables.

She values and is infinitely grateful for the granted loan which makes it possible for her business to grow and her quality of life to improve.  At the same time she commits to pay her installments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 30 years old, married to Francis and supports a family of six. She has been in the farming business for the last 13 years with a monthly income of KES 3,500 

With her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET, she plans to purchase wheat seeds and get fertilizers for her farm. This will help in early preparation of her family farm. 

Her future plan is to continue with farming with an aim of educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Edgard Alberto

texts.es:
El  señor Edgard Alberto vive en la ciudad de Managua y se desempeña como promotor comunitario desde hace nueve año para una empresa del estado.

El señor visito nuestra instalación para solicitar un crédito para  ya que necesitaba el crédito para completar el dinero para la compra de un terreno. 
El  señor agradece a ceprodel por el crédito que le dieron por que gracias a el va a poder hacer la compra de su terreno.
texts.en:
Edgard Alberto lives in the city of Managua.  He has been working as a local developer for a state-owned company for nine years.

Edgard Alberto visited our offices to request a loan that he would put together with some money he already has put aside to buy a plot of land.  He is grateful to Ceprodel for the loan that they have given him as it will enable him to buy his plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Abejitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy responsable en su casa con las labores del hogar, tiene 2 hijos pequeños un niño estudiante de primaria de 8 años de edad y una niña de 6 años que pronto entrara en la primaria. Doña Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de jugos y licuados afuera de una escuela, tiene con esa actividad aproximadamente 7 años, dice que emprendieron ella y su esposo este negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que los dos tenían trabajos estables y desgraciadamente hubo recorte de personal y tuvieron que abrir un negocio por desempleo. Ella también se dedica a vender dulces los compra en la ciudad de Toluca ya que allá le dan un buen precio y surte a diferentes tiendas de su población en una camioneta. Ella esta muy contenta por el préstamo que le esta otorgando la financiera por que gracias al crédito ella podrá comprar un poco mas de dulces de diferentes variedades y podrá surtir mejor a sus clientes y surtira mejor su puesto de jugos y licuados. La meta que tiene doña Eli como es conocida en su población es poner una dulcería grande pero primero ella quiere hacer un ahorro para hacer un local y poner la dulcería. Elizabeth pertenece a un grupo llamado "Abejitas Trabajadoras" que pidieron un préstamos a Fundación Realidad ñpara impulsar sus negocios.
Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Gloria, Cristina, Rosa, Mariana, Jorge, Maria de Jesús, Adriana, Teresa ellos usaran sus créditos para invertirlos en sus negocios como en un taller de costura, mueblería, bordado de prendas artesanales, taller de manualidades, panadería, tienda de ropa y antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very hard-working woman who does her household chores very responsibly.  She has two young children: an 8 year-old boy who is in elementary school and a 6 year-old girl who will start elementary school soon.

Elizabeth's business is selling juice and smoothies outside a school.  She has been in this business for approximately seven years.  She says that she and her husband started the business so that they could get their children ahead in life.  They both used to have stable jobs but, unfortunately, the company made staff cuts and they had to open a business as they found themselves unemployed.  Elizabeth also sells sweet treats which she buys in the city of Toluca as she receives them for a good price there.  She supplies the stores in her town in a pickup truck.  She is very happy to be receiving this loan from our financial institution because, with the loan, she will be able to buy a few more, different sweet treats and will be able to better supply her customers.  She will also be able to better stock her juice and smoothie stall.

The goal that Eli, as she is known in her town, has is to set up a large candy store but first she would like to make some savings so that she can build premises and set up her store.  Elizabeth belongs to a group called 'Abejitas Trabajadoras' (Hard-Working Little Bees).  They requested a loan from Fundación Realidad to boost their businesses.  The other members of the group are Gloria, Cristina, Rosa, Mariana, Jorge, María de Jesús, Adriana and Teresa.  They will use their loans to invest in their businesses which include a sewing workshop, a furniture store, embroidering garments, a craft workshop, a bakery, a clothes store and selling Mexican snacks.

loans.use: to buy sweet treats and to buy fruit for her juice stall

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  localidade de Chamissava, distrito municipal da Catembe a sul de Mocambique no ano de 1971. Cresceu  e fez o seu ensino primário na antiga Escola Missao, porque a familia nao tinha condicoes para continuar a sustentar os seus estudos.
 Casou se e tem 4 filhos  em idade escolar. E, devido a sitiacao economica que nao era satisfatória para a familia, comecou com os negócios muito cedo e vendia diversos produtos.
Atraves das amigas teve uma pequena formação na area da avicultura, e dai comecou com a criação de frangos, actividade que vem desenvolvendo  ha mais de 4 anos numa capoeira de material precario.
Tem larga experiencia nesta actividade, mas o unico problema é que na calada da noite varios animais tem invadido a capoeira e comem os pintos assim como os frangos e isto tem criado perdas.
Debateu com o marido e decidiram procurar a hluvuku para solicitarem credito no valor de 15.000,00mt para compra de material de construcao  ( cimento blocos e outros ) como forma de minimizar riscos de invasao de animais na capoeira.
Tem como plano futuro fazer  crescer cada vez mais no negocio.
texts.en:
Helena was born in 1971 in Chamissava, which is in the Catembe municipal district in southern Mozambique.She grew up and attended primary school at the old Mission School because her family could not afford to continue paying for her studies.

She got married and has four school-age children. And because her family's economic situation was not satisfactory, she began in business very early and sold a variety of products.

Through friends, she has a little training in aviculture, and she began raising chickens. She has been raising them for more than four years in a poorly built chicken coop.

She has a lot of experience with this activity, but the only problem is that in the dead of night several animals have invaded the coop and eaten the chicks and chickens, so Helena has had losses. She discussed it with her husband, and they decided to ask Hluvuku for a loan of 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement blocks, etc.) as a way to minimize the risk of animals invading the coop.

In the future Helena plans to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement blocks, etc.).

loans.name: Altanzul

texts.en:
Mr. Altanzul is 24 years old.  He is a young father who lives with his two children and wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife both work hard and are busy during the weekdays. Altanzul is a builder and makes home furnaces through the clients' subscription. In 2008, he bought a small piece of land and built a house with questionable building materials from his fence. Now the home needs repairs and renovations, because it is very uncomfortable and built inadequately.  

The loan he is taking will be used to purchase building materials and to pay repair costs for his house, in order to have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase building materials and pay for repairs of his house for a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: Hilario vive con su compañera de vida y tiene su negocio en el mercado municipal de la localidad donde vive, él vende productos plasticos y productos de primera necesidad tiene muchos clientes pues el lugar es muy concurrido de personas y además en su puesto siempre tiene lo que la gente necesita; Hilario siempre da muy buenos precios y sus productos son de muy buena calidad, el es un hombre muy entregado a su trabajo piensa que las oportunidades no son producto de la casualidad, más bien son resultado del duro trabajo y en esta oportunidad se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permite comprar productos plásticos, granos básicos, productos instantáneos, golosinas entre otros. Hilario tiene fe que todo el esfuerzo le dará la oportunidad de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Hilario lives with his life partner and has his business in the local market in the area they live in. He sells plastic products and essential items. He has many clients since the market is crowed and his store always has products his clients need. Hilario always offers good prices and high quality products. He is very dedicated to his work and believes that opportunities are not accidental but a result of hard work. With this opportunity he decided to request INTEGRAL a loan to buy plastic products, basic grains, instant products, sweets, as well as others. Hilario has faith that all of his efforts will give him the opportunity to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy plastic products, basic grains, instant products, and sweets.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a baker. She bakes bread and fries doughnuts to sell as she moves from one area to another in the vicinity of Krofofordo near Abura. She wishes to increase her income, and will use her loan from Kiva to buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients to bake and fry for sale.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients to bake and fry for sale.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mr. Chan is a 44-year-old man who lives in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. Mr. Chan is works very hard in his farming business to earn a living. Mr. Chan has been married for many years to Mrs. Sai, 45, a domestic farmer. And they have seven children, five of whom are single.  The other children are already married and live separately. Mr. Chan and his wife are able to generate an income about $7.50 USD each day. During this rainy season, this family has difficulties in living because some parts of their shelter are broken. Thus, Mr. Chan would like to request a loan from Kiva to mend his present house. Mr. Chan proposes to use the remainder of the loan to grow a larger rice crop and also to buy a plow. In the future, Mr. Chan hopes he can send his children to school.

loans.use: to mend his present house.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Jessica has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jessica has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy books and ink cartridges

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Veronica; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos, gallinas y cuyes, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos, gallinas y cuyes al por mayor.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Sra. Veronica is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Las Mercedes” which is located in the District of Huayllabamba, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 31 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Veronica divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. She sells her animals as a traveling merchant. Veronica works from 6am to 5pm. Through her business, she has been able to move her children forward. Veronica wants to expand and improve her business of raising animals, so she is requesting a loan to buy pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs wholesale.

She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
ESTRELITA
At the age of 17, Estrelita got married. She is now 48 years of age and has six children going to school. Estrelita engages in a retailing business in their village. She sells snack foods, beverages and spices. Estrelita’s husband is a farmer, planting rice in the Philippines.
With her dreams to improve their living, Estrelita engaged herself in a hog-raising business. She started this business only when her family experienced financial difficulties. Now, Estrelita has been in this business for almost 21 years. She said that she could not have reached this length of managing her hog-raising business if she didn’t love what she was doing.
Estrelita’s profit from the retailing business went toward her family's daily needs and some for the feed of her hogs. Still, her profit was not enough to sustain the feed of her hogs. Estrelita decided to take out a loan of P15,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 51-year-old married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for ten years. He started the business with the money he earned as a government worker. His major challenge is price fluctuation and inadequate capital to purchase enough inventory. His personal goal is to build a permanent house, while his business dream is to expand his business into new markets. Christopher needs the loan to harvest maize.

loans.use: to harvest maize

loans.name: Yesu Asobola Development Group

texts.en:
27 year old Aida is cognizant of the fact that it’s only her enterprise, steadfastness, assiduousness, determination and perseverance which will ensure steady improvement in her retail shop business. Aida, a happy go lucky single lady, says the sky is her only limit. She operates her business in Kampala.
Aida's family is close knit and there is a semblance of cohesion in what the family sets out to do.
The last 2 years have seen Aida on the inside lane as she aims at establishing a firm foothold for her business. She sells mostly general merchandise such as soap, sugar, salt, cold drinks, maize flour, rice, beans, plastics,etc.  Weekly she says his sales returns total up to Ugandan shillings 50,000.
Aida's reckoning is that in the near future, she will be able to sell and earn more if she can restock her shop with more commodities.
She intends to use her Kiva loan to purchase more retail stock, such as maize flour, beans, sugar, candles, etc to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail stock, such as maize flour, beans, sugar and candles

loans.name: Osim

texts.ru: Осим кредитор «Арванд-а» с 2006 года, он занимается продажей мужской обуви.  Ему  40 лет. За товаром ездит сам в Бишкек, один раз в месяц. Его жена работает в столовой поваром. У Осима двое детей. Старший сын учится в ПТУ на сварщика, а дочь заканчивает среднюю школу. Он каждый свой кредит использует целенаправленно не расширение бизнеса, следовательно, на следующий кредит хочет привезти партию зимних мужских сапог.
texts.en: Osim has been obtaining financing from "Arvand" since 2006.  He is involved in selling men's shoes.  Osim is 40 years old.  He travels for his merchandise to Bishkek himself once per month.  His wife works as a cook at a cafeteria.  Osim has two children.  His oldest son is studying to be a welder at a professional technical college, and his daughter is finishing a secondary school.  Osim uses each of his loan purposefully for business expansion and wants to use this loan to bring in an inventory of men's winter boots.

loans.use: to bring in an inventory of men's winter boots

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 36, is married to Evans and is blessed with one child. She runs a butcher shop, which she has operated for 11 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 59,000.

This is her third loan with KADET LTD, and she has successfully repaid the previous loans. She will use the funds to buy a motorbike for transporting the meat to a wider range of customers. Grace hopes to open a chain of butcheries.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting meat

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Trabajadoras ” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de Union. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  pero también hacen actividades para fomentar su compañerismo. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Ursulina, quien cuenta que tiene una librería bien surtida, gracias a la cual ella puede trabajar y obtener los medios para poder sostener a su familia. Ella comenta que siempre tiene buena venta, ya que en todo momento del año hay gente comprando algo y eso la ayuda a tener buenas ganancias. Su proposito es seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cuadernos, libros, lapices, pinceles y demás insumos con los cuales podrá abastecerse y tener un buen stock para cuando las clases vuelvan a iniciar.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadoras" was formed by several neighbors of the community called Union.  All of the members are involved in independent businesses, but they also get together for activities that foster team spirit.  They are very hard-working, determined women.

One of the members is Mrs. Ursulina who has a well-stocked bookstore that allows her to work and make enough income to support her family.  She says sales are always good because throughout the year people are always buying something, and that generates good profits.  Her goal is to keeping growing and continue helping her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy notebooks, books, pencils, brushes and other supplies to restock her store for when school begins.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, books, pencils, brushes and other supplies.

loans.name: Uljon

texts.ru: Улжон более девяти лет занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Она в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Она берет кредит для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Uljon has been involved in breeding cattle for over nine years.  She primarily breeds livestock for future sale.  Uljon is 46 years old, married and has six children.  She is requesting this loan to purchase several heads of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase several heads of cattle

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en: The last house on the only road in the village of Pruteni (leading to the Romanian border) is Raisa\'s homestead. Her house overlooks a massive field leading into a forest where the sun seams to linger during the sunset. Raisa is 45 years old and operates her family farm together with her two girls and hard working husband. She believes that wild pigs roaming freely instead of locked up in a cage will make more plump and juicy meat which will sell for a higher price in the market. She would like a loan to purchase an additional two pigs and expand her fence around her property.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 pigs and related expenses

loans.name: Taliilagi

texts.en:
Taliilagi grew up with the dream of one day owning her own store, and with the help of the SPBDF it is now coming true.

She wants to expand her business in order to improve the life of her family by providing a stable financial base for her family.

She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from the SPBDF in order to expand the number of goods for sale and to expand the size of her store.

loans.use: Expand inventory of goods and expanding the store.

loans.name: Sahilah

texts.en: Sahilah lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all the members of her family and she is married. She wants to help her husband support the family. She has good work experience as a tailor and now she is faced with financial difficulty. She wants to take a group loan to buy the materials that she needs to expand her business and make a good life for her family. She is to happy that she can support them with her husband.

loans.use: To buy new materials

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ama A., 34, is mother to eight children who have never been to school because the family lacks the necessary money to send them. Her husband who had been working as a guard at a school has been let go, so she is the sole breadwinner for the family. Mrs. A. was a servant in the family of a close relative for a year before learning how to make ointments (pommades). In spite of the their poverty, the family manages to function normally.

Preparing the ointments demands a good deal of financial input and for this reason, Mrs. A. took out a first loan which she managed to repay in a timely fashion. Now she is asking for another loan, this time $700, so that she can purchase all that is necessary for her purpose (camphor, candles, etc.). This little endeavor is the family's only hope of rising above their miserable situation.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 34 ans, Madame A. Ama est mère de huit (08) enfants qui n’ont pas été scolarisés par manque de moyens. Son mari Gardien au CEG Gapé Centre a été licencié ; ce qui fait qu’elle subvient seule aux besoins de la famille. Elle fut domestique chez un proche parent pendant un an, avant d’être initié à la préparation de pommade salcylées. Malgré la pauvreté de cette famille, l’ambiance y règne normalement.

Cette préparation nécessitant beaucoup de moyens financiers avait poussé Madame A. Ama a bénéficié d’un premier crédit qu’elle a remboursé avant l’échéance. Encore une deuxième fois, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour s’approvisionner de tous les nécessaires (Kanfor, bougies…) pour la préparation ; seul moyen de sortir de la misère.

loans.use: stock up on raw materials for preparing ointments

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is 31 and the single mother of a ten year old son. She worked very hard to earn a professional degree so that she could support herself and her son. For the last four years she has been working as an education administrator for a social services organization. This work often takes her to rural areas where she teaches and does outreach with farmers. Carmen previously lived with her parents but she has worked hard to save enough money to buy a small plot on which to build a home for her son. This, Carmen's third loan with Agrocapital, will pay to finish construction of the home. Carmen has no other debts and repaid her previous loans promptly.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Carmen es una mamá soltera de 31 años de edad, su hijito tiene 10 años. Debido a que ella es el sustento de su familia, se esforzo para alcanzar el grado de técnico medio, actualmente trabaja desde hace cuatro años en un proyecto Solidario de la Sociedad Salesiana MUYURINA, desempeñandose como administradora del programa educativo, su trabajo demanda gran parte de su tiempo ya que tiene que viajar a las zonas rurales para dar asistencia y capacitación a las personas que se dedican a la agricultura. Antes de conseguir ahorrar dinero para comprar un pequeño lote, Carmen vivía con sus papás, peo debido al empeño que puso en su trabajo y al apoyo de su familia logró conseguir construir su casita donde dará un techo seguro a su hijito. La presente solicitud es para finalizar la construcción de su vivienda, debido a que le falto dinero. Carmen actualmente no tiene deudas en otras instituciones y este crédito es el tercero con nuestra Institución, tiempo en el cual demostró tener pagos puntuales y oportunos.

loans.use: To complete construction of a home.

loans.name: Bethy Rossio

texts.es:
Bethy and her enterprising husband make beautiful decorative pieces of clay and plaster. They both work diligently 6 days of the week, putting their creativity and talent into every design. They sell their pieces from a small mobile stand at the fairs in the different cities. They are always accompanied by their daughter Marisol, who is the pride and happiness of their lives.

Bethy wants to increase the quantity of their merchandise and is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase materials and paint used to make their handicrafts, giving them a colorful finish so that they can generate more income for their family. She has committed to repay your generousity by repaying the loan within 6 months.

Bethy and Francisco are waiting for your kind support so that they can continue forward.

Bethy y su emprendedor esposo Francisco, se dedican a realizar hermosos trabajos decorativos a base arcilla y yeso, ambos trabajan diligentemente durante seis días a la semana, poniendo su creatividad y sacando a flote sus talentos en cada diseño, para luego ofrecerlos en su pequeña movilidad los días de feria en las diferentes ciudades de su país acompañados siempre de su querida hija Marisol, quién es el mayor orgullo y alegría de sus vidas. Ella desea acrecentar la cantidad de su mercadería y para esto solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que invertirá en la compra de pintura para moldear sus excelentes trabajos a fin de otorgarles un mejor y vistoso acabado y posteriormente con la venta de estos generar mayor ingreso económico para su familia; así mismo les extiende su compromiso de retornar vuestro generoso aporte en un lapso de siete meses. “Bethy y Francisco esperan tu desinteresado apoyo para salir adelante”

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS AND PAINT FOR THEIR BEAUTIFUL HANDMADE CRAFTS,  SO THEY CAN GIVE THEM A MORE COLORFUL FINISH, SELL MORE OF THEM, AND INCREASE THEIR INCOME.

loans.name: Carlota Samuel

texts.pt:
Carlota Samuel M., holder of ID Card No. 110509343R, single, 32 years of age, living with her spouse and 2 children, is a native of Maputo and resident of the George Dimitrov neighborhood, house number 38, in Maputo. This is her first time in the program. She will start off with a loan of 6,000 MT to be repaid in 4 months. This is her first cycle. She sells essential products in Bobol, a district of Maputo that is about 50 km outside the city. She plans to use the loan to invest in the growth of the business.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlota Samuel M., portadora do BI nº110509343R, Solteira, de 32 anos de Idade vive martalmente e tem 2 filhos natural de Maputo, Residente No Bairro George Dimitrov Casa nº38 em Maputo, primeira vez no progama vai iniciar tomando o valor de 6000 para pagar em 4 meses é o primeiro ciclo ela vende produtos de 1º necessidade e bobol um Distrito de Maputo Fica quaze 50 km da Cidade de Maputo pretende com esse valor aumentar o negocio.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Lupe Edna M. manufactures shoes in the traditional cholita style for a living. She has worked alongside her husband for two years now. Prior to this, she worked at an office as a secretary, but unfortunately had to leave that work once her son was born and because she got married. The art of shoe making was learned from her family, who also taught her husband, and is now what supports her family. Currently they have a workshop at their home equipped with semi-industrial machines that were bought thanks to Pro Mujer. Her main market is in the carnivals and has a few clients who take her merchandise all the way to Perú. The name of Lupe's business is named after her daughter, Duvaly. Lupe needs capital in order to buy bulk raw material since she knows that demand is strong and she has a possibility of exporting a high quality product.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Lupe Edna M., se dedica a la confección de calzados de cholita, trabaja junto a su esposo hace ya dos años. Anteriormente ella trabajaba en una oficina como secretaria, lastimosamente tuvo que dejar ese trabajo por el nacimiento de su hijo y por que se casó. El arte de la confección de los zapatos lo aprendió de su familia, quienes también enseñaron a su esposo y ahora es el sustento de su familia. Actualmente cuentan con un taller que funciona en su domicilio, equipada con maquinaria semi industrial, mismas que compró gracias a Pro Mujer. Su principal mercado se encuentra en las ferias y cuenta con algunos clientes que llevan la mercadería hasta el Perú, el nombre de la empresa de Lupe lleva el nombre de su hija Duvaly. Lupe precisa de capital para poder acceder a la compra de materia prima al por mayor, en vista que la demanda es fuerte y tiene la posibilidad de exportar un producto de calidad.

loans.use: Lupe needs capital in order to buy bulk raw material since she knows that demand is strong and she has a possibility of exporting a high quality product.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Josephine Sebufu. She runs a small retail store and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to buy more stock. Josephine is 30 years old and married to a builder. She has 5 children ranging from age 1 to 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Josephine makes approximately UGX 150.000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Josephine has taken a previous loan of UGX 500,000 from BRAC Uganda to invest in her retail store paid back the loan on time.

Josephine is joined in her small group by Resty Kyomuhangi, Hellen M., Harriet N., and Ruth N.. Resty Kyomuhangi sells matooke (plantains) and is requesting a loan of UGX ,1,000,000 to buy more matooke. Hellen M. rears poultry and runs a tailoring business and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to buy a sewing machine. Harriet N. runs a bar and sells chips and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy a frying pan for making chips. Ruth N. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan of UGX 550,000 to buy more charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her retail store

loans.name: Kabumbi B (Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Irene T.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock. Irene is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a social worker. She has 1 child aged 2.5. Each week, Irene makes approximately UGX 28000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business. Irene has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Irene is joined in her small group by Josephine B., Gladys Nakibuule, Carol N., and Annet N.. Josephine B. has a business selling tie and dye clothes and wants to buy tie and dye material. Gladys Nakibuule is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to purchase more furniture and utensils. Carol N. operates a business of charcoal sales and wants to purchase in bulk. Annet N. is currently in the business of selling fresh food and is requesting a loan to invest in the business.

loans.use: To increase inventory in retail shop business

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is married and has 5 children including 3 who are married and 2 who are single and still live with her and her husband. The younger children are a 19-year old son who works and a 15-year old daughter who is in school. Her husband works as a laborer at Pemex. Faced with the need for an extra income to meet all of the family's bills, she went to work reselling jewelry and shoes that she bought from catalogs. She started about 2 years ago, selling jewelry to her husband's co-workers and relatives, and later added shoes. Because of her hard work, business has been strong. Her son helps her collect money from her customers.

She's asking for your loans in order to pull together US$950, to be repaid in 6 months, for buying jewelry with cash and so be able to offer it more cheaply and to buy shoes for the spring-summer season. With your help, Maria Luisa will continue moving her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María Luisa es casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 están casados y 2 solteros aun viven con ellos. Los menores son un hijo de 19 años que trabaja y su hija de 15 años que estudia. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en Pemex y ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para completar con todos los compromisos de su familia fue que ella se dedico a la venta de joyería y zapatos por catalogo. Inicio hace aproximadamente 2 años vendiendo joyería con los compañeros de su esposo, y familiares, y después añadió la venta de calzado por catalogo. Debido a su esfuerzo le ha ido bien con este negocio, y su hijo le ayuda con la cobranza a sus clientes.

Ella solicita de sus contribuciones para reunir US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir joyería de contado y poder ofrecerla mas económica, y comprar zapatos para esta temporada de primavera-verano. Con tu ayuda Luisa seguirá adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock in bulk

loans.name: Angelino

texts.es:
Angelino lives in the Igachi Community in the Los Andes province, three and a half hours from the city of La Paz. He has a wife and two children, ages 17 and 8. He breeds cattle, whose production is sold to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant). He also works as a bricklayer to increase his monthly income.

He is requesting a loan to invest in fodder and to improve his cultivating fields. This is his first loan from Impro; the results of our evaluation approve of Angelino’s request.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Angelino vive en la Comunidad de Igachi provincia Los Andes a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene una esposa y dos hijos de 17 y 8 años respectivamente, se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción es comercializada a PIL Andina (una Planta Industrializadota de Leche). También trabaja como albañil para incrementar sus ingresos mensuales.

Solicita crédito para invertir en forraje y mejoramiento del terreno de sembradío. Es el primer crédito con Impro, los resultados de nuestra evaluación aprueban la solicitud de Angelino.

loans.use: Purchase fodder and improve his cultivating fields.

loans.name: Falanika

texts.en: Falanika N., 59, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and taamu business. She sells to the public and villagers 2 days per week. She has had 3 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 430 Tala (~179 USD).  SPBD loans are Falanika’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She we also use some of the loan to buy cement and timbers for home repair. She also runs a printing business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 37 years old and is a wife and mother of four children. Mary is a resourceful mother and successful business woman. She works very hard to support her children who are currently in school. She trades towels, sponges and assorted soaps by hawking. She has inadequate working capital to support her business growth. With the loan she will be able to purchase more inventory for more profit. She hopes to save enough income to support her family. Mary belongs to the community group called the St. Pauls Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for one another and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of towels, sponges and assorted soaps.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yenny is 31 years old, single, and lives by herself at a room that she rents. She is an elementary school teacher with lots of desire to move ahead. She works at a school in the city of Juliaca, where she teaches kids from 6 to 12 years old. In addition to her job, she sells natural medicinal products to increase her income, since today the cost of living is increasing. Usually, she teaches in the mornings and sells the natural medicinal products from house to house in the afternoons. In this way, she is busy all day working, which is heartening and dignified. Yenny works tirelessly to forge a better future for herself. The money from the loan will be invested in buying more natural medicinal products. In the future, she wishes to have another type of business like a grocery store or a book store.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Yenny tiene 31 años, es soltera, vive sola en un cuarto que alquila. Es una profesora de educación primaria con muchos ánimos de superación, trabaja en una escuela de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde enseña a niños de 6 a 12 años, además de esto, se dedica a la venta de productos de medicina natural para aumentar su economía, ya que hoy en día el costo de vida va en aumento.Usualmente, enseña por las mañanas y vende productos de medicina natural de forma ambulatoria por las tardes, así se mantiene todo el día ocupada en el trabajo, el cual le resulta alentador y dignificante. Yenny trabaja incansablemente para forjarse un mejor porvenir. El dinero del préstamo será invertido en la compra de más productos de medicina natural, en el futuro, ella desea tener otro tipo de negocio, tal como una tienda de abarrotes o una librería.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of natural medicine products that she sells.

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.en:
T. Dilmurod is 23 years old. He is married and has a young child. For the past 10 years, Dilmurod has been producing sieves in his house. He learned this type of business from his father. Dilmurod became a real expert in his business and has a lot of clients. His wife helps him sell the sieves in the market. Because Dilmurod has many clients and demand for his goods, the business is very successful. The business provides a stable and significant income that allows Dilmurod to improve the living conditions of his family.

Now Hakimjon has orders for producing the sieves. So he is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750) to purchase the raw materials for producing the sieves. With your help, this will be possible. Dilmurod is counting on your help and he expresses his gratitude to everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing materials for production of sieves

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Juana del Socorro C. se dedica desde hace 7 años al negocio de venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde es originaria. Esta dama se ha caracterizado por ser muy esforzada y el motivo por el cual hoy en día acude a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita obtener las verduras para su respectiva comercialización.

Con el crédito obtenido por Ceprodel se beneficia tanto ella como su amada familia a la que tiene que mantener y brindarle su apoyo.
texts.en:
For seven years, Joan del Socorro C. has been in the business of selling vegetables and fruits in the central market in the city of Chinandega (where she is originally from). She has been characterized as very hardworking. She now goes to Ceprodel seeking a loan that allows her to obtain vegetables for her own marketing. With the credit obtained by Ceprodel, her family (whom she must maintain and support) will benefit greatly.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Ana Rita Azuel

texts.pt:
Ana Rita Azuel Chauge is a native of Chibuto, one of the districts of Gaza Province, in the south of Mozambique. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children aged 23, 20 and 17 respectively. She also supports a grandchild who lives with her.

Ana Rita studied through 12th grade and stopped due to issues she preferred not to reveal to our interviewer. Ana Rita has been an employee in the field of education for over 25 years, with a 7 am to 12 pm schedule. She lives in her own home.

This is Ana Rita's second loan with Hluvuku, and she has dreams o requesting a loan in the future to complete the construction and furnishing.

Ana appears in the photo with her grandchild.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Ana Rita Azuel C. é natural de Chibuto um dos distritos da província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 43 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre 23, 20 e 17 anos de idade respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta um neto que vive com ele.

Ana Rita estudou até 12ªclasse e parou pelos problemas de carácter social quais não quis revelar ao nosso entrevistador. Ana Rita é funcionária da educação a mais de 25 anos, com um horário das 7:00h até 12:00h. Vive numa casa própria.

Para Ana Rita este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku, tem sonhos para futuro solicitar um empréstimo para finalizar a sua obra e mobilar.

Ana aparece na foto com a sua filha.

loans.use: Purchase of construction material for her home

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr:
Mécanicien vulcanisateur de profession, Monsieur A. Messan est né en 1969 à Aného. Résidant à Kpémé où il exerce son métier de mécanicien, il est très connu de tous et très sollicité dans la localité. Il est marié et père de trois (03) enfants dont l’avenir lui tient beaucoup à cœur. Aussi tous ses efforts contribuent à subvenir à leurs besoins et à leur assurer un lendemain meilleur.
Mais ses moyens très limités constituent un sérieux handicap à tous ses projets et les crédits sollicités auprès des usuriers l’enfoncent de plus en plus dans la misère.
Pour réhabiliter son atelier et mieux servir ses clients, il sollicite un financement pour équiper son atelier et se ravitailler en pneus très recherchés sur place. Une telle diversification de son activité lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
A tire mechanic by trade, Mr. Messan A. was born in 1969 in Aného. Residing in Kpémé where he practices his trade, he is well-recognized by all and in high demand in town. He is married and the father of three children, whose future he holds dearly to heart. Furthermore, all his efforts go towards providing for their needs and to ensure a better tomorrow for them. But his very limited means is a serious handicap to all of his plans. And the loans gotten from loan-sharks drag him lower and lower into poverty.

To rehabilitate his workshop and to serve his customers better, he is requesting financing to equip his shop and to get resupplied in highly sought-after tires, locally. Such diversification of his business will enable him to increase his income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up his workshop and to sell used tires

loans.name: Sylivia's Group

texts.en:
Sylivia M. is a very friendly person with a salon business called Mama Emmanuel’s Beauty Salon that is doing well since its inception 10 years. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children. In her salon, she makes braids, does weaving, shampoo and set, retouch and all kinds of treatments and this diversification has helped her a lot in her business success.

Through being able to save, Sylivia has been able to buy a plot of land on which she plans to construct commercial houses. She has been able to educate her children and she hopes to take them much further in education. Sylivia plans to use her share of this loan to buy more braids, weave-ons, shampoos, and chemicals for her business.

loans.use: More braids, weave-ons, shampoos and chemicals for re-sale

loans.name: Martha Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Martha Sonia V. H. tiene 36 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa situado en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio hasta segundo grado de secundaria y no continuó estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos. Se unió a su pareja a los 23 años y tienen un hijo de 14 años.
Su negocio consiste en la compra venta de animales menores como ovejas y cerdos, los que compra en carne y lleva a la provincia de Trujillo a vender.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas compró carne más cereal que volvió a vender en Trujillo.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en compra de carne.
Martha sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Martha Sonia V. H. is 36 years old and belongs to the Jesús Nazareno Communal Bank of the Agallpampa district located in the Otuzco province in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the second year of secondary school and did not continue studying due to the lack of economic resources. She joined with her partner when she was 23 and they have a son who is 14 years old. Her business consists of the purchase and sale of small animals like sheep and pigs, which she buys their meat and takes them to the province of Trujillo to sell. With her first loan of 300 soles repaid in 4 installments she bought meat plus cereal that she returned to sell in Trujillo. With this loan of 800 soles which will be repaid in 6 installments she will invest in the purchase of meat. Martha dreams of having her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat for her business.

loans.name: Titi

texts.en: Titi L., 35 years old and married with three children, sells tailoring materials and sews clothes. Her husband is a mechanic. She is requesting the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. Titi says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que trabajan y lo apoyan mucho. Se dedica a vender carne de pollo en un puesto del mercado de su localidad, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 20 años, ganándose la confianza de muchas personas quienes ahora son sus fieles clientes, que acuden a su puesto porque saben que Rosa no les miente ni en el peso, ni en la calidad de su producto. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es satisfacer a sus clientes cortando los trozos de carne según el gusto particular de su cliente, sin cobrarles ningún precio adicional. Además, le es rentable, ya que no hay un día que deje de vender. Para más adelante Rosa quiere mandar a construir un galpón en su casa para criar sus propios pollos y obtenga mayores ganancias. Rosa viene trabajando con MFP, cerca de 6 años, esta es su solicitud de préstamo número 11, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque siempre existe comunicación y en cualquier percance todos colaboran para su solución. Con la cantidad que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de pollos, y una parte del dinero le servirá como capital de inversión para un nuevo negocio que desea emprender con su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old and lives with her husband and their three children who work and support them very much. She sells chicken in a stall in a neighborhood market, which she has been doing for 20 years, earning the trust of many people who now are her loyal customers. They go to her shop because they know that Rosa doesn't lie to them about the weight or quality of her product. What she likes most about her work is satisfying her clients, cutting the meat to the particular tastes of each customer with no extra charge. Additionally, it is profitable for her, and there isn't a single day that she doesn't go to work. In the future Rosa wants to have a shed built at her house where she can raise her own chickens and obtain better profits.

Rosa has worked with MFP for almost 6 years, and this will be her 11th loan. She likes working with her group because there is constant communication and in case of any minor problems, they all work together to find a solution. With the amount that she is requesting she will buy more chickens, and a small part of the money will be used to invest in a new business she wants to start with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Nurinisso

texts.en:
S. Nurinisso is married with 4 children and she lives in Khujand. Nurinisso has been selling men's wear in the local bazaar for 10 years. She brings the assortment from Istarvshn and she sells at lower prices than the bazaar prices because she brings in the assortment for herself.

Nurinisso is applying to KIVA with the request for a business support loan of 1400 STJ for 1 month for importing new seasonal wear that will permit her to increase the business turnover and business terms. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: importing new seasonal wear

loans.name: Ilhomchon

texts.ru: Илхомчон занимается куплей продажей скота на местных рынках. Ему 33 года, имеет 2 детей. Его жена нигде не работает и сидит дома. Илхомчон закупает скот на рынке и если получиться перепродать его то продает. А если не получается то приводит его домой и там неделю за ним смотрит его жена. Затем на следующем рынке он продает скот и получает прибыль. Сейчас цены на скот оптимальные и он собирается немного расширить свой бизнес и подал заявку на займ КИВА.
texts.en:
Ilhomchon purchases and sells livestock at local markets. He is 33 years old and has 2 children. His wife does not have a job and stays at home. Ilhomchon purchases livestock at the market and if he is able to resell it he sells it. If he is not able to resell it he brings it home and there his wife watches after it for a week. Then at the next market he sells the livestock and earns a profit. Right now livestock prices are optimal and he plans to expand his business a little bit and has applied for a loan on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Mariam L. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children, between the ages of 2 and 13. Mariam has been running a drinking water sales business since 2005. Mariam buys drinking water wholesale and sells it retail. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Mariam currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stock of drinking water in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Mariam thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of drinking water in bulk.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A. is a 26-year-old mother of one boy, named Geoffrey. She runs a salon and also sells both ready-made and used clothes, purchased from Busia or Nairobi. She lives in Nyalenda slum and hopes to use the loan to expand her business. The profits will go to support children orphaned by relatives and by neighbors that have passed away. Her main challenges are stiff competition in the market from other clothes-sellers.

Susan likes running her own business because no one restricts her and it gives her freedom. Susan’s hopes that in the future she will be able to grow her business so that she can make enough money to support all her children. She is hoping the government will do something for all the orphans she takes care of.

In this video, you can hear me greet Susan saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Susan responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

K-MET, the NGO distributing the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. To read more about K-MET’s work, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: Clothing Stock

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en: Mrs. Ursulina A. was born in the city Aregúa, is the mother of three older children, and owns a small grocery store that she has operated out of her home for more than seven years. She has been a client of the Fundación Paraguaya since 2007. She used her last loan to purchase merchandise from Argentina. That loan helped her household income and at the same time helped her make small renovations to her home in order to improver her quality of life. She is requesting a new loan for the same purpose.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise from Buenos Aires, Argentina including food and beverage items in general.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila C. is a 64-year-old woman who hails from the beautiful island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is a mother to four. Her husband, Teodoro, is 65 and her partner in business.

Before, she sold charcoal and made baskets but the business was so tedious and consumed so much time, she opted to shift her business into fishing. For her 11th loan, she proposes to borrow 40,000 pesos to purchase a motorboat for fishing. This will be their new business. 

She is hopeful that the business will grow and be sustainable since fishing is one of the staple sources of income in the island village and having a motorboat is an edge over other fishermen.

She dreams of helping her grandson with his school fees, expanding her business and building a more spacious and durable house.

loans.use: To pay for an engine for her fishing boat and other fishing gear

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda P. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45, married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Glenda owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Glenda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 17000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Glenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenda repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Glenda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 53 años, es casada y vive con el menor de sus hijos de 23 años en una casa arrendada. Desde hace más de 3 años se dedica a la venta de diferentes artículos, de acuerdo a la ocasión y época del año, pero preferentemente vende ropa para bebé. Liliana realiza largas caminatas en busca de nueva clientela, para ello, sale todas las mañanas y regresa a su casa por la tarde. De esta manera logra conseguir sus propios ingresos económicos que le sirven para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Liliana está muy contenta por realizar esta actividad, pues le permite estar en plena comunicación con las demás personas de su entorno y para un futuro cercano desea seguir dedicándose al comercio pero establecida en local propio. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella ingresa a su banco comunal debido a la invitación de uno de los miembros, por lo que se compromete ser puntual en los pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando le servirá para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en prendas de vestir para todas las edades, para ello viajará a otra ciudad para abastecerse en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
Liliana is 53 years old. She is married and lives with her youngest child, who is 23, in a leased house. For more than three years, she has been selling different items, depending on the occasion and time of year, but she prefers to sell baby clothing. Liliana goes on long hikes to find new customers, so she leaves her house every morning and comes back in the afternoon. In this way she has been able to earn her own income that allows her to cover her household expenses.

Liliana is happy to be doing this, because it allows her to communicate with the other people in her area, and in the near future she would like to continue selling but in an established store in her own area.

This is the first time that she has had a loan with MFP. She joined her communal bank because of an invitation from one of the members, so she is committed to being punctual with her payments. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy a larger quantity of clothing for all ages. She will travel to another city to stock up on large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 41-year-old married woman with six children, aged between 22 and 9 years. She resides in a rented house. All her children go to school. Margret takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day.

Margret resides and works in a semi-urban area. She incurs extra transport to and from business shopping. She buys charcoal from Kibogo, a rural area, and sells it near her residence. She sells 4 sacks of charcoal a day. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for her family. She has been in this business for the last seven years.

Margret has been with MCDT for eleven years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more charcoal and increase her working assets in preparation for the forthcoming rainy season. Margret is aspiring to see her business grow and build a house for herself.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal stock in preparation for the forthcoming rainy season

loans.name: Res

texts.en:
Res F. (husband shown in picture) is a 27 years old chicken trader. She retails chickens that she buys in bulk at low prices from people who live in her area. She has been in business since 2003.

Her husband drives a motorbike taxi to raise money. This couple has been married for a long time and has one young child who attends school.

Res F. is taking out a loan to buy extra chickens to meet her customer's needs.

loans.use: Buy more chicken to sell.

loans.name: Mr. Hun Em Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of eleven people who live in Preak Ta Ong Ti 1 Village in Kandal Province. Mr. Hun E. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Tum Hoeung, is a weaver. She needs more raw materials to support her business. Thus, Mr. Hun E. has decided to ask for a loan for his wife's business. He is 59 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is a security guard and the other is enrolled in the local school. 

One member of this group loans has an end-of-term (EoT) loan; the rest have monthly payment loans. Borrowers with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term  loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his wife's weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell hair extensions

loans.name: Rona

texts.en: Rona A. is 20 years old and a new member of ASHI.  Her sweet and loving husband Marlon is a former technician and now drives a sidecar motorcycle, known as a tricycle, for hire.  Marlon’s income is the main financial source for the family.  Rona is a housewife and caring mother to her only child who is eight months old.  Aside from taking care of her child, Rona also wants to help contribute to the family income.  Therefore she is requesting a loan in order to buy spare parts to maintain the tricycle in running order.  As much as possible, Rona and Marlon want their passengers to enjoy good quality service.  Someday, Rona would like to purchase another tricycle for the hire business so they can generate more proceeds and improve the standard of living for their family, and to prepare herself financially for the future college education costs of her baby.

loans.use: To puchase spare parts for their hire tricycle.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma R. is from the village of Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Alma is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.
