In 2009, Alma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase spare parts for the motorcycle. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the motocycle

loans.name: Mr. Pon Korng Village Bank Group

texts.en: The twelve people together requesting this village bank loan live in Veal Kandal village in Kandal province.  They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mr. Pon K. is the president of the village bank loan group. He is a construction worker and his wife, Mrs. Touch Van, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice and vegetables. She needs some fertilizer to support the rice field but she does not have enough money. Thus, Mr. Pon K. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the rice field. He is 46 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is a commune assistant while the other stays at home to do housework.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Briceyda Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Briceyda A. se dedica arduamente a laborar como maestra en un colegio ubicado en Managua donde a diario desde muy temprano inicia dando clases a los alumnos destacándose como una buena maestra que vela por el desarrollo intelectual de los estudiantes.

Ella es casada y tiene un hijo en edad escolar al que tiene que mantener y brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Ella tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda y para esto solicita un crédito porque requiere comprar los materiales de construcción para mejorar dichas condiciones. Ella en este momento mejorará las condiciones de un cuarto y baño para que la familia tenga un mejor lugar donde vivir y así contribuir a su desarorrollo.
texts.en:
Briceyda A. is a dedicated teacher at one of Managua's schools. She begins her work day early in the morning teaching her students being notweworthy for the dedication she puts into caring for the intellectual development of her students. She is married and the mother of a school-age son who she must support and provide the conditions necessary for his development. She needs to make some home improvements and requires financing to buy the materials. She plans on this occasion to make improvements on a bedroom and bath so that the family can have a better place to live and thus contribute to their development.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva vive en la Mzno. E, patio 1de la  Zona Rió Seco, viviendas de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes.

La señora se dedica a la fabricación “suerte sin blanca” que son tickets elaborados en cartulina, que en su interior muestran el nombre del premio que el posible cliente gana al comprar un ticket. Estos productos los vende en tiendas, ferias y barrios.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de más mercadería (cartulina y tintas) para preparar sus productos. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con IMPRO;  la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Elva lives in Mzno. E, hall 1, in Rio Seco, in the city of El Alto. She lives in her own home with her husband and their three children who are all independent. She makes color card tickets for a game called “Suerte sin Blanca” (Raffle in which everybody wins a price). The tickets show the name of the price on the inside that the customers may win when they buy them. She sells them in stores, fairs and around the neighborhood. The loan will be used to purchase stationary material (colored cards and ink) to make her products. This is her second loan with Impro. Her successful evaluation qualified her to get it.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase color cards and ink to make tickets

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora D. is from the village of Gulayon. She is 37 years old. Nora is married and has six children. Some of them are students and the youngest is an infant. To make a living, Nora makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Nora has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2005, Nora joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Nora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Nora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family's daily needs and for the education of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Bobojon

texts.ru: Сармисов Бободжон проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сармисов Бободжон имеет медицинское образование. Он торгует более 6 лет на рынке. Бободжон в основном занимается продажей национального вида продукта "Курут". Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Bobojon S. lives in the region of Vose. He is 25 years old. He is married, has two children. His wife is a housewife. Bobojon has medical education. He has been selling on the market for more than six years. Bobojon mainly sells traditional Tajik type of product Kurut. He is taking out a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es: El señor Nelson Enrique S. C. es casado tiene 30 años y vive en el Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla, ellos tienen un negocio de venta d e carne de pollo, cerdo y res, ambos trabajan ahi, ellos tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad el cual es la razon  para buscar el sustento diario, es para poder ofrecerle a su hijo un futuro mejor es que solicitan de este prestamo para la compra de mayor inventario de carne, que ayudara a elevar las ventas y a mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Nelson Enrique is married, 30 years old and lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla district. They have a business selling chicken, pork and beef. They both (he and his wife) work there. They have a 3 year old son which is the reason they are looking for daily sustenance - to be able to offer their son a better future. This is why they are asking for this loan to buy a greater inventory of meat, which will help increase sales and improve the living conditions of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat for the business

loans.name: Bibi Shimen Gull Group

texts.en: A. Habib, the 19-year-old unmarried son of A. S., is the leader of Bibi Shimen Gull group. Part of a large family, he lives in Kabul, Afghanistan where he has been selling a variety of fruit from a cart for more than seven years. Now he wants to expand his business and buy more fruits, especially those that are most in demand. As well, he wants to attract more clients and make a good income for his whole family. A. is happy about the microloan process that can help solve entrepreneurs’ problems.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits for his business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a fashion designer. She also sells tailoring materials. She specializes in making female clothes and has been in this business for 5 years. She is the young mother of one child. She is 27 years old and is married to a commercial driver. Stella hopes to acquire a more sophisticated, industrial sewing machine to boost her business. She also hopes to add the sale of cosmetics to her business. She hopes to have more children and to give them the basic necessities of life. She needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and an industrial sewing machine to boost her fashion business.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more yams and plantains to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. cooks rice to sell at Abura. Ama has been through junior high school.  She is divorced and lives with her two children. Ama has been cooking rice for about two years now. She is solely responsible for the general upkeep of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more rice to cook to be able to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest into her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more rice to cook

loans.name: Ritche

texts.en: Ritche M. is from the village of Poblacion 1 in Clarin, Misamis Occidental and is 34 years old. Ritche is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ritche owns and operates a business operating motor transport services. Ritche has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2006, Ritche joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ritche has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ritche is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Ritche from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase the area of arable land and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en: Dorris is a 32-year-old married lady.  She runs a pharmacy which is six years old. She also sells cosmetics.  She is a member of Shalom group in Faulu Kenya. Since she joined the group, her business has really grown because of her savings with the group, which she uses to boost her business.  She has requested a loan of 75,000 KES to buy more cosmetics and drugs to sell.  Dorris hopes to open several other outlets so as to get more income in the future.

loans.use: To buy drugs and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is married with four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She owns a chicken stall in Kisaasi market in Nakawa Division Kampala District and sells to all categories of people on retail. She wants to use this loan to buy more chickens for resale. She uses public transport to and from buying chickens and buys these chickens from poultry farmers in Namugongo Kyanja, Komamboga and Ntinda. She goes shopping twice a week. Caroline sells broilers and layers locally. She has been in this business for ten years. Her business challenges include transportation and thieves. She is aspiring to see her business grow big and to start rearing chickens herself. Caroline decided to join MCDT because they were giving out timely loans. She resides in and owns a two roomed house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for resale

loans.name: Los Pinos De Carahue Group

texts.es:
The communal bank “Los Pinos de Carahue” is composed of 16 members from the community of Carahue, near the city of Temuco (in the Ninth Region, in southern Chile).  They dedicate themselves to sewing businesses, clothing sales, the sale of cheese, toasted wheat, dried wheat, breads, vegetables, dessert-making, and artisan wood products.
Ruth is the group´s secretary and in the picture she is in the first row second in from the left.  She sells sweets and used clothing from a roofless dismountable stand in the center of the village, and she has been in this business for approximately three years.
With this loan, Ruth will purchase sweets and clothing to sell.  Her dream is to have her own home, she is currently saving, and she is close to reching her goal.  She also wants to grow her business, to have an enclosed post to sell from, which is enclosed from rain, cold, and sun.
Ruth has two children, a son who is 14 and a daughter who is 18 and recently had a baby, making ruth a grandmother.
Ruth has enjoyed working with Fondo Esperanza because her business has given her the support to cover the expenses of her children and herself.
Carahue is located 56 kilometers south of Temuco.  Its name comes from a Mapudungun (the language of the indigenous Mapuche population) word meaning “place of the village”.  There are 25,696 inhabitants in Carahue, over 60% of them living in rural areas.  There is a large Mapuche population in Carahue, and their culture greatly defines the identity of the community.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Los Pinos de Carahue” is composed of 16 members from the community of Carahue, near the city of Temuco (in the Ninth Region, in southern Chile). They dedicate themselves to sewing businesses, clothing sales, the sale of cheese, toasted wheat, dried wheat, breads, vegetables, dessert-making, and artisan wood products. Ruth is the group´s secretary and in the picture she is in the first row second in from the left. She sells sweets and used clothing from a roofless dismountable stand in the center of the village, and she has been in this business for approximately three years. With this loan, Ruth will purchase sweets and clothing to sell. Her dream is to have her own home, she is currently saving, and she is close to reching her goal. She also wants to grow her business, to have an enclosed post to sell from, which is enclosed from rain, cold, and sun. Ruth has two children, a son who is 14 and a daughter who is 18 and recently had a baby, making ruth a grandmother. Ruth has enjoyed working with Fondo Esperanza because her business has given her the support to cover the expenses of her children and herself. Carahue is located 56 kilometers south of Temuco. Its name comes from a Mapudungun (the language of the indigenous Mapuche population) word meaning “place of the village”. There are 25,696 inhabitants in Carahue, over 60% of them living in rural areas. There is a large Mapuche population in Carahue, and their culture greatly defines the identity of the community.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Used clothing and sweets

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin L. is from the village of Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 30 years old and single. To make a living, he owns and operates a service-based business, providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately $150 a month from these activities. He is considered a 'third sex' person and that is why he has long hair and is wearing a woman's blouse.

In 2010, Edwin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his services. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide his services

location.town: Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema G. is a 32-year-old Mitumba (used clothing) dealer in Mtwapa Mombasa. She also supplements her income as a part-time tailor in Mtwapa.
She is married to George Tumaini who supports her income. They have four children. Rehema has been in the business for the past 12 years and now is requesting her first loan from KADET.  She plans to purchase a sewing machine with the loan and use the anticipated profit to educate her children. Rehema hopes to own a school uniform shop and a second-hand shop for a variety of items like furniture.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr. Luis Alfonso R. L. se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos tales como maíz, trigo y otros rubros, cuenta con más de doce años de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para ayudarse en  la compra  de insumos, pago de mano de obra y preparación de tierras  para la siembra de sus cultivos para aumentar los niveles de producción en su finca agropecuario y así mejorar los ingresos de la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Luis Alfonso R. L. works in agriculture, growing basic grains such as corn, wheat and others. He has done this work for more than twelve years. He is currently married. He has had three loans with CEPRODEL, and he has used all of them to help him buy supplies, pay for labor and prepare his fields for planting his crops, in order to increase his production levels on his farm and thus improve the income of his family unit.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Helping him buy planting inputs such as seeds, insecticide, urea, plowing, balanced fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Burulush

texts.en:
Burulush K. is a 53-year-old farmer who lives in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. She has two children who live with her and help in the household. She graduated from Trade College and worked as an accountant. She is known as a purposeful, positive and sociable person. Burulush’s husband is engaged in farming.

Unfortunately, after the breakdown of the Soviet Union, Burulush lost her job. That is why in 1995, Burulush began to engage in stock-breeding using the 20,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) that she had put aside for a rainy day. At that time, she had only two calves. Gaining experience in cattle breeding, Burulush broadened her business and today owns 24 sheep, one milk cow, one calf and one horse. She also began to cultivate a plot of land with potatoes, kidney beans and perennial herbs.  

Burulush is a really hard-working woman. Her striving to provide her children with a better life motivated her to apply for a loan of 60,000 KGS for cattle breeding. She used her loan as intended and repaid it without any delays. 

Now, Burulush has decided to apply for a second loan of 60,000 KGS. She will use it to buy more milk cows. With the revenues, Burulush plans to build a barn for her cattle.

Kiva's field partner Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas. This leads to increased employment and meets the interests of both clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en: Rosenie V. is a married woman who lives in Hda. Maruja, Brgy. 9, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and dealing Avon products. Her husband Constancio V., who is 43 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 2 to 2 years old. Rosenie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosenie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 22,000, which she intends to use to pay for more stock for her general store business so that she can continue to save up for their future and buy home appliances. Rosenie V. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending-team page on Kiva to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine K. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, four of whom are in school.   Christine has a business as a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Christine sells her products in a shop by means of retail.    

Christine has requested  for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of soap, cans of cooking oil, cartons of salt, bags of rice and sugar.  She also generates additional income through selling piped water and a bar.The main business challenge for Christine include the rainy season because the place where she works from is prone to floods and thieves.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own home and business premise and someday owning a whole sale shop.   Christine lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and has  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, cans of cooking oil and boxes of soap

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
El Señor Víctor Manuel T. A.,  inicia su negocio como una herencia con un capital de C$ 20,000.00 producto de ahorros y préstamos para el sustento de su familia.
Este crédito fue utilizado para  compra de productos como cuero y cromo.
El señor T. se siente muy satisfecho y agradecido con los créditos que CEPRODEL le ha brindado ya que ha podido aumentar sus ganancias y ha logrado construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Víctor Manuel T. A. started his tannery business when he inherited it.  He started with $20,000 córdobas of capital -- which came from savings and loans -- in order to support his family.  This loan will be used to buy products like animal hides and chromium.
Mr. T. feels very satisfied and grateful for the loans that CEPRODEL has offered him, as they have made it possible for him to increase his earnings and to build his home.

loans.use: to buy animal hides and chromium

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: Aurelia, de 39 años, está casada con Guzmán, de 38 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos menores. A los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Yaroka. Tiene 17 años dedicándose a la agricultura, “el campo le da todo”, afirma, es por ello que Aurelia desea con muchas ganas seguir trabajando como lo está haciendo hasta hoy. Gracias a Dios, sus sembríos de arveja, papa, gladiolo, maíz y zanahoria, le dan mucha rentabilidad. En época de cosecha su producción es comercializada, en la ciudad de Tarma y Lima, por eso viaja constantemente; pero gracias al apoyo de Guzmán, su familia tiene más ingresos, hasta hace algunos años adquirió un par de carros, con los que realiza trasporte público, en las rutas de Tarma – Palca; la lejanía de los pueblos, le proporcionan a esté oficio una gran rentabilidad. En adelante desea comprar más autos y de esa manera abarcar más poblados lejanos. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y se muestra feliz de trabajar en su banco comunal, ya que le agrada compartir, ideas, experiencias de éxito junto a su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá adquirir semillas de gladiolos y lechuga, ya que en los próximos meses está planeando sembrar y si el dinero le alcanza, también comprará algunos sacos de abono.
texts.en: Aurelia, 39 years old, is married to Guzmán, 38 years old. They have 3 young children together. They care and educate them in their home in the rural area of Taroka. They have been devoted to agriculture for 17 years. They affirm "the fields give us everything". It is for this that Aurelia hopes to continue working as she has done until now. Thanks to God, her harvests of peas, potatoes, gladiolo, corn and carrots give them lots of profit. At harvest time, her production is sold in the cities of Tarma and Lima and for this, she travels constantly. Thanks to the support of Guzmán, her family has more income and bought two cars with which they run public transport between Tarma and Palca. The distance provides a very profitable job. Going forward, they hope to purchase more cars and in this way, cover more communities. This is her third loan with MFP and is happy to work in her communal bank as she loves to share ideas and success stories with her communal bank. With the loan she is requesting, she can buy seeds for gladiolos and lettuce, so that in the coming months she will plant the crops and if the money covers it, also buy some sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: Buy seeds for lettuce and would like to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Doña Concepción, es una señora D. 53 años D. edad, dedicada a la venta D. queso y leche, vive en San Carlos, departamento D. Morazán, su familia está conformada por su esposo don Cristóbal, sus nietos Òscar D. 14 y Gerson D. 9 años D. edad, ella tiene ganado y obtienen D. él leche para preparar los quesos y salir a venderlos, pero por el momento se ha quedado sin dinero para la compra D. alimento para el ganado y solicitan  un préstamo para la compra D. este, ya que al comprar zacate y harina (concentrado) le darán un mejor cuido, para obtener también los productos.
Su propósito es crecer a sus nietos, crecer con su negocio y tener una mejor condición D. vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción is a 53-year-old woman who sells cheese and milk. She lives in San Carlos, in the department of Morazán. Her family is maD. up of her husband Cristóbal and her grandchildren, 14-year-old Òscar and 9-year-old Gerson.
She has cows that she milks to make cheese for sale. At the moment she has found herself without enough money to buy food for her cattle, which is why she is requesting this loan. By purchasing hay and cattle feed, she will better look after them and also obtain better products.
Her goal is to raise her grandchildren, to grow her business and to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of hay and cattle feed

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. María L. es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive por el sector de Las Caleras en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, sus iglesias, su gran variedad en la gastronomía y su gente que conserva su cultura y tradiciones.

Nuestra socia trabaja en su panadería la que tiene hace 20 años, esta actividad la aprendió cuando trabajaba en una panadería desde muy corta edad, su pan elabora de lunes a sábado desde la 1 de la tarde hasta las 5 de la tarde y si se le termina el pan lo elabora en la madrugada.

La Señora. María tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4  hijos de 30, 28, 27 y 25 años de edad, su primer hijo es soltero, trabaja y es quien ayuda  en la economía de la casa, su segunda hija  estudia en la universidad y trabaja para solventar sus gastos, su tercer hijo también estudia en la universidad y su ultima hija es profesional y trabaja como profesora. Su esposo es carpintero y labora en su propio taller, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña María es socia fundadora del banco comunal y le gusta porque son un gran grupo de mujeres que tienen una gran amistad. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de harina, manteca y muchos más materiales que necesita para la elaboración del pan. Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria L. is a member of the Las Caleras loan group. She lives in the Las Caleras neighbourhood in the city of Cuenca, renowned for its beautiful historic center, its churches, its diverse cuisine and its people, who keep their culture and traditions.

Maria has worked at her bakery for the last 20 years. She learnt the job by working at a bakery from a young age. She makes bread Monday to Saturday from 1 pm to 5 pm and, if she runs out of bread, she also makes bread early in the morning. 

Maria is 52 years, married with 4 children aged 30, 28, 27 and 25 years old. The eldest son is single. He works and helps her with household expenses. The second daughter studies at the university and works to cover her expenses. Her third son also studies at the university and the youngest daughter works as a teacher. Her husband is a carpenter and works in his own workshop. With their joint efforts they have managed to build their own home. 

Maria is a founding member of the loan group and she enjoys it because it is a large group of people and they are all friends. She will invest the loan in the purchase of flour, butter and other ingredients needed to make bread. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: Buy flour, butter, eggs, baking powder and other bread making ingredients.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame I. is divorced and has six children. She has received no formal education. Maame sells a variety of soap at Ankaful near Abura, which she has been doing for the past five years. Maame uses her income to pay for school fees, utility bills and other expenses of her children. Maame will use the loan to purchase more soap for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to invest back into the soap sales.

loans.use: To purchase soap for resale.

loans.name: Mercy Marlene

texts.es:
Mercy Marlene C. M. tiene 29 años, vive en Unión Libre con su esposo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Mercy Marlene se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, soya y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien

Le gusta conversar con sus amigos
texts.en:
Mercy Marlene C. M. is 29 years old and lives with her partner in the neighborhood of Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. She has two children.

The members of the V.R.C. Tierra Nuestra (Our Land) meet in the building of San Luís de Zapotal in Ventanas. This group of 14 works in agriculture with fast-growing crops such as corn and rice.

Mercy Marlene works farming corn, cocoa, soy, and rice. She buys her products at Farma-Agro and sells them in the same place. She is asking for a loan to plant corn and rice, to buy fertilizer and seeds. This loan will help support her economically by supplying for her needs. She faces challenges such as plagues and illness and the changing climate. Her dream is that her children may study. She enjoys talking with her friends.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita D. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 51 years old, married and has five children. Two of her children still go to school. To make a living, Teresita plants and harvests rice for sale. Teresita hopes to be able to earn enough money to sustain her children's education, especially now that tuition fees are increasing every year.

Teresita joined Kiva field partner CEVI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting her first loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos, with which she intends to buy farm inputs like seed and fertilizer. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from her enterprise to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jesus Pan De Vida Group

texts.es: “Jesús Pan De Vida”, esta alcancía está conformada por 9 personas muy responsables y tienen un buen tiempo trabajando unidos como grupo siguen integrando nuevas socias ya que les va muy bien en sus respectivos negocios y están felices con el préstamo que les brinda EDAPROSPO. Janet es una nueva integrante de esta alcancía ella tiene 40 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de 17, 15 y 3 años de edad, ella se dedica a realizar trabajos de manualidades como: decoración con globos, pinturas, tejidos de macramé (carteras), teje para vender y también pedidos, además de realizar todas estas actividades Janet trabaja como cocinera en un club campestre pero solo sábados y domingos, los ingresos de todas estas labores le ayudan a cubrir, los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos ella solicitó el préstamo para completar el monto que le falta para  comprar una máQ. para acabados de carteras en cuero. A Janet le gustaría poner un restaurante- café. En la fotografía podemos apreciar  a 8 integrantes del grupo dos de ellos acompañados de sus hijos y la señora María Luz C. López faltó por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en: “Jesús Pan De Vida” (Jesus, Bread of Life Group) is made up of 9 very responsible people who have a good time working together as a group.  They keep involving new members as people see how well their own businesses are going and how happy they are with the loan from EDAPROSPO.  Janet is a new member of this group.  She is 40 years old, is a single mom, and has three children who are 17, 15, and 3 years old.  She works making crafts like balloon decorations, paintings, and woven bags.  She knits things to sell and also takes orders.  In addition to all these activities, Janet works as a cook at a country club on Saturdays and Sundays.  Her earnings from all these jobs help to cover the expenses of the home and of her children.  She is asking for a loan to be able to buy a machine for finishing leather wallets.  Janet would like to open her own restaurant.  The photo is of 8 of the group members with their children.  Mrs. María Luz C. López had to work and could not be present for the picture.

loans.use: To buy a leather-wallet finishing machine

loans.name: Benkadi. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BENKADI sont mariés, avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Tiébiziédougou un des villages de la commune de Kadiolo 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de beurre de karité en générale. 
CHATOU T. compte acheter avec son  prêt  500kg de noix de karité pour les transformer en beurre. Elle s’approvisionne dans le village et dans les villages environnants . Le beurre de karité est  ensuite vendu au  grand marché de Kadiolo ville et au marché de Lofigué à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500FCFA dont une partie est utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre partie pour certaines dépenses familiales et l’épargne.
texts.en: The four members of the Benkadi group are married women who are, on average age, 37 years old with 4 children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Tiébiziédougou, a village in the Kadiolo commune, third administrative region of Mali.  This is their first loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of satisfying  their customers’ needs. Generally, this group of women sell shea butter.  With her loan, CHATOU T. plans to buy 500 kg of shea nuts and turn them into butter.  She gets her supplies in her village and from those nearby.  She sells shea butter for cash at the Kadiolo Lofigué Grand Market and the Lofigué market to a clientele composed of men and women.  She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 32,500 CFA, part of which will be used to pay down principal and interest on the loan and the remainder for various family expenses and savings.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has a mixed farm in Nkubu town in eastern Kenya that produces bananas, milk, coffee, tomatoes and passion fruits that are all sold locally.  He has been in the farming business for eight years now. 

He has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry farm. This loan will enable him to buy chickens, chicken feed and also construct a poultry unit.  The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children.  His primary challenges in this business have been a lack of proper markets for his products, animal diseases and the high cost of animal feeds.

David is 33 years old and married with 2 children ages 2 and 9.

loans.use: To start a poultry farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and swimming costumes

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Georgette works hard to support her family.

She has a water refilling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from room rentals. Georgette is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more water containers for her water-refilling business.

Georgette has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers for her water-refilling business

loans.name: Mukonyezi

texts.en: Mukonyezi B. makes a living by selling produce and spare parts from the Katogo Trading Centre. He is 31 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda with his wife and four children, two of whom are in school. He has been in this line of work for six years and is God fearing, hard working and committed to sell his customers high-quality products. His goal is to increase his sales so he can earn a larger income, and he is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has three children.

In 2003 Hussein opened his own shop selling shoes for women and men. He has five years' experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $2100 loan to make an aluminum door and shelves for his shop. He is aiming to expand his business so he will be able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to make an aluminum door and shelves for his shop.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is from the village of South Cogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Julieta is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk fods, beverages, shampoo, soap & electronic loads in the local community. She is also buying and selling bananas. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional items like canned goods, junk foods & bananas. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, junk foods & bananas.

loans.name: Benkadi Vi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI VI est constitué de femmes mariées du village de NIAZEKAN   région de SÉGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec en moyenne 39 ans et au moins 8 enfants.
Elles font essentiellement de la culture de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans, et avec qui elles sont leur quatrième prêt de campagne, après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents..
AISSA utilisera son prêt pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et d’intrants agricoles  pour la culture, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
AISSA compte réaliser, après l’écoulement de sa production  agricole, un bénéfice 65.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille. Les membres du groupe demande à SORO YIRIWASO  de pérenniser cette activité qui leur permet d’élargir les parcelles cultivables et subvenir à leurs petits besoins.
texts.en:
This BENKADI VI group is made up of married women from the village of NIAZEKAN, SÉGOU region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) They live in extended traditional families and have an average age of 39 and at least eight children. 

They essentially grow peanuts. Intent on making their agricultural ventures profitable, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso four years ago, and they are on their fourth rural (seasonal) loan, after having reimbursed the preceding loans correctly. 

AISSA will use her loan to buy peanut seed, small equipment and agricultural entrants for the growing season at the big market of Kimparana. After the rainy season, the harvest is stockpiled for a certain time so that it is more valuable before being sold at the big market of Kimparana and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele generally coming from the big towns. 

After selling her crops, AISSA expects to make a profit of 65,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and for day-to-day family expenses. The members of the group are asking SORO YIRIWASO to continue this activity that allows them to enlarge their arable plots and cover their minor needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants, seed, and small equipment.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Oñondivepa se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad  de Santaní.
El comité está en el quinto Ciclo con 14  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu de servicio y de responsabilidad con la Fundación.
La Sra Viudina posee una pequeña despensa, por medio del cual puede sostener a su familia, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Solicita el crédito para poder cargar con mas mercaderias su pequeño negocio, ya que es conciente de que si tiene mas variedad de productos, podra atraer mas clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Oñondivepa" consists of a group of neighbors from the community of Santani.

This group is in its 5th loan cycle and has 14 members.  This group stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, cooperative and responsible.  Its members have a great spirit of service and responsibility to the  Fundación.

Viudina has a small store with which she supports her family.  She is a very hardworking and tenacious woman.  She requests this loan to buy more merchandise for her small business, since she knows that if she has a greater variety of products  she will be able to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy groceries, including canned goods, drinks and other products to stock her store

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is married. She is a market vendor from Berdyansk. Tamara sells women’s clothing and footwear in a local marketplace called "Privoz." She started her vending business 17 years ago. Currently, she has 55,000 UAH in turnover capital. Her income amounts to 17,000 UAH a month. 

Tamara is seeking a loan of 20,000 UAH to increase her inventory and purchase assorted clothing and summer footwear items for her female customers. She believes that offering quality products in combination with the best customer service is a wining strategy for both her customers and herself as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Magnoli, tiene 41 años y vive con su esposo y su hijo de 15 años. Ella estará utilizando su préstamo para invertir en más mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes en la cual vende gaseosas y golosinas.  Aparte de su tienda, María también vende gelatina, cancha, yogurt y chupetes en las ferias.  Abrió su tienda hace 20 años junto a su esposo y ya lleva 10 años vendiendo en las ferias.  María se unió a FINCA Perú en el 1988 y lo que más le gusta son los ahorros que le han ayudado a establecer.  Ella también ha aprendido la importancia de ser responsable para superarse como persona.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Magnoli Communal Bank.  She is 41 years old, and she lives with her husband and their 15 year old son.

She will be using the loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store.  She sells soft drinks and sweets there.  Aside from her store, María also sells gelatin, yogurt, and lollipops at the fairgrounds.  

She opened her store with her husband 20 years ago, and she has been selling at the fairs for 10 years.  María joined FINCA Perú in 1988.  What she likes the most are the savings that they have helped her to establish.  She has also learned the importance of being responsible in order to improve as a person.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Elie Yawo

texts.fr:
Elie est un jeune célibataire et sans enfant de 27 ans.

Il est ingénieur de son et pianiste depuis 2010.Pour mieux exercer son travail il sollicite un premier crédit auprès de WAGES pour s’acheter une table de mixage.
 
Il s’approvisionne  dans une boutique de la place (l’établissement Gracelec) et exerce son métier à Anfamé.
texts.en:
Elie is a young 27-year-old man. He is single and has no children. 

He has been working as a sound engineer and pianist since 2010. He gets his supplies in a local shop (Gracelec) and practices his profession in Anfamé.

In order to improve his work performance, he is seeking his first loan from WAGES to purchase a mixing console.

loans.use: to buy a mixing console

loans.name: Cipuncang Indah Group

texts.en: Sutini lives with her husband in Cilincing. She already has two children. In Cilincing, one way to earn a living is by selling clothes by credit. Sutini has run this business since 2010. She enjoys the business, and also helps her husband with the extra income for the family. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She requests a loan of 1,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah to pay for more clothes to sell. She plans to have her own kiosk, and send her children to college. To fulfill this dream, she promised herself to work hard to help her husband financially.

loans.use: to pay for clothes.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella posee un puesto D. comida en su residencia y es muy conocida por todo el lugar ya que prepara diferentes platillos en el desayuno y almuerzo como rellenos, pollo, carnes, sopas y otros, todos muy exquisitos con un sabor inigualable además el lugar D. preparación es muy higiénico y los precios muy accesibles a los clientes; Margot es una mujer muy emprendedora siempre está dispuesta a ganarse el pan D. cada día es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar carnes, embutidos, lácteos, verduras, granos básicos, bebidas y más a fin D. satisfacer el incremento D. la demanda D. los últimos días y no perder oportunidad para hacer venta. Margot tiene la esperanza que D. esta manera con trabajo duro y dedicación le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Margo lives with her partner and her children. She has a small restaurant in her house and is well-known in the whole area because she prepares different foods for breakfast and lunch, such as rellenos, chicken, meats, soups, and other things, all exquisite and with an unmatchable flavor. Also, the prep area is very hygienic and the prices are accessible for the customers. Margot is a very enterprising woman and is always willing to earn her living. This is why she requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy meats, lunch meats, dairy products, vegetables, basic grains, soft drinks, and other things to satisfy the growth in demand of the last few days and not lose the opportunity to make sales. Margo hopes that in this way, and with hard work and dedication, she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy meats, lunch meats, dairy products, vegetables, basic grains, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old and blessed with two children who go to school. She has been running a grocer shop for only one year. She also does livestock farming to generate more income so as to meet her family’s needs. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown financially. 
Elena hopes to grow her business and open other business outlets in the future. She has requested for 9,000 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp for lighting her business and her house.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 26 years old, married with one child. Her primary business is farming. She has been in the business for the past five years.


She was introduced to KADET  LTD by a KADET client.This will be her first loan which she is planning to spend to buy fertilizer, wheat and maize seeds.

She hopes to use the profit to build a permanent house and buy a good car. Her dream is to create a good environment for the family thus a better standard of living. She is an industrious woman who is determined to achieve her set objectives.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, wheat and maize seeds.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie has been operating her retail store for five years and she is glad that her business is improving and growing. She is able to earn about P5,000 a month and uses her profit to pay for her family's electric bills and daily needs. 

Elvie suffers difficulties in her business due to many unpaid purchases on credit from her customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of P20,000 to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, assorted biscuits, noodles, cooking oil etc. for her retail store business. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, assorted biscuits, noodles, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Elvis Axamir

texts.es:
Elvis trabaja en su vehículo como taxista, siendo su fuente de ingreso económico. Con el ciclo del préstamo anterior realizo grandes cambios con beneficios para su familia. Se le ha presentado dificultades de salud ya que para los tiempos de lluvia esta tendente a resfriarse ocasionando gasto de medicamentos y disminuyendo sus horas laborales en el taxi. Actualmente requiere comprar repuestos del automóvil que le está dando problema de movilización. Con el préstamo comprara: llantas, batería, le dará mantenimiento a la direccional y la suspensión. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al crecimiento de su pequeño negocio.
texts.en: Elvis works as a taxi driver with his own car, which is his source of income.  In the previous loan cycle, he made some big changes to his house that benefited his family.  He has had health problems, because during the rainy season he has tended to get colds, requiring him to spend money on medicines and reducing his working hours in the taxi.  Now he needs to buy spare parts for his taxi, because he's having some mechanical problems with it.  With this loan he will buy tires and a battery, and he will have maintenance work done on the suspension and the turn signal.  He thanks the lenders for this support to help him grow his small business.

loans.use: to buy auto parts and pay for maintenance work on his taxi

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores tiene 46 años, es una mujer que lucha por el futuro de sus hijos. Vive en el anexo de Acraquia, junto a Rodrigo, su esposo; ambos tienen 5 hijos. De los cuales solo cuidan a uno de ellos, Leydi, en su casa propia. En la plaza principal del caserío, todas las mañanas encontramos a Dolores, quien prepara los alimentos para luego venderlos a los pobladores que conocedores de su buena sazón, la visitan constantemente. Le va muy bien en su trabajo, tanto así que hace poco comenzó a preparar jugos de diversas frutas y a surtir su tienda, con bebidas, golosinas y demás productos de primera necesidad. Pero como ella es una mujer trabajadora, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ya tiene 3 vacas y 2 becerros, de los que prepara queso pequeño o llamados “bolillos”, que después lo comercializa en la ciudad de Pampas, cuando es día de feria. Ahora desea seguir trabajando con más empeño pues, desea contar con un capital de trabajo sólido, que no le cause dificultades. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Acraquia” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo financiero. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que se caracteriza por ser responsable. Dolores de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles, además de pasto para el alimento de sus animales.
texts.en:
Dolores is 46 years old.  She is a woman who works hard for the future of her children.  She lives in the small village of Acraquia together with her husband Rodrigo.  The couple have five children.  They only care for one of their children, Leydi, in their own home. 

Every morning, in the main square of the village, we find Dolores preparing food which she will then sell to the local people who, aware of the good flavor of this food, visit her all the time.  Her work is going very well, so much so that she recently started preparing different fruit juices and stocking her store with drinks, candies and other basic products.  As she is a hard-working woman, Dolores also raises cattle.  She has three cows and two calves whose milk she uses to prepare small cheeses called 'bolillos' which she then sells in the city of Pampas on market day.  Right now, Dolores would like to continue working harder as she would like to have solid working capital so that she doesn't have problems.  

Dolores belongs to the 'Acraquia' community bank and this is her eighth loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the financial support and pledges to make her repayments on time as she is noted for being responsible.  With your support, Dolores will invest the money she has requested in buying basic products for her food store and also fodder with which to feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store and fodder for her animals

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Enock has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap, sugar, and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Enock has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more soap, sugar, and cooking oil for resale. It will help Enock to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Enock hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Enock is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Enock who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase soap, sugar, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
This is Isabel, 28, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, her business partner, and a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Isabel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Isabel hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sérigne

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il exerce l'activité d'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine. Il achète des bœufs qu'il engraisse et revend au bout de quatre ou six mois. Cette activité génère des revenus consistants avec lesquels il arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite un prêt de 350000f pour acheter deux bœufs .Son ambition est d'acquérir assez de fonds pour élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Sérigne is married and the father of three children. He raises livestocks, notably cattle. He buys oxen that he fattens and resells after four or six months.

This business earns him a consistent income, which enables him to provide for his family. To bolster his business, he's seeking a loan of XOF 350'000 in order to buy two oxen.

He ambitions to have enough capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy two oxen

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BENKADI sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles polygamiques à Ouayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
HABI, la première à gauche fait le commerce de pomme de terre dans ce groupe de femmes BENKADI. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  700 kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Sikasso et effectue sa vente au  grand marché de Sikasso ville et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi group are married women who are on average 32 years old with two children. They live in polygamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their third loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, seeking to meet the needs of their customers.

Habi (first on the left) is the potato trader in this Benkadi group of women. The loan will enable her to purchase 700 kgs of potatoes. She resupplies from villages surrounding Sikasso and sells at the general market in Sikasso and also from her home. Her clientele consists of both men and women, who pay cash.

She envisions average monthly profits of 32,500 FCFA, which will be partly used to pay off the loan and its interests, the remainder being put into savings.

She wants to increase her turnover to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr:
Mme Saye  âgée de 60 ans  est mariée et mère de famille. Elle fait du petit commerce depuis  40 ans.
Elle vend des légumes  dans le marché local. Avec le crédit elle va acheter de l’oseille, de l’oignon, du tamarin.
Elle aide ses enfants dans leurs études et  participe à la dépense quotidienne 
Dans l’avenir  elle aimerait avoir une bonne assise pour  augmenter  ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Saye is a 60 year old married mother. She has been a small-scale retailer for 40 years now.

She sells vegetables at the local market. With the loan, she will buy sorrel, onions, and tamarinds.

She helps her children in their studies and helps cover daily expenses.

In the future, she would like to have a good foundation to increase the goods that she offers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables: sorrel, onions, cassava

loans.name: Patricia Arely

texts.es:
Patricia, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, ya que su clientela y demanda ha aumentado por eso debe comprar más mercadería para brindar un buen servicio, comprará queso, crema, requesón, y los demás productos lácteos que necesita.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo con la inversión del préstamo anterior con la que ha mejorado sus inventarios y las ventas han aumentado.
texts.en:
Patricia has decided to apply for a new loan, since her clientele and demand have increased. That's why she must buy more merchandise, in order to provide a good service. 

She will buy cheese, cream, cottage cheese, and the other dairy products that she needs. She has seen a positive effect from the investment of her previous loan, which allowed her to improve her inventories and increase sales.

loans.use: To buy cheese, cream, and cottage cheese to sell.

loans.name: Maria Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de carne,ella vende carne de cerdo,de res y de oveja,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,ella tiene un puesto en el mercado y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de carne.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is still dedicated to selling meat. She sells pork, beef, and sheep meat. She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. She has a merchant stand in the market and by means of this business, she advances her children. Her dream is to expand her business of selling meat. She requests the loan to buy shoes wholesale. 
She is happy about the loan, and she agrees to comply with the payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Ramona De Jesus

texts.es:
La  Señora Ramona, tiene 65 años de edad, no tiene  hijos a su cargo, cuida dos nietos, es  madre soltera, Su actividad principal es la cría y engorde de cerdos y la elaboración y venta de pan desde hace más de 6 Años, Doña Ramona, esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de concentrado y materia prima para la elaboración de pan y la compra de ropa americana para la venta, sus clientes ha crecido y necesita satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes los que prefieren de sus producto por la buena calidad, y atención brindada a sus clientes ya que Doña Ramona sale a visitar y ofrecerles los productos a sus clientes a los habitantes de su aldea, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia
Doña Ramona sus sueños es  tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos. 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de concentrado y materia prima para la elaboración de pan y la compra de ropa americana para su negocio

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members (grandchildren).

She has a business of rearing chickens, and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more chicken feeds and chicks. She works from home and sells on a retail basis.  She works seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  

She is aspiring to own many chickens and also to educate her children up to university.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses   include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Seruni I Group

texts.en:
The "Seruni" group was newly formed about one year ago. This group was formed because all the women had small businesses and knew each other. They have a common goal to further grow their businesses and improve the welfare of their families. 

There are so many types of businesses from the Seruni group, such as a bridal salon, selling herbs, selling cell phone credit, selling snacks, selling clothes and pillows, selling noodles and farming ducks and chickens.

Siti, as the leader of this group, has a bridal salon. Her husband works as a contractor. Siti has two children who are still in school. With this loan, she wants to buy equipment and bridal makeup. Currently, she rents equipment, but with this loan she won’t have to. So, the price that she charges clients will decrease, making her business more competitive. Her dream is to start a bridal course at her salon. 

This loan from Kiva will help develop the businesses of this group. Siti is very grateful to the lenders of Kiva who have helped all members of the group, even though the lenders don’t even know the members personally.

loans.use: to buy equipment and bridal makeup.

loans.name: Shaktimayee Group

texts.en:
Manjula, age about 25 who is a unique lady in the Sripali village, of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. Manjula has a small family with her Husband and only one son. She has been engaged with herself Rice business at her own home of Sripali village. The concern lady is sitting in the 1st row first person from right hand side in the photo. Also she is an ideal member of her village SHG namely Shaktimayee. Which was perverse in the year 2015 and contains 10 no’s of member under the SHG and they all are engaged with their own professional and business. Manjula is one of them who has taken a great role to play with an object to improve their livelihood and professional life as well as their group members.

Manjula has been engaged with herself with Rice business at her own home of Sripali village since 6 years. Through concerned business she earns a monthly income of Rs.7,800/-. Her opinion is that, through concerned income is not sufficient to maintain her family, with sufficient surplus which total investment in the business and to materialize her dreams. She has to get more and more income by expansion of her business, so she planned to improve her business in the course of loan, which resulting taken the loan & purchased huge quantity of Rice and different types of rice from nearest market post disbursement of loan. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of a house and purchase of any additional household assets.

The other 9 members of her group are also smart at their professional like vegetable vending, milk business, popped rice business, general store and transport business and with this loan, hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: purchased huge quantity of Rice and different types of rice

loans.name: Martha Virginia

texts.en:
Martha is a very hard-working, venturesome and single woman, with 35 years old, these are the reasons by she decided to start her business two years ago. She is working in the elaboration of tortillas in order to increase her revenues and reach a better standard of life for her family.

The tortillas are a part of the Mexican diet and the quality of their elaboration is very important to determinate the acceptation from its consumers. In the Martha’s way, she needs to buy the flour in big quantities to cover all the demand and reach good prices in benefit of better utilities.

For that reason Martha requests a loan for $250 USD to buy her principal input: the corn Flour to assure the supply of this flour in a long time, the term that she requests to pay is of 3-6 months. She needs you help.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Martha es una mujer de 35 años de edad, es soltera, muy trabajadora y emprendedora y es precisamente por eso que hace dos años se decidió a iniciar un negocio de elaboración de tortillas, en busca de poder incrementar sus ingresos y alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida para ella y su familia.

Las tortillas son parte integral de la dieta del mexicano y en su elaboración es muy importante poder contar con materia prima de calidad, ya que esto determina la aceptación de las mismas por parte de los clientes. En el caso de Martha, ella necesita comprar la harina en grandes cantidades, para poder alcanzar buenos precios en beneficio de mejores utilidades.

Debido a lo anterior Martha solicita un préstamo por $250 USD para comprar su principal insumo que es la maseca (Harina de maíz) y tener asegurado el abasto de la misma, el plazo que solicita para pagar es de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: Puy her principal inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Kamran is 57 years old and drives a taxi. He has been in this business for 10 years.
This business is the only source of income for his family.
He used a previous loan of $400 to buy tires and spare parts.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to paint and repair his taxi.
Kamran is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. Kamran, his wife, and 4 children live in the Khirdalan settlement.

loans.use: To paint and repair his taxi

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo A. is 41 years. He has three wives and eleven children. His wives all work in agriculture but they don't earn much. He is a woodworker by trade and currently rents shop space, but high rent leaves him little income to meet his family's needs. Nonetheless, the family is happy. In order to provide for them better, Kodjo would like to outfit a shop of his own and to do so he is asking for a loan of $800 in hopes of saving on rent so his business and family can prosper.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 41 ans, Monsieur A. Kodjo est marié à trois femmes et est père de onze (11) enfants. Les femmes sont toutes cultivatrices à faible revenu. Menuisier de profession les frais de loyer de l’atelier lui reviennent très chers. Ce qui fait qu’après le paiement du loyer le reste de son revenu ne lui permet pas de satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Mais cette situation n’empêche pas l’ambiance dans la famille. Pour remédier à sa désastreuse situation économique, il a décidé de construire son propre atelier. Faute de moyens, Il vient solliciter un crédit de $800. Ce qui lui permettra d’éviter les frais de loyer et de faire face aux besoins de la famille pour son épanouissement.

loans.use: To set up a woodworking shop.

loans.name: Senara

texts.en: Senara P. is currently 30 years old, and has four children. She is experienced in making pork buns, a skill she learned from her mother. She decided to turn her expertise to a business, and used her first loan to purchase the necessary ingredients. In addition, she is also making ice-cakes. Senara is currently working extremely hard, because she believes that if she does not, she will not be able to earn a profit. She is extremely grateful for the program, and would like an additional loan to improve not only her business but also her home.

loans.use: Provide the needed ingredients for the business.

loans.name: Elvia Maria

texts.es:
Mrs.Elvia María is a 69 years old lady from Centro Poblado Menor D. Monchacap . She currently divides her residence between Trujillo and Monchacap. Her 3 adult children do not live with her.

Up until her husbands´ illness, Mrs.Maria used to take care of the house and helped in the family vegetable garden. Since her husband could not work anymore she started travelling to the market in Trujillo to sell the produce from their plot of land. In Trujillo she saw the opportunity to purchase 200 chicks to raise back home to increase the family income. A niece suggested she join the Communal Bank “Las Lomas II” to help her obtain a $100 loan to purchase chicken feed. Three months later she sold all the chickens.

Mrs. Maria dedided this was a profitable business venture and moved to Trujillo to dedicate herself fulltime to raising chickens. However, she must travel to Monchacap weekly to help a family member with a plot of land. She brings back to the Trujillo market the harvests and brings chickens and clothing back to her home town to sell. Currently she has 400 chicks and 50 chickens ready to sell. The $567 loan she received from Manuela Ramos will be payed back in four installments. The money will be used to purchase chicken feed which will get them ready to sell in time for the New Year´s Eve family celebrations.

Mrs. Maria dreams of having a larger plot of land which will allow her to increase the production of chicks. She would like to save up enough money to lead a worry free life when she is no longer able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.
