La señora Elvia María tiene 69 años D. edad, es natural del Centro Poblado Menor D. Monchacap del Distrito D. Otuzco D. la Provincia del mismo nombre en el Departamento D. La Libertad, actualmente pasa un tiempo en Trujillo y otro en Monchacap. Tiene sólo 3 hijos, todos adultos y viven fuera. La señora Elvia se dedicaba sólo a las tareas D. su casa y a ayudar a su esposo en la chacra pero debido a que él cae con una enfermedad delicada, la que le impiD. trabajar, la señora asume sola el negocio, empieza por traer la cosecha a vender a los mercados D. Trujillo pero como tenía que permanecer más tiempo en Trujillo por acompañar a su esposo busca que hacer para entretenerse y empieza a criar pollitos, cuando compró su primer lote D. 200 pollitos le faltó dinero para la compra del alimento, ahí acepta la invitación D. su sobrina e ingresa al Banco Comunal “Las Lomas II”. Con el primer crédito que recibió D. S/.300.00 soles ($ 100 aprox.) compró alimento para los pollitos, después D. tres meses sacó a la venta este primer lote y como le fue muy bien decidió dedicarse a esta actividad así que se trasladó a vivir a Trujillo pero todas las semanas viaja a Monchacap porque allí tiene tierras que han sido sembradas por un pariente, lo que cosecha también lo trae a vender a Trujillo, además lleva pollos y otros productos como ropa y frazadas, a vender en Monchacap. Actualmente tiene 400 pollitos pequeños y otros 50 que ya están para venderlos. Con el reciente préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.1,700 ($ 567 aprox.), el mismo que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará alimento para los pollitos, los que estarán listos para vender en las fiestas D. fin D. año. La señora Elvia sueña con tener un terreno más amplio que le permita criar mayor cantidad D. pollo y con tener un buen ahorro para descasar sin preocupaciones cuando ya no pueda trabajar.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Ny (aged 52) got married in 1980 and has five children: three sons and two daughters. She runs a business weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1966 and began her silk production in that year. However, during the years of rule by the Khmer Rouge regime, her family fled to live in other provinces and she stopped her weaving work. She restarted silk production in 1979.

Mrs K. also buys and resells silk products which she buys from villagers in the community. Her two youngest children weave silk at home with her. The other three work in different businesses. Her husband is a farmer, growing papaya, gourd and eggplant in the village.

Mrs K. has borrowed money from MAXIMA thrice. She is now requesting a $100 loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 30 years old and married with two children. Her main business is selling dried fish in an open air market of Kabala in Sierra Leone.  Musu usually buys fish from the coastal areas and transports them to Kabala. She has been very successful over the years in her fish business but still needs additional capital to purchase larger quantities of fish. By buying in bulk, she can cut down on the number of trips she has to make from the coast to Kabala, which will reduce her transportation costs and help earn more profits. She says that a loan of $600 will make her dreams come true.

loans.use: Fulfill her dreams of earning an adequate income by purchasing additional quantities of dried fish to sell in Kabala.

loans.name: Nabweru North C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Yudaya N.. She is currently in the business of making and selling snacks and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her business. Yudaya is 41 years old and is a widow. She has 9 children ranging from age 2 to 18 and all her children go to school. Each week, Yudaya makes approximately UGX 50,000 in profit and combined with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to increase the volume of her business and begin supplying to schools.

Yudaya is joined in her small group by Sumayiya N., Sarah N., Cathy N., and Sarah N.. Sumayiya N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to increase her stock.

Sarah N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 120,000 to purchase more shop items.

Cathy N. is currently in the business of running a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy more salon equipment like oils and weaves.

Sarah N. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to buy more cloth materials and also another sewing machine.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of snacks

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa  is 30 years old and is married with two children, ages 9 and 2 years. She and her husband also take care of two other children, ages 9 and 2 years old. Hawa owns a small food vendor store and also sells clothes.  She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Mrs. Chayo, as she is affectionately called, has been a seamstress for over 20 years. Today she offers her services to the schools to make school uniforms, and therefore has good seasonal work.

The loan she is seeking for US$750, which will be repaid in 4 months, is to purchase another sewing machine to build her shop and not have to leave her home to go to work. With your help Chayo will be able to continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Chayo como cariñosamente la llaman se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a ser modista, actualmente ofrece sus servicios en las escuelas para la fabricación de uniformes, y así tener muy buenas temporadas de trabajo,

El crédito que nos esta solicitando es por US $750 que pagara a 4 meses ya que desea comprar otra maquina de coser, para ir formando su taller de costura. y así no tener que salir a trabajar fuera de su casa. Con tu ayuda Doña Chayo podrá seguir desarrollándose.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Nji Richard

texts.en:
Born in 1949, Ade Pa Richard is married and has three children, two of who are below the age of fifteen years. Due to poverty and the untimely death of his father, he was unable to continue his education. His widowed mother was unable to help him and his younger siblings. She could not raise enough money to educate the children, take care of their hospital bills, or to provide for the basic household needs like salt and magi (a seasoning cube used every day in Cameroon).

As a young boy, Richard decided to start the business of buying and selling petrol. When he got married, he was very eager to add to his business capital by starting a business weaving bags. He decided to become a member of GHAPE in 2002, where he was trained in business and marketing techniques, So far he has obtained and successfully repaid four loans from GHAPE.

Given a loan, he plans to continue his petrol business and buy materials for the weaving of bags. He is convinced that his business is going to be successful because he has experience and a lot of customers. He plans to repay the loan in 24 months. The first installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of fibers, colors and petrol

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny belongs to the “Unión II” comunal bank.

Marleny is married, is 25 years old, and has one child. She sells telephone cards as a street vendor on a well-situated street in the city of Ayacucho. She works from very early in the morning until very late at night, making sales as she walks. She sells all types of telephone cards.

Marleny needs a loan of 1,000.00 soles, which she will use to buy phone cards of several brands.

Marleny dreams of having economic stability, of establishing her business in a store space, and that her son will have a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marleny pertenece al Banco Comunal Unión II.

Marleny es casada, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Marleny vende tarjetas telefónicas de manera ambulatoria en un calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza desde muy temprano hasta altas horas de la noche, sus ventas los realiza caminando, actualmente vende todos los tipos de tarjetas.

Marleny necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tarjetas de diferentes marcas.

Marleny sueña con tener una estabilidad económica, establecer su negocio en un local y que su hijo tenga una buena educación.

loans.use: Marleny needs a loan of 1,000.00 soles to buy telephone cards of several different brands.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria E. is 45 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. Gloria sells unisex clothing to the people of her community. Gloria learned the business in 6 months. She started her own business in 2007.

She needs a loan of $875 USD to buy more unisex clothes to meet the demands of her customers. She is a LAPO client. She expresses her gratitude to all

.

loans.use: To buy more unisex clothes to sell

loans.name: Alba Lidia

texts.es:
Alba Lidia would like a loan to buy material to build a porch. She has worked in the school Deyling Olivas Betancurth for 22 years. She has 3 kids; the eldest studies in the university URACCAN and her husband is a builder and he helps her with the family's expenses. Alba is a responsible, honest teacher and a good mother. Her dream is for better conditions in her home, for health and for work stability. We ask you to approve this loan for the required amount as she has demonstrated herself to be an excellent client who has always paid on time.

Translated by Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Alba Lidia está solicitando su financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de materiales para construir un porche, trabaja en el colegio Deyling Olivas Betancurth desde hace 22 años, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de 20 años estudia en la universidad URACCAN; su esposo trabaja como albañil y le ayuda con los gastos familiares, doña Alba es una docente responsable, honesta, buena madre y maestra, su sueño es tener mejores condiciones en su hogar, salud y estabilidad laboral, solicitamos se le apruebe el monto requerido ya ha demostrado ser excelente cliente y con voluntad de pago.

loans.use: To buy material to build a porch/Compra de materiales para construcción de porche

loans.name: Custom Embroidered Clothes Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji is the wife of M. Sharif and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. She has been living in this city since her childhood. She is the mother of four sons. Her elder son is a driver and drives a local bus. The next eldest to him works in a factory. The younger to him is in 10th standard (grade). Her younger son is in the 9th standard. Naziran baji's husband is a worker in a school. Naziran baji is a housewife but she also makes embroidered clothes and sells them in market. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (clothes, colored thread, and patterns) to make more embroidered clothes to earn good profit. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Khairan baji wants a loan to buy motorbike spare parts. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy more video games for her video game shop. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy more cigarettes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material to make embroidered clothes

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en: Oluwakemi O. sells provisions and has been in this business for the past eight years. She sells at retail to her customers. Oluwakemi is 35 years old and married to Mr. O.. They have four children. Oluwakemi needs the loan amount of $850 to purchase more provisions in bulk. This, she said, would enable her to meet the demands of her numerous customers and, thereby, increase her profit, which will enable her to take better care of her family. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more provision for sale

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao S. was born in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker who makes a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Mok Samey, is a housewife. 

Although they have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions and in an old house. Now, their house needs to be repaired, so Mr. Mao S. has decided to ask for a loan to fix their house. 

Mr. Mao S. is 46 years old and the father of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The four middle children attend the local school. The youngest is just one year old.

His wife appears on his left in the photo.

loans.use: To fix their house.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca S. is a caterer by profession. She has been selling cake and other pastries, along with maize and other foodstuffs, at Adakope near Shama since 1997. She buys maize in large quantities, re-dries it so that it does not get moldy, and then repackages it in sacks for resale.

A widow with two children, Rebecca has received a junior high education. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and the family's utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to increase her food sales and to ease her transportation costs. Rebecca hopes to save the new profits from her business towards getting a warehouse for her goods.

loans.use: To increase her food sales

loans.name: Francesca

texts.en: Francesca D. is a thirty-two-year-old married mother of six children. Fortunately, four of them are currently in school. She is very dedicated to her work and to her child. By her own effort and hard work through her business, Francesca has supported her daughter to finish junior high school. She owns and operates a clothing and cosmetics shop in the local market of Obuasi where she lives. She believes she can grow her business through a Kiva loan; she plans to use the loan to buy more clothing materials and assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. She believes this will help her to send her daughter to senior high school next year. She belongs to the community group called All Nations Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral for the loan loan. She does not sell on group meeting days, and her picture was taken during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and assorted cosmetics

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Dần 59 tuổi chồng chị mất sớm vì thế chị đã phải làm việc rất vất vả để nuôi 3 con khôn lớn. Năm 1998 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư voà chăn nuôi và làm bánh đa. Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, bán bánh đa chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của các con đã trưởng thành nên cuộc sống đã được cải thiện hơn.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua thêm một số nguyên liệu về sản xuất bánh đa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi D. is 59 years old. Her husband died early so she has to work hard to grow up the three children. In 1998, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in raising livestock and making rice dried pancakes. Currently, in addition to incomes from raising livestock and making rice dried pancakes, she also receives financial support of the grown-up children, so the quality of live has improved.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy additional supplies for making rice dried pancakes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy additional supplies for making rice dried pancakes.

loans.name: Ermida

texts.es:
La señora Ermida  L. S. tiene 40 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa de la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo económico de su familia.
A los 25 años se casó y tiene 2 hijos a quienes educa con mucha ilusión.
Su negocio consiste en compra de reses en la provincia de Julcán y las vuelve a vender en pie.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, invirtió en una res.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en una res.
Su máximo sueño es tener un capital propio para trabajar sola.
texts.en:
Ermida L. S. is 40 years old and belongs to the Community Bank of Jesus of Nazareth in the Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, La Libertad state, Peru. She completed a high school education but did not continue her studies to due a lack of financial support from her family. At 25 years old, she married and then had 2 chidren who were brought up with a lot of hope. Her business puchases beef from the Julcan province and then she travels around selling it. With her first loan of 300 soles, paid in 4 payments, she invested in a cow. With this loan of 1000 soles, to be paid in 6 payments, she will invest in another cow. Her highest dream is to have enough capital of her own to work alone.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle for her business

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna I. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and the mother of two children, a boy and a girl. She says her son is in the in the basic school while her daughter is in junior high school. Mamuna’s husband owns a corn mill in their community. He has hired workers who run the business daily. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Mamuna trades in footwear, textiles, jewelry and other fashion accessories. She procures a variety of these goods from Accra and other cities. She says she learnt this business from her aged mother. She sells in the local market and also treks to nearby towns to sell. Mamuna has been running this business for about twenty-five years and is endowed with rich experience. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more goods. It is Mamuna’s desire to help her husband give their children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy textiles, footwear, jewelry, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba S. is a medical nurse by professional background but the nurses' salary is too low to ensure her family live as required, so Matluba trades at a weekend bazaar with pantyhose, tights and socks. She has been trading for 10 years and she is skilled in the trade business. Matluba goes to Istaravshan for her assortment of goods and she buys her assortment 2-3 times per month.

Matluba has applied to Kiva with the request of a business support loan of 600 STJ for 4 months for importing the new seasonal assortment. Matluba thanks Kiva for its support and small business development.

loans.use: For importing the new seasonal assortment.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married and has one child. He lives in Belo, Cameroon, where he has his small retail store selling various food items. His business is located in the Belo Market, where most of the retail businesses exist in Belo. With this loan, Emmanuel plans to purchase two bags of rice, ten rolls of cigas (cigarettes, 20 packets in each roll), some biscuits and loaves of bread. 

Despite his business being in a competitive market and being so small, Emmanuel believes in his ability to continue his businesses success. He has experience selling his items in this busy market and knows that he has a good customer base. Supplying his community not only provides them with the items they need, but does so at a lower cost, because otherwise they may have to travel farther and pay more in transportation. 

This is Emmanuel's second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. His first loan was used for buying items for his store and he has been profitable with this strategy. With the profits from his last loan he was able to buy a new zinc roof for his house. The profits from this loan will go towards paying his child’s school fees as well as supporting other members of his family. Emmanuel takes out GHAPE loans because he gets his loan before he starts to repay it and because of the education they provide on poverty alleviation. 
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase rice, cigas (cigarettes), biscuits and bread

loans.name: Apaula

texts.en: Apaula A., 45, is married and has 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the public and villagers 5 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 270 Samoan Tala (~ 95 USD).  SPBD loans are Apaula’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan towards buying tools for her business and fees related to her childrens' schooling.

loans.use: Purchase kines, chemicals, school fees, school uniforms.

loans.name: Edina Katyega

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Edina K. from Mbeya. She is married with three children between the ages of 14 and 24. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan. Edina has been running a crops business since 1996, purchasing and selling crops. She works at the business for 9 -12 hours per day, six days per week, currently earning about $80 a month. Edina is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Edina thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia C. is from the town of Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old and widowed with three adult children. To make a living, Julia owns and operates a snack-vending business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Julia has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Julia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Julia is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Julia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita J. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Florita is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Florita owns & operates a "sari-sari" or general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Florita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Florita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell to expand the product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Florita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima T. has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. She uses her income solely for her personal needs and those of her dependents.

Jemima is a food vendor who sells banku (corn dough served with hot pepper or soup) and rice recipes in Kpando, which she has done since 2005. Jemima will use the loan to purchase more of the ingredients for the banku she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredient for her banku

loans.name: Dario

texts.en: Dario P. is from the city of San Antonio, Ozamiz City. He is 56 years old, is married and has three adult children. Dario owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Dario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Dario is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Sari-sari store (community-based store) is the business managed by Lerma in her village.  She has been engaged in this business for 20 years and she can see its improvements.  However, it still needs further development to meet the growing needs of their family, especially their children.  

Thus, she wanted to avail a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000 as additional business capital.  She will use the loan to buy more stock for her store.  

Lerma is a resident of Barangay San Antonio, Jones, Isabela. She is happily married to Vilmar R. and they are grateful to have their two children: Vily - 19 years old and Villamark - 15 years old. Both are presently studying. She hopes to maintain their good family bonding and their successful business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes P. is from the village of Napurog, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Lourdes is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling poultry products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kean

texts.en: Kean I, 40, lives in the province of Pursat, Cambodia, where she owns and works a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She can plant her crops twice a year, a trade she was taught by her grandfather. She is currently good mother to her three teenaged children. The first child helps her on the farm, the second child is a fisherman, while the last one attends school. She is married to Choeun Chin, age 41, a domestic fisherman and rice farmer. Kean I will be using her loan to pay for the cost of plowing her farmland and to buy fertilizer for her crop yield. She and her husband are shown in the picture at their field.

loans.use: To pay the cost of plowing her farmland and to buy fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en: N. Sergelen lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Mongolia's capital city of Ulaanbaatar. Sergelen's relatives currently own and operate a company that manufactures covers for gers. His wife works at the company as a seamstress, sewing the covers. Sergelen operates a ger cover selling business at Narantuul, the largest market in UB. He purchases the covers from his family's company and sells them out of a small workspace at the market.. Sergelen started his ger cover business in 2002 and has been successful. Due to the high traffic of the market and his ability to cheaply purchase ger covers from his relative's business, his earnings have been high. For the future, he hopes to one day start his own factory where he can produce his own ger covers to sell. He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~1760 USD) loan to purchase a car to use for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use for his business

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa Argentina C. de 48 años de edad, su negocio es la elaboración de cosa de horno, las famosas rosquillas que desde joven hace ya que era como se ganaba la vida su mama, y ahí aprendió ya que ayudaba a preparar las ricas rosquillas, ella lleva varios ciclos en Afodenic el cual ha invertido en materia prima como en mejora a su vivienda, vive en Sabana Grande, como objetivo es mejorar su vivienda, con este crédito reparara el horno en donde prepara los hornados ya que   tiene que darle mantenimiento ya que día por medio horna. El cual entrega  a sus clientes como la venta ambulantes  de las rosquilla.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Argentina C. is 48 years old and her business is in baked goods, producing the famous rosquillas (donuts which are the specialty baked good in Nicaragua). She’s been baking them since her youth, as this was how her mother earned her living. She has had several loans with Afodenic which she’s invested in prime materials for home improvements. She lives in Sabana Grande and her goal is to continue to improve her home. With this loan she will repair the oven in which she bakes her rosquillas, which she delivers to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to repair her oven

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a Palestinian man living in Bethlehem. He is married with three young daughters. Adel is a sports teacher in a private school in Bethlehem and his wife works in a private school.

Adel estabilished his shop three years ago to have a better income for the family. At his shop he sells all sporting clothes: tracksuits, pants, shorts, tennis shoes, walking shoes and balls. He opens his shop after finishing his work at the school as the area where he opens his shop gets busy in the afternoons. He also opens it all day long on the weekends.

Adel requested 1,500 USD to buy new products for his shop. He appears in the photo at his shop.

loans.use: To purchase new products for his shop

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: Zenabu is a 56-year-old married mother of eight children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities. Zenabu is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey, a local food from corn dough. She prepares the food in her house and sells at the local market in her community. Zenabu buys the raw materials from nearby communities. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: To earn a living, Mary sells frozen foods like turkey, chicken and fish at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is 37 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is an estate surveyor. She has been in business for 2 years. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Fiaola

texts.en:
Fiaola S. is 41 and married with 5 children (ages 3 - 16).  She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  Fiaola has many years of experience in this business.  Fiaola needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Fiaola iss requesting an additional loan to expand her business as an ongoing activity to improve her family and support her children in terms of school fees.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Fiaola's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

You can view Fiaola's previous loan on Kiva at:  http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=93494

The following social metrics for Fiaola are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:               1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies such as flour, butter, sugar, yeast and firewood

loans.name: Sairanbibi

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages never defeat Sairanbibi, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Sairanbibi is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 45 years old, a widow and the loving mother of two children. For more than five years, she has operated a store where she sells women’s clothes and shoes. Her store is well known and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful. Sairanbibi hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her two children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. For this purpose, Sairanbibi requests $1500 USD. She promises to repay the loan with accuracy in the same manner as she did with the previous one. Sairanbibi is counting on your help. Be an important of the growth of Sairanbibi’s business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann J. is from the village of Centro 1. She is 44 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Mary Ann owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Mary Ann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda, de 65 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y es madre de 4 hijos. Actualmente vive con 2 de ellos y su esposo, su casa es de material noble y de dos pisos.

Hace dos años su hija instaló una farmacia en el primer piso de su vivienda, entonces Florinda optó por comprar una  vitrina donde exhibe su stock de productos de belleza. A su vez, diariamente camina en busca de clientes y visita a sus amistades para ofrecer sus productos y recolectar los pedidos mensuales, mientras que su hija la ayuda vendiendo sus productos en la farmacia. Es por ello que se siente muy satisfecha, pues le gusta su negocio, ya que desde su infancia se dedicó al comercio. Ahora con estas ganancias ayuda a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar y las necesidades de sus hijos. Por otro lado, la venta de cosméticos le parece muy rentable, además está pensado en vender adornos de cerámica, los cuales son muy demandados por sus bonitos diseños, con los que captará mayores ganancias.

Es por ello que solicita un segundo crédito con MFP, para el crecimiento de su negocio. En tanto, hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que le gustaría seguir trabajando con posteriores créditos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de sus productos de belleza y la compra de adornos de cerámica.
texts.en:
Florinda is 65 years old and married. She is a hard-working mother of four. Currently she lives with two of her children and her husband. She has a well-built two-story house. Two years ago her daughter started a pharmacy in the first floor of the house. So Florinda decided to buy a display case where she could sell her beauty products. She also sells her products door-to-door and visiting her friends to sell her products and collect monthly orders. Her daughter also helps her buy selling products out of the pharmacy. She feels very satisfied and likes her business, since she has worked in commerce since she was a child. With her profits she helps her husband pay the household costs and fulfill the needs of her children. Cosmetic sales is a profitable business. She is also thinking of selling ceramic ornaments, which are in demand because of their beautiful designs, because this products would bring her even higher profits. She is applying for a loan with MFP to grow her business. She is dedicating to making her payments on time just like she has with previous loans. She will use this loan money to buy more beauty products and ceramic ornaments.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Sumail

texts.pt:
Sumail J. nasceu na localidade de Nacussa, Província de Cabo delgado, norte de Moçambique tem 40 anos de idade casado e pai de 1 filho de 5 anos de idade ainda não começou a frequentar escola. Frequenta 7ą classe, não foi possível continuar na altura devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Cabo Delgado para o Distrito de Boane na Província de Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 4 anos, não possui nenhum empregado mas conta com ajuda da sua esposa. Vende camas de madeira e mesinhas cabeceiras, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum mensalmente na sua conta bancária (Millenium Bim).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que já são clientes desta Instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (camas de madeira, mesinhas de cabeceira e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt e 11.500.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o presente empréstimo para poder aceder outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais crédito para introduzir a venda de colchões no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Sumail J. was born in Nacussa, in the province of Cabo Delgado in the north of Mozambique. He is 40 years old, married, and is the father of a five-year-old son who does not yet attend school. Sumail only studied through 7th grade and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and isn't responsible for supporting anyone else financially. Sumail left Cabo Delgado for the district of Boane in search of better living conditions. He has had his own business for more than 4 years and has no other employees, though he is helped by his wife. He sells wooden beds and nightstands, and his monthly earnings come to around 7000.00 Meticales. He uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some money each month in his bank account (with Millenium Bim). Sumail has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through neighbors who were already working with the institution. This is his 3rd loan, for the amount of 20,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy products (wooden beds, nightstands and other items) in order to increase his merchandise. His earlier loans were for 6000.00 Meticales and 11,500.00 Meticales, and both were used for the same purpose. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to begin selling mattresses in his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beds, nightstands, and other products

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 40 years old, married with 4 children. She owns a grocery store where she sells groceries and drinks. Her husband also works to support their household. She is a LAPO client. Helen says her expectations are to grow her business and to be able to provide her children with the basic needs of life. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says a big thank-you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to  sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ice fish in cartons to sell

loans.name: Padmini

texts.en:
Padmini is a 45-year-old married woman living in Hikkaduwa, Galle, with her son and husband. Padmini and her husband  have been managing a business together, which consists of cultivating vegetables. They devote their full effort towards cultivating their vegetable farm.  They use the income to help support the family and their son's necessities. Padmini has managed her business for five years now.  The weather in her area is particularly good for vegetable cultivation.  

Padmini has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to pay labor costs and to purchase seed, and chemicals to promote the fertility of her vegetable farm.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and seed for farming

loans.name: Mani's Group

texts.en:
Mani is a 44 year old working woman who lives in the city of Vehari, in Pakistan. She operates a business selling bedsheets. Her bedsheets business is famous in her neighborhood because of the good quality and cheap rates. She has been doing this work for the past 5 years. She does this work to improve the financial condition of her family. Her husband is also a very hardworking person. He is involved in the same business of bedsheets. He deals outside of the community. Their earnings are not much, but they meet the financial expenses of their home. 

They have big family to support and their current income doesn’t allow them to provide good facilities in addition to the education of their children. They are applying for a loan for the second time from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and partner of Kiva) to invest more capital into their business so that they may increase their income and enroll their kids in school.

loans.use: To invest capital towards increasing their bedsheets sales business.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora P. Montiel es  una señora de 23 años de edad la cual vive con su abuelita en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Aurora se ha destacado por ser siempre una  joven muy emprendedora.  Desde hace algunos años inicio su propio negocio una pulpería (tiendita de abarrotes) para vender productos básicos a sus vecinos en su propia casa; con este negocio ha logrado tener  una actividad económica rentable que la ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida y mantener a su abuela quien a sido su madre y padre toda la vida.

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢654.000(seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro  mil colones) para comprar los materiales necesarios para ampliar su local y así poderle brindar una mejor atención  a sus clientes. Ella comenta que el servicio que ella brinda es muy importante ya que tienen muchos clientes y por eso necesita más espacio.
texts.en:
Aurora P. Montiel is a 23 year-old woman who lives with her grandmother in a community called Hernández in Los Chiles, in the Alajuela province. This is a community that is known for its mountainous areas and beautiful countryside; it is quite humid and is located along the highway that runs very close to the country’s northern border. Its main commercial activities are livestock production and farming, specifically staple grains, tubers and oranges. Aurora has stood out because she has always been a very enterprising young person. A few years ago she started her own grocery store business (a small grocery store) selling basic products to her neighbors from her own home. With this business she has managed to have a profitable economic activity that helps her to improve her quality of life and support her grandmother, who has been her mother and father all of her life. Currently she needs a loan of 654,000 Costa Rican colones to buy materials needed to expand her store, so that she can provide better service to her customers. She comments that the service that she provides is very important, since she has a lot of customers and so needs more space.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and expand her store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace T., from the town of Baclayon, is 40 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a tailoring business providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members.

In 2009, Grace joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new loan, her third, of 9000 PHP to purchase additional fabrics and materials, and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Agée de 44 ans, D. abra est mariée avec 3 enfants. Elle est commerçante de tissus.
Il s’agit des tissus coupons qu’elle achète à Lomé et qu’elle revend comme ambulante de quartiers en quartiers. Elle exerce cette activité depuis plus de 20 ans.
Le crédit actuellement sollicité servira à l’achat de 25 pièces de tissu coupon et 30 pièces de draps.
Comptant sur l’accroissement de son activité, elle espère mieux répondre aux besoins de scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Abra D. is 44, and is married with three children. She buys cloth in Lomé and sells it as piece goods from door to door in different neighborhoods. She has been doing this for more than 20 years. The loan she is now asking for will be used to buy 25 pieces of cloth and 30 sheets. She hopes to increase her business so as to better take care of her children's educational needs.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth and sheets

loans.name: Martha Betulia

texts.es:
Martha Betulia V. A. tiene 45 anos de edad, es soltera y tiene seis hijas.  Reside in Barrio Centro en Juticalpa, Olancho, Honduras.  Tiene una pupuseria donde trabaja con sus hijas desde 8 de la manana a las 8 de la noche cada dia.  Comenzo hace 9 anos vendiendo pupusas su necogio a crecido y ahora vende todo tipo de comida.  Su negocio es buen conocido y tiene muchos clientes.

Con el prestamo de 12,000 Lempiras comprara materia prima para hacer diferentes comidas.  Comprara refrescos, carnes, verduras, lacteos, jugos, huevos, condimentos, frijoles y arroz.  El prestamo le ayudara a crecer su negocio y sus ingresos para que puede ayudar a sus hijas en sus estudios ya que ellas no tienen padre.  

Sus suenos son que su negocio sea mas grande y que sus hijas sean profesionales.  Martha ha sido un buen cliente de FAMA por siete anos y los prestamos han ayudado a crecer su negocio.  Le agredece mucho por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Martha Betulia V. A. is 45 years old, she is single and the mother of six girls. She lives in Barrio Centro in Jaticalpa, Olancho, Honduras. She owns a restaurant where she works with her daughters from 8 in the morning to 8 at night every day. She started 9 years ago selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas). Her business has expanded and her menu includes all kinds of food. Her business is well known and she has many clients. With this loan of 12,000 Lempiras she will purchase ingredients to make different foods. She will purchase soft drinks, meats, vegetables, milk products, juices, eggs, condiments, beans and rice. The loan will help her expand her business and her earnings, with the goal of helping her daughters with their tuition. They do not receive any support from their father. Her dream is to have a larger business and so see her daughters in professional jobs. Martha has been a good client of FAMA (Kiva field partner) for seven years and the loans have helped her invest in her business. She is very grateful for the support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make different types of foods.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is from the village of Pedlagahan, Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old. Teresita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business pedicure & manicure services to local community members. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima R. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 29 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Fatima owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP when she sells a raised animal. In 2007, Fatima joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Fatima is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 5th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio J. trabaja en un centro de labores del municipio de San Rafael del Sur. Tiene siete  años de trabajar para esta empresa, tiene un niño en edad escolar al que tiene la responsabilidad de proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. 

El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá directamente en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda porque tiene el sueño de proporcionarle a su hijo excelentes condiciones de vida y así seguir avante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar J. G. works at the San Rafael del Sur Town Hall as a security guard. He has worked here for six years. He has one school-aged child. Julio has had five loans with Ceprodel and has used them to purchase construction materials and improve his house. He has always shown great responsibility in paying his debts, and he appreciates the hard work these institutions do for the poor, 'who are dependent on low incomes, and if it were not for the help of these organizations, we would not be able to do any of these things to improve the life of each employee.'

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone, piedrin

loans.name: Rawya

texts.en:
Rawya J. is a 28 years housewife and mother of four children, Lina, Nour, Jihad and Yaser, the children are 12, 10, 7 and 6 years old respectively. Rawya's husband is a Palestinian National Authority Employee, Rawya wanted to have the store so she helps her husband cover life expenses.

Rawya sells house accessories and tools such as vases, frames, paintings, dishes, spoons, cups, etc.
Rawya came to FATEN to take a $600 to purchase goods she needs in the store, Rawya is very happy helping her husband and that she received a loan which will increase the returns.

Rawya's husband Muhamamd appears in the picture above as Rawya lives in Gaza which is a conservative region.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bunches of plantain and more dried meat

loans.name: Amigas Group

texts.es:
Este comité se por la invitación de la Señora Juana C.  quien conocía el Programa Comité de Mujeres, y de esta forma se realizó la reunión donde decidieron  concretar el comité para  recibir capacitaciones y  los créditos.
El comité se Denomina “Amigas ”  están  en el Tercer  Ciclo   con 17  integrantes , el  grupo  se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas y responsables en la comunidad, ya que realizan obras de caridad y actividades para el fondo del grupo  ,  ellas tienen actividades diferentes  y otras que están emprendiendo una nueva labor y cuentan con un ingreso fijo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Sergia quien se destaca por ser una señora muy emprenderá.
Ella hace poco decidió tomar un curso de manicura y pedicuro, para poder hacer servicios de belleza y por ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de las herramientas que le hace falta para trabajar bien.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the invitation of Mrs. Juana C. who knew about the Women’s Committee Program and organized a get-together where they decided to form a committee in order to receive training and loans.

The committee is called “Amigas” (Friends) and is in its third cycle with 17 members.  The group stands out in the neighborhood for being very unified and responsible in the community in that they undertake charitable events and activities to raise funds for the group.  They are involved in a variety of activities while some are starting off in new work directions and have steady income.

One of the members is Sergia who is noted for being very enterprising.  A short while ago she took a manicure and pedicure course to provide beauty services and is asking for a loan to buy the tools she needs to work properly.

loans.use: To buy manicure and pedicure tools and supplies.

loans.name: Salvadora Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora Salvadora Yolanda M., inicia ambulante con un capital de C$1,000.00 producto de aporte de su esposo actualmente tiene una pulpería en su casa, una parte de productos lo compra a proveedores que la visitan a su casa y otra parte en el mercado la terminal. 

Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de Compra de gaseosas, cosméticos, granos básicos y golosinas. La Señora M., con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL  se siente muy agradecido  por que ha logrado a incrementar su inventario donde ha obtenido buenas ganancias y así mejorado su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Ms. Salvadora Yolanda M. started as an itinerant vendor with just $1,000 córdobas [approximately $46 USD] of capital. Thanks to input from her husband, she now has a pulpería [small grocery store] in her house. She buys some of her products from suppliers who come to her house, and others from the La Terminal market. She is using this loan to buy soft drinks, cosmetics, staple grains, and candies. Ms. M. feels very grateful for the loans CEPRODEL has offered her, as they have allowed her to increase her inventory, earn good profits, and therefore improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cosmetics, staple grains, and candies

loans.name: Farrah's Group

texts.en:
Farrah lives in Khanewal which is a small city of Pakistan. She lives in a 2 roomed brick house with her family in the area named Christian colony. She moved here 4 years ago after her marriage to S. M.. Farrah is 27 years of age and has 3 children: 2 daughters and a son. All of the children are very young and are not yet of school going age. Farrah wants her children to get a quality education once they become older. She shares the financial burden with her husband by doing sewing works. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. Her husband is a government employee, earning a meager income. 

Farrah has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She will use the loan towards buying a new sewing machine because the old sewing machine doesn’t produce quality, neat work. The new machine will help her complete her work more quickly and she will be able to make more income. She started doing this business 4 years ago and is hopeful that an investment will increase her household income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she proved herself as a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farrah.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Sop Sokhna Astou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Astou est composé de 14 femmes habitant le même quartier, il a été créé le 28 mars 2008. L’activité principale des femmes du groupe est le petit commerce.

La responsable Mbeugué Guéye  est mariée, mère de trois enfants. Elle est à droite sur la photo, elle vend des fruits et légumes et des produits cosmétiques. 

Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville  et revend dans son quartier

Elle a sollicité le prêt de 50 000 F pour augmenter les produits à acheter.

 Avec ses bénéfices elle aide son mari pour les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Mame Astou is made up of 14 women living in the same neighborhood. It was created on March 28, 2008. These women’s main activity is small retail.

The group leader, Mbeugué Guéye, is married and the mother of three children. She is on the right of the photo. She sells fruits and vegetables and cosmetic products.

She gets her supplies from the large city market and resells in her neighborhood.

She is requesting a 50,000 Francs loan to increase the amount of items she sells.

With her profit she helps her husband in supporting the family.

loans.use: To promote her small business activity

loans.name: Kendel

texts.es: Kendel, de 21 años, es un joven padre de familia muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Linda de 17 años y su querida hija Nicol de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Kendel, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de buena calidad, ya que le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plaga de insectos que pueden aquejar sus plantaciones. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de cacao, café y hojas de coca al mercado mayorista, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para poder ampliar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Kendel is 21 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working young father.  He lives in his own home together with his wife 17 year-old Linda and his beloved 2 year-old daughter Nicol who he would like to provide with a better future.

The land which Kendel has achieved through so much hard work are the main support for his family.  His produce is very much in demand in the city of San Francisco since he is well known for growing good quality crops.  This helps him to fetch very good prices for his produce.  What Kendel most likes about his work is protecting his crops from insect infestations which can damage his plantations.  He has been in this business for 6 years and he considers that the most difficult part of his work is transporting the sacks of cacao, coffee and coca leaf to the wholesale market because they are very heavy and tire him out.  In the future, he would like to buy more land so that he can expand his production.

This is Kendel's third loan from MFP.  He knows that this support will be very helpful to him in making progress in his work.  He is a very cheerful member of his community bank who always brings order to the meetings.  He will use the 500 Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy manure and insecticides to make his land more fertile.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 3 Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina  “Mujeres Unidas 3” están en el  Decimo  tercer ciclo  con  24  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas , las mismas  realizan labores para la recaudación de fondos para el grupo como: Rondas, Polladas y Sorteos.
Una de las integrantes del comité, una señora muy trabajadora y creativa en cuanto a su forma de trabajo, es la señora Alice. 
Ella actualmente se dedica a la atención de la despensa que posee en su casa y de esa forma mantiene ayuda a su familia, se encuentra muy satisfecha con el grupo que trabaja.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como arroz, fideos, yerba mate, panificados y otros.
texts.en:
This committee is called “Mujeres Unidas 3” (United Women 3).  They are in their thirteenth loan cycle with 24 members.  This is a group that is well-known in their neighborhood for being very united, supportive and responsible.  They carry out activities to make funds for their group such as: competitions, lotteries and raffles.  

One of the committee's members is Alice who is a very hard-working and creative woman as far as her work is concerned.

Alice currently works serving in the small grocery store that she has in her home.  This is how she supports her family.  She is very satisfied with the group.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, noodles, yerba mate, baked goods, etc.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, yerba mate, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Nila Abigail

texts.es:
Nila Abigail V. M. tiene 52 años, es casada, vive con su esposo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Nila Abigail se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una finca.

Le gusta conversar con sus amigas y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Nila Abigail V. M. is 52 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the Ventanas canton,  Los Ríos province. She has 5 children.  

The members of the rural bank TIERRA NUESTRA live in the San Luís de Zapotal community, which belongs to the Ventanas canton. This bank has 14 members who work in short cycle agriculture, planting corn and rice.  

Nila Abigail works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She buys her materials in Farma-Agro and sells in the same place. 

She is asking for the loan to buy materials and seeds to plant corn and rice. The support from the loan will help her to meet her needs financially and face challenges such as pests and disease and changes in the weather. Her dream is to have a farm.    

She likes to talk to her friends and play sports.

loans.use: To buy materials and seeds

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima  B., 56 years old is a rice grower from the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She started her business last 2001. She desired of having a bigger farm in the future. She wished that she would be able to support the needs of her family even if she as she is getting older.

She would like to apply a loan of PhP 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the funds to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.  In this way, she will be able to grow her harvest. The loan will also help improve her business and her family.

Prima enjoys the micro insurance program of CEVI and the company of other entrepreneurs in their loan association.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Gilda

texts.en:
Ma. Gilda is a married woman who lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a business of buying, weaving and selling nipa (a palm whose foliage is used for thatching). Her husband, Bennymar, who is 30 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 4 and 8 years old. 

Ma. Gilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 6,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $75, raising the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 3rd loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Ma. Gilda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies for her business

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
SABALY est un regroupement de 5 femmes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Kamalen Sirakoro, Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été bien dénoués. MARIETOU S. fait le commerce de poissons dans ce groupe .Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  75kg de poissons. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso. Elle les revend au comptant au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à Kamalen Sirakoro à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55.000 FCFA dont une partie est épargnée et l’autre utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The group SABALY has five members who are married women. They all have around 42 year-old and about 4 children. Most of them live within polygamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro district in the city of Sikasso. Sikasso is the third administrative region of Mali. The women are applying to their twelfth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their clients. Their previous loans have been paid off. In this group of women, Madam Marietou S. sells fish to men and women. She is planning on buying 75Kg of fish with the loan. She gets her supplies at Sikasso's main market. She sells fish for cash at Medine's market in Sikasso and with her family in Kamalen Sirakoro. She plans of making a monthly profit of 55.000CFA. A part will be use to pay her family's daily expenditures, the other part will be saved.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik M. is an economist, and she lives in Ijevan with two sons, a daughter-in-law and a grandchild. Her older son graduated from the Ijevan College and now helps Hasmik in her business. The younger one studies at the Yerevan Police Academy.
