Hasmik has her own business which she runs in her private shop where she sells food, flour and animal feed. With the income from her business Hasmik keeps her family and pays for her younger son’s education. 

This is Hasmik’s third loan from Nor Horizon and second loan from Kiva. Now Hasmik needs a loan of 1.000.000 AMD to buy flour and fodder to sell.

loans.use: To buy flour and fodder to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Lamosa

texts.en:
Lamosa M. is 39 years old,  married, and has four children. Lamosa owns and operates a business venture, selling bamboo handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Lamosa is requesting a loan for 2,900 WST to purchase additional handicrafts to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business, estimated to be 400 talas or $167 per week, to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Lamosa  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Lamosa 's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun S., 40, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known as one of Pre-Angkorean Temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 20 on food and USD 45 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase pigs to raise and resell. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and resell.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
S. Gulsara is an honest, hard-working woman who is married and has three sons. Her oldest son helps her in the business; her second son serves in the army, and the last son studies at secondary school. Her business is the family’s business: they work together and support each other. 

Since 2008 she provides video recordings of movies, music, entertainment and so on. She sells her disks in the central market of Isfara region. She works 28 or 30 days a month. Gulsara has regular customers and more orders for recording. She would like to get a loan of 8000 Somoni for purchasing equipment to burn the CDs in order to do better with the quality of records with new technology.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy equipment to burn CDs.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is 22 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in her parent's backyard. They live in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband works in a paper producing factory. She manages a hair salon at a rented booth at a trading center. 

Oyunchimeg started her business after graduating from school with Diploma of Hairdressing in 2008. In 2009, she changed her working place in order to increase her customers. Now she has many regular customers and is planning to continue her business. She is a polite woman who attributes her business success to her good communication skills. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase salon equipment.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario La Esperanza está compuesto por Josefa Catalina, Martha Lorena, Martha Elena, Martha y Rosa. Josefa tiene su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad inicio con esfuerzos propios a pesar de que no ha sido fácil ha logrado ya que hay mucha competencia pero no brindan el buen servicio y la amabilidad que Josefa. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de polvos, lápiz labial, cremas, tratamientos, shampoo y otros.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “La Esperanza” (The Hope) consists of Josefa Catalina, Martha Lorena, Martha Elena, Martha, and Rosa.

For more than five years, Josefa has been managing a business in which she sells cosmetics. She was able to start her business through her own efforts even though things were not easy at first. Josefa had to face many competitors, but they were not able to provide an excellent level of friendly service like she does. Her loan will be used to purchase powders, lip liners, crèmes, treatments, shampoos, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase powders, lip liners, crèmes, treatments, shampoos, and other products.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 35-year-old housewife who did not let the fact that she has three children to raise with her husband keep her from being a productive member of the family. Wanting to stay by her children’s side during the day and having experience as a housewife led her to start a small retail business at home selling household supplies.

Since she knows what is best for women to use at their houses, she started attracting them to buy from her, plus being closer than the closest home supply shop in their area.

Now after three years since launching her business, and being known in the area,  Safaa has applied for this loan to start expanding by opening her own home supplies store to increase the income she gets and to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in her own store.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a Ugandan man, age 41, who needs a loan to pay the balance on his newly acquired taxi van. He hails from Kyenjojo district and is the father of five children between the ages of 12 and 28 years old. He dreams of educating his children and setting up other income-generating activities to supplement his income. As a farmer of 15 years, his start-up capital came from accumulated savings from his tea plantation.

loans.use: to pay the balance on his newly acquired taxi van.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cuyes y también la socia se dedica al trabajo de profesora en el nivel inicial en el distrito de Urubamba, y el negocio de venta de cuyes lo realiza en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Urubamba, la socia por medio de este negocio y trabajo sacan adelante a sus hijos, al socia quiere ampliar le negocio de venta de cuyes y mejorar en su trabajo como profesora. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y alimentos para los cuyes.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She belongs to the communal bank "Senor de Torrechayoc". It is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, married, and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling guinea pigs and she also works as a primary school teacher in the district of Urubamba. She carries out her sale of guinea pigs itinerantly at the different fairs that happen in the district of Urubamba. It is through this business and her employment that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand her business selling guinea pigs and to improve her employment as a teacher. She requests a loan to purchase guinea pigs and feed for guinea pigs.

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and their feed.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 34 years old and married to John. They are blessed with three children: aged seven, five and three years. 

Stella has been selling vegetables and fruits for five years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family members and her business.

She is applying for her second loan term with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy beans, green maize, tomatoes to add to her business. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, she will buy a pickup car for transporting her products. Her hopes are to educate her children, to buy a piece of land and to build her house.

loans.use: To buy beans, green maize, tomatoes to add to her business.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 51 years old, and is a married woman who has been working in the mobile phone sector for three years. She and her husband started this business to cover their expenses, and raise two daughters. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Nga is requesting a loan to use to purchase a stock of mobile phone sim cards and accessories to sell from her stall. There is a lot of demand for these products in her community, and Nga hopes that by offering a great variety of products that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

Nga hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand this business, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy phone cards and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: Monsieur Daouda  habite au Sénégal. Il est  marié et âgé de 38 ans.  Il est enseignant dans la localité ou il vit.  Il a choisi sa profession par amour du métier mais aussi par nécessité  dans le souci de se procurer des revenus pour subvenir a ses besoins personnels. Tout son plaisir consiste à former les jeunes élèves et les aider a affronter les difficultés de la vie. Daouda est un  nouveau  marié qui sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs. L’objet du prêt est l’achat d’un lit et  d’une coiffeuse en vue d’aménager sa chambre a coucher pour préparer l’arrivée de sa femme a rejoindre le domicile conjugal. Le financement lui permettra de réaliser son projet et d’améliorer son cadre de vie.
texts.en: Daouda lives in Senegal. He is married and 38 years old. He is a teacher in the town where he lives. He chose his profession out of love for teaching but also because he needed to earn money to provide for his personal needs. He gets great pleasure from teaching young pupils and helping them to face life's difficulties; Daouda is a newly-married man who is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs. The purpose of the loan is to purchase a bed and a dressing table for his bedrom in preparation for the arrival of his wife in the conjugal home. The loan will allow him to fulfil this project and improve his living space.

loans.use: to buy a bed and dressing table for his bedroom

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children. For the past 5 years, Francis has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase supplies like sugar soap for resale, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and expand his business. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to open another business. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Sirote

texts.en:
Sirote is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. She is 26 years old, married, with one child. 


She has been a good client and is applying for her second loan. She plans to use a part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs and the other to use in her business.

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Chinara's Group

texts.en:
Chinara is the leader of this group. She is 35 and married. Her husband works in the brick factory.  Together with her husband, she is raising three sons and two daughters. The sons study at school and the daughters are pre-school aged (under seven). In order to earn money to meet the family needs, Chinara breeds cattle. She sells dairy products and in this way she earns about 2000 soms per month. At the moment, she wants to increase the number of cattle she keeps, but she doesn’t have enough money to realize her plans, thus she applied for the loan. With money received from the loan she will purchase cattle for breeding. In the future, Chinara wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Igualdad Para Todas Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras denominado Igualdad para Todas es del Chaco. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con 10 integrantes. En su mayoría las clientes se dedican a la  venta D. todo tipo D. productos y también están las demás miembros del grupo que con mucho esfuerzo responsabilidad ven el fruto D. muchos años D. sacrificio.
una D. las miembros es la señora Carmen, que se dedica a la venta D. productos D. limpieza, ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que gracias al sacrificio y a su trabajo ha logrado salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. los elementos D. limpieza que venD., para que D. esa forma pueda tener mas abastecido su negocio y pueda cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurial Women Committee called 'Igualdad para Todas' (Equality for All), is from Chaco.  They are currently in their first loan cycle with ten members.  Most of these clients work selling different types of products.  The other members of the group, through a lot of hard work and responsibility, are also seeing the rewards of many years of sacrifice.

One of the members of this group is Carmen who sells cleaning products.  She considers herself to be a very hard-working and tenacious woman who, thanks to her sacrifice and hard work, has managed to get ahead and help her family.  

Carmen is requesting this loan to buy cleaning products to sell so that her business is better stocked and she is able to fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to re-sell

loans.name: Nuevo Día Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO DIA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por siete integrantes dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora  Rosmery.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de licores, venta de jugos, venta de productos, tienda de barrio, venta de comino.
 
La señora Rosmery indica que es la primera ves que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de víveres para llenar la tienda (compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, etc.) que compra de la Ceja y posteriormente  lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse en lo posible pues ella soltera.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y la atención en salud.
texts.en:
A.C. “NUEVO DIA” will start its first loan cycle as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It consists of 7 members lead by a board which is headed by Señora Rosmery. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are various and among them are: liquor sales; juice sale; groceries; neighbourhood store; cumin sales.

Señora Rosmery says that it is the first time that she has been a member of a communal bank with Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of one of the promoters. Currently she has a neighbourhood store which she has run for many years.

The loan she is asking for now is to buy groceries to stock her store (to buy rice, oil, noodles, etc.) which she buys at La Ceja and subsequently sells in her store. This workflow allows her to generate resources with which to support herself as much as possible as she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past six years, Irene has been working hard to manage her health clinic, which sells medicine. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for resale and will help Irene to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for her children. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Irene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for resale

loans.name: Naris

texts.ru:
Нарис 30 лет, замужем и воспитывает троих детей, старшие дети учатся в школе.  Супруг работает в « Кыргыз почтасы» почтальоном. В целях увеличения дохода семьи, два года назад Нарис решила начать свой собственный бизнес в торговле, используя при этом стартовую сумму в 40,000 сом (KGS). Открытие небольшого магазина с промышленными и хозяйственными товарами поддержала и мама Нарис, оказавшая помощь в предоставлении помещения под магазин.  Доходы от бизнеса позволили Нарис сделать ремонт в квартире и купить бытовую технику. 
 В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нарис обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на расширение товара. Сейчас Нарис прилагает все усилия , чтобы воплотить свою мечту – дать детям хорошее образование.
texts.en: Naris is 30 years old, married and raising three children. The older children are in school. Her husband works as a mail carrier for the Kyrgyz Post. In order to increase her family’s income, two years ago Naris decided to launch her own sales business, using a starting capital of 40,000 KGS. Naris’s mother, who helped with obtaining store premises, helped her open a small store with household goods and various general merchandise. The income from her business allowed Naris to do renovations in the apartment and to buy home appliances. In order to develop her business further, Naris turned to “Bai Tushum and Partners” for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS for expanding her  assortment of goods. At present Naris strives very hard to realize her dream and provide good education for her children.

loans.use: to  expand her assortment of goods

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is 57 years old. She lives in the village of Korkhi, South Georgia. Nina lives alone; she performs night-watch duties at a local school and receives a monthly salary of 80 GEL. 

Nina's main source of income is agriculture. In particular, she has a milk cow, and she produces cheese and sells it at the local market. Along with the dairy farm, Nina is also busy growing potatoes. She sells the harvested vegetables in the village to retailers. 

Nina requested credit for purchasing calves, piglets, and wood.  Nina will feed calves and piglets during the winter months and sell them in spring for a higher price. She will use the wood to heat her house.

Nina plans to save some part of the received income for further development of potato growing, as this business has a high profit margin. Part of the income will be also used for purchasing additional household goods to improve Nina’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves and piglets and to purchase wood for warming the house.

loans.name: Sinignesigui Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe SINIGNESIGUI sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, en moyenne 4 enfants et qui vivent majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques à  HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame KADIATOU, qui est au milieu fait le commerce de chaussures.
Elle compte acheter de la matière première afin de fabriquer  des chaussures pour femmes et hommes qu’elle revendra au marché de Médine à Sikasso, à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle diverse et variée 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the group called  SINIGNESIGUI  are essentially married women with an average age of 32 and on average four children. They mostly live in monogamous families in  HAMDALLAYE, one of the working class districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). 

They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Madame KADIATOU, standing in the middle, sells shoes.

She intends to buy raw materials for making shoes for women and men which she will resell at the market of Médine in Sikasso, in a fixed place, and within her extended family, to a diverse and varied clientele.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 F CFA of which a part will be used to pay off the loan and its interest and the rest will be put aside as savings.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for shoe-making.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 45, is married to James. She has been in this business for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of 6,250 Kenyan shillings (KES). Lucy is applying for her first loan of 100,000 KES. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to purchase more cereal products for sale and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cereal products for resale.

loans.name: Mirna Ruth

texts.es: Mirna, por la necesidad de mejorar  la vivienda está solicitando un prestamo, ya que quiere realizarle unos trabajos a la casa y comprará cemento para repellarla en unas partes que aun faltan y pintura para darle una mejor apariencia y vistosidad. Ella con estos préstamos ha mejorado su condición de vida,su vivienda poco a poco se va transformando, ha solventado las compras más necesarias para tener una mejor condición y ofrecérselo también a su familia.
texts.en: Mirna is requesting a loan due to the need to better her home. Since she wants to carry out some work on her home she will buy cement to plaster it in some parts where it is still missing and paint to give it a better appearance and brightness. With these loans she has bettered her condition of life and her home is transforming little by little. She has settled for the most necessary purchases in order to have a better life and offer it to her family.

loans.use: to buy cement and paint for her home.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra de 32 años de edad, trabaja como docente del Colegio Rubén Dario desde hace 11 años, solicita su  crédito para  invertirlo en remodelación de una habitación en su casa y pintarla, en su comunidad es muy reconocida como una persona honesta y responsable en sus compromisos, su esposo la ayuda con los gastos del hogar ya que ambos son asalariados y bien unidos.  Su sueño es tener una casa mas grande con mejores condiciones como toda persona lo desea, que su familia goze de salud y trabaja para que no falte lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en: Sandra, 32 years old, has worked as a teacher at Colegio Rubén Dario for 11 years. She is asking for a loan to remodel a room in her house and paint it. She is very well-known in her community as an honest person who is responsible regarding her commitments. Her husband helps her with household expenses, since they are both salaried and are pretty united. Her dream is to have a bigger house with better conditions, like everyone wants, and for her family to enjoy good health. She works so that her household does not lack the basics.

loans.use: to remodel a room

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 53 year old barber shop owner in Bamburi, Mombasa.  She is married and has been running this for the past three years with success. 

This marks Christine’s second business loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to purchase new shaving machines and to renovate her shop. 

She will use the anticipated profits to open a new business.  She hopes to own many barbershops in Bamburi.

loans.use: To purchase new shaving machines and to renovate her shop.

loans.name: Jolyanne Edwige Laure

texts.fr: Jolyanne Edwige Laure est âgée de 47 ans, a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Jolyanne Edwige Laure est veuve, mère de trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Jolyanne Edwige Laure  vit seule avec ses enfants. Les différentes charges du ménage sont assumées par dame Jolyanne Edwige Laure.  Pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à ses propres besoins, Jolyanne Edwige Laure  vend de la nourriture à son domicile depuis une dizaine d’année Jolyanne Edwige Laure s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Jolyanne Edwige Laure devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Jolyanne Edwige Laure sollicite une deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, de l'huile végétale et des poissons.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза, 31 год, не замужем, есть дочь, ей 4 года. У Наргизы- среднее образование, она 5 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Наргиза очень любит свою деятельность, на земельной доле 1,0 ГА она выращивает люцерну для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Также в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, на ежедневной основе продает молоко. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). Наргиза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Благодаря кредиту, Наргиза сможет откладывать доходы от бизнеса на дальнейшее его развитие, что позволит накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nargiza is 31 years old, unmarried, and has a four-year-old daughter. Nargiza has secondary education, and she has been engaged in agriculture and animal husbandry for five years. 

Nargiza loves her business very much, and on a 1 hectare landshare she cultivates alfafa for on-farm consumption. There are also three cows on the farm, which produce milk daily. Her monthly income is 9000 som (KGS). 

Nargiza has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS), in order to buy three cows. Thanks to the loan, Nargiza will be able to set aside funds from her business for its further development, which will allow her to save for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Mr G. owns a haircuttery, improvised in his own home, his aspiration is to be able to improve his home/business like his brothers in the center of the city.

\"For more than a decade,with my brothers, we have created a small haircuttery in the center of the city, now I have decided to become more independent and have connected a room in my house, I have dedicated my entire life to this, and now I need to have my own business, I am asking for $1,500.00 dollars to buy equipment and tools.\"

Español

El Sr. González cuenta con una peluquería improvisada en su casa, su deseo es poder acondicionarla en forma adecuada tal y como la tienen sus hermanos en el centro de la ciudad. “Hace ya mas de una década que en conjunto con mis hermanos echamos a andar una peluquería en el centro de la ciudad, hoy en día decidí independizarme y acople un cuarto de mi casa, toda mi vida me he dedicado a esto, hoy quiero tener mi propio negocio, solicito $1,500.00 dlls para comprar equipo y herramienta.”

loans.use: equipment for his Barbershop

loans.name: Roza

texts.en: Roza B. bakes very tasty meat rissoles, patties and buns. The recipe of preparation Roza got from her mother who is already 86 years old. Roza starts her cooking at 4 o’clock in the morning. The traders from the local market take her goods from her home at 7 in the morning. She has many clients and mostly she and her daughter are not able to manage the demand. They need more assistants and bigger premises. In April Roza plans to rent a café, where she will cook national dishes and bake. The loan will be used in creating conditions for work in the café and buying additional appliances for cooking. Roza and her daughter love Tajikistan and want to be involved in development of their motherland.

loans.use: Preparation of new premises for work

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
I have a bakery where I sell various kinds of bread and pastries as well as pinatas and other decorations for birthday parties. I have been in business for five years and have a good clientele because people really like my pastries. With the receipts of the bakery I am able to help my family and employ several people.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Tengo un negocio de resposteria donde vendo variedades de panes y pasteles. Tambien vendo piñatas decoraciones para cumpleaños, este negico lo tengo hace 5 años del cual tengo una buena clientela ya que mis pasteles y panes les encantan. Los ingresos de venta ayudo a mi familia y a otros personas en dandoles trabajo.

loans.use: To buy eggs, flour and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Mrs. Jacqueline K. was born on Feb. 2, 1982 in Lomé (Togo). She is married and mother of one child. Her husband is a carpenter who does not have the financial means to make his business prosper. Mrs. K. is an apprentice dressmaker and has almost reached the end of her training period.

In order to set herself up in business as quickly as possible, Mrs. K. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a sewing machine and other necessities for a dressmaking shop. This will permit her to be financially independent and also contribute to household expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame K. Jacqueline est née le 02 février 1982 à Lomé (P/Golfe). Elle est mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant. Son mari, un menuisier n’a pas les moyens suffisants pour faire prospérer son métier. Madame K. Jacqueline est apprentie couturière et est presque à la fin de sa formation.

Afin d’ouvrir un atelier très vite, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour acheter une machine à coudre, et les nécessaires pour un atelier de couture. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir une autonomie financière et contribuer aussi aux dépenses du foyer.

loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine and opening of a dressmaker's shop

loans.name: Miatin

texts.id:
As a widow, Miatin has to work for her own living since all of her children are married and live with their own family. Before her husband passed away, Miatin had been selling meatball-noodle in a mobile food stall. After his husband passed away, no one could hep her to carry her food stall around. Miatin switched to a stationary food stall near the harbor. She opens her stall from 8AM to 9PM. With initial capital of 300,000 IDR (1USD~9,000 IDR), Miatin can earn a profit of 40,000 IDR daily. She used the profit to pay for her basic needs, for additional working capital and for paying the rent for her food stall of 150,000 IDR per month. With the loan from Dinari, Miatin plans to add more variety to her food stall so she can earn bigger profir and serves more customers.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebagai seorang janda, Miatin harus berusaha untuk menghidupi dirinya sendiri karena semua anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal bersama pasangannya masing – masing. Sebelum suaminya meninggal, Miatin berjualan bakso dengan cara keliling di lingkungannya. Namun, setelah suaminya meninggal, tidak ada lagi yang bisa mendorong rombong yang dipakainya berjualan. Karena hal itu, Miatin beralih usaha dengan membuka usaha warung nasi di dekat pelabuhan. Miatin membuka usahanya dari pukul 8 pagi sampai pukul 9 malam. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 300.000.-, Miatin bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 40.000.- per hari. Dengan keuntungan itu Miatin sisihkan untuk keperluan sehari – hari, menambah modal dan juga untuk membayar sewa tempat usaha sebesar Rp. 150.000.- per bulan. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, Miatin berencana untuk menambah jenis dagangannya sehingga ia bisa mendapat keuntungan yang lebih besar dan melayani lebih banyak pelanggan.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Tong (age 59) was married in 1960 and has six children, three sons and three daughters. She is currently in the business of weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her mother in law in 1979 and began her silk production in the same year. One of her daughters is also weaving silk. Her husband, Mr. Chay Phat (age 59) is a farmer. He learnt this skill from his parents in 1979. He fishes, plants corn, and raises cows. One of his sons is also assisting him in raising cows.

Tong has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times before. Now she is requesting a loan to continue her weaving business in the amount of $400. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Nolberta's Group

texts.en:
Maria Ernestina, Nolberta and Maria Asunta have been members of the community bank Bienestar II (meaning  “Well-being”) for two, six, and three years, respectively. Being members of the bank, they have learned skills that allow them to lead a better life. They have learned to be responsible, to communicate effectively, and to stand in solidarity.  At the same time, they have learned the value of saving.
Maria Ernestina is 53 years old and has three children. She has owned a small grocery store for the last 35 years.
Nolberta is 49 years old and has four children, all of them studying in a university. She has a small grain mill that she uses to grind many different types of flour. She sells these products from a stand in the jungle near Ayacucho. In the past, she sold these grains from a traveling cart. Over the past seven years, she has been able to save enough to buy a machine to cut the grain and another one to remove the husks.   
Maria Asunta is 56 years old and a mother of six. For the last five years, she has been running a business selling whole grains and different types of flour, such as wheat, corn, and kiwicha which is typical of the region.
Maria Ernestina, Nolberta and Maria Asunta need loans of 400 soles, 600 soles, 400 soles, respectively, which they will invest in the purchase of sugar, flour, rice, grains, and in the expansion of their respective businesses.  
They plan to use their savings to buy household items and clothing for their families.
The dream of Maria Ernestina is that her children become professionals; that of Nolberta is to further develop her business, while Maria Asunta dreams of owning a house.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, rice, grains, and expansion of business

loans.name: Winnie's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Winnie N.. She is currently in the business of selling tea and is requesting a loan of UGX 250,000 to buy furniture. Winnie is 24 years old and married to her husband who is a driver. She has 1 child of age 3. Each week Winnie makes approximately UGX 15,000 in profit. With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy furniture.

Winnie is joined in her small group by Prossy N., Mariam L., Ruth N., and Teo N.. Prossy N. is currently in the business of selling tea and is requesting a loan of UGX 250,000 to buy cooking utensils.

Mariam L. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to expand the business.

Ruth N. is currently in the business of operating a market stall and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to expand the business.

Teo N. is currently in the business of running a market stall and is requesting a loan of UGX 100,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 47-year-old mother of 2 children. She works and lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon.
Fatima sells clothing to help her husband provide for their family. This is the first time Fatima has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With this loan, she is planning to buy additional merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sustain and develop her business

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela R. P. is a hardworking businesswoman in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. Manuela owns some land where she has a fish farm and also raises pigs and chickens. Her goal for this year is to raise 1,800 chickens and create four fish farms. A fish farm is 40 meters wide and will support bocachico and carachama. She also plants different crops on the five hectares of land she owns.

Manuela is 43 years old, has five children, and is happily married. She loves working, farming, business, and helping her family. Her goal is to provide all the opportunities in life for her children that she never had.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Manuela is requesting a loan of $1,100 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to buy 500 chickens, plus feed and vitamins.

loans.use: To buy 500 chickens, as well as feed and vitamins

loans.name: Nila Violeta

texts.en:
Nila Violeta Zavalet C. has a general store in the town of Agaullpampa, high in the sierras of the La Libertad Region. She has 4 years of experience and sells candy, oil, rice, sodas, and much more. Her store has a wonderful location in the center of town.

Nila is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She loves her business because she now has more independence and dignity. She doesn’t have to ask her husband for money and can help pay for her children’s tuition.

A member of the community bank Jesus Nazareno, Nila is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months. She will restock her store with all her best selling products.

loans.use: She will restock her store with all her best selling products

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
B. Nargis is 21 years old and is not yet married.

Nargis has been running her own business for 4 years already. Nargis sells clothes for kids and women in a store which is located in one of the densely inhabited parts of the city. She began her business in order to have an independent income and to support her parents. Muhabbat is very nice and polite and has many clients. The business is quite stable and serves as a significant source of income for the family.

Now she requests $700 US in order to increase her stock of summer clothes for kids and women. Nargis is planning to repay the loan completely in 9 months. She promises to be accurate with the repayment of the loan and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing of new clothes to increase stock.

loans.name: Omorefe

texts.en:
Omorefe F. is 30 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells traditional women's dresses called "wrappers." Omorefe learned this business from her mother. and started her own business in 2001. She is a LAPO client.

She needs a loan of $875 USD to buy more wrappers to sell.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Thi Hong's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. H. Thi Hong (born in 1976, ID: 23010043) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to invest in breeding cows and pigs and her small business in the market. Mrs. Hong is currently living with her husband’s parents, her husband and her two children in Xuan Canh, Dong Anh, Hanoi. Her husband is a construction worker with a stable income. In addition to raising cows and pigs at home, Mrs. Hong runs a small business in the market, selling goods, which generates another source of income for her family. As Mrs. H. and her husband work very hard, their income has been stable, about 100000 VND per day, which is very suitable for the paying-back method. Other members in Mrs. Hong’s group include:

-Mrs. N. Thi Loan (born in 1973, ID: 23010045) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to invest in her electronics shop.

-Mrs. V. Thi Muoi (born in 1971, ID: 23010004) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to invest in poultries.

-Mrs. N. Thi Gai (born in 1960, ID: 23010042) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to raise chickens.

-Mrs. N. Thi Mao (born in 1951, ID: 23010101) would like borrow a loan of 4.876.000 VND to raise pigs.

-Mrs. N. Thi Luat (born in 1950, ID: 23010105) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to raise pigs.

-Mrs. D. Thi Duyen (born in 1985, ID: 23010103) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to invest in her carpentry shop.

-Mrs. V. Thi Canh (born in 1962, ID: 23010104) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to invest in her small shop in the market.

-Mrs. N. Thi No (born in 1957, ID: 23010106) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to raise poultries.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva volunteer.

Hoàng Thị Hồng, sinh năm 1976 (Ms 23010043), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi bò, lợn, một phần để đi chợ. Chị đang sống cùng bố mẹ chồng, chồng và hai con tại Xuân Canh, Đông Anh, Hà Nội. Chồng chị hàng ngày đi phu hồ với mức lương ổn định. Bản thân chị ở nhà tăng gia sản xuất, chăn nuôi. Nông nhàn, chị lại đi chợ buôn bán tạo thu nhập. Sẵn có sức khỏe, lại chịu khó làm ăn nên vợ chồng chị có thu nhập đều theo ngày khoảng 100.000 vnđ / ngày. Điều đó rất phù hợp với những khoản vốn vay trả dần. Bởi vậy, gia đình chị rất thích vay vốn trả góp và mong muốn được vay liên tục. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Nguyễn Thị Loan, sinh năm 1973 (Ms 23010045) mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng đồ điện tử. Vũ Thị Mười, sinh năm 1971(Ms 23010004 ), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi Nguyễn Thị Gái, sinh năm 1960(Ms 23010042 ), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Nguyễn Thị Mão, sinh năm 1951(Ms 23010101), mức vay: 4.876.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Nguyễn Thị Luật, sinh năm 1950(Ms 23010105), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn. Đỗ Thị Duyên, sinh năm 1985 (Ms 23010103), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư xưởng gỗ. Vũ Thị Cảnh, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 23010104), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ. Nguyễn Thị Nở, sinh năm 1957(Ms 23010106), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnd để đầu tư chăn nuôi.

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Mr. Voeun B., 31, and his wife, Mrs. Srey-aun Soeung, 26, live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2000 and have two children: one son and one daughter. 

Mr. Voeun has been a mason since 2003. He does his work in Phnom Penh and a nearby province. His wife has been a garment factory worker for two years. Currently, Voeun needs a motorcycle for driving to work and running a motor taxi when he is free from his construction work. Thus, he is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle to drive to work and serve as a motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work and run as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods, drinks and fried meat. She has been in this business for the past six years. Mary buys the foodstuffs for cooking from Ikotun main market and takes the foodstuffs to Egbeda where she has her restaurant. Mary needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more foodstuffs in bulk to cook and sell. This, she says, will enable her meet the demands of her customers and, thereby, retain her customers. Mary is 45 years old and married to Mr. A.. They have three children who are all in school. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To Purchase more foodstuffs and beef for cooking to sell

loans.name: Musarat's Group

texts.en:
Musarat baji is the widow of J. I. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar of the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the last 17 years. She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son runs a mobile shop. The next to him is a tailor and completed his education till 8th standard. Her daughter stays at home and does household work.

Musarat baji herself has a clothes selling business. She has been in this business for the last 18 years. She buys clothes from a big clothing market named “Shahalmi and Feroz pur Road”. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies (cement and sand) to resell. Shaista baji wants a loan to buy medicines to resell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Fazilat baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia A. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high. Lydia sells fabric and ladieswear at Abura market, which she has done since 2003. She is a seamstress who sews all kinds of traditional dresses. Her husband is a trader. Lydia uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Lydia will use the loan to increase the sale of ladieswear and fabric like lining and other sewing materials to enhance the efficiency of her services. With the new profits from her expanded business, Lydia plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Lydia will use the loan to increase the sale of ladieswear.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi O. sells provisions and foodstuffs. She started her business in 2004. She is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She need a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Giang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Ngô Thị Giang   năm nay 40  tuổi, chị đang ssóng cùng chồng và 3 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2004 chị tham gia Quỹ tình htương và vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi lợn và gà. Đến nay sau 4 năm tham gia  Quỹ  với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Giang đã  ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua lợn giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Giang Thi Ngo is a 40 years old woman. She is living with her husband and her three children in school age. In 2004, she joined the TYM fund and borrowed money to raise pigs and chickens. Now, the family’s income reaches 2,500,000 VND; their living condition has been much improved. Mrs. Ngo plans to make the next loan of 15,000,000 VND to buy breeding pigs and food for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena S. is 40 years old. She is married with one child. At the moment, her son is in senior high school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and also has been selling grocery products and fruit like bananas for the past twenty years in order to take care of her family. Palm oil is produced from palm fruits. The palm fruit is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil. The palm oil produced is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to lacking the necessary capital to buy machines for the work of processing.

In addition to her palm oil business, she also operates a grocery shop and sells item like sugar, biscuits, evaporated milk, etc., and bananas in the community where she lives. She says this has also slowed down due to current food prices and the economic crunch in the world market. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her capacity to produce in larger quantities. She plans to purchase rice, sugar, milk, biscuits, and other canned foods, etc. so that she can supply her customers on a regular basis.

Abena believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to help her husband provide food and finance her dear child's education. Abena belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Nti’ which means For Christ's Sake. She hopes to receive GHS 1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits and grocery products to restock her inventory

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida baji has been a citizen of a city called Kot Radha Kishan for the past 15 years. Kot Radha Kishan is famous for its livestock because mostly people work in this business to support their families. Zubaida baji is married to a man whose name is M. A. and he is involved in a dairy business. He has a buffalo at his house.

Zubaida baji and her husband get up early and get the milk from the buffalo and then fill the milk pots. Her husband is very happy with her supportive behavior. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s milk-selling business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en:
B. Faizullo is 54 years old, married, and lives with his wife and adult son. He works very hard at cultivating wheat, an activity which he has practiced for five years. He enjoys his work for the contact with nature, and also because wheat sells very well in the markets and is valued within his community. Currently Faizullo needs a loan of $675 for his business. With this loan, he will buy seed and fertilizers to improve his farm and get a larger crop. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 52 years old and married with 2 children. She sells engine oil retail to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more engine oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase engine oil

loans.name: Agasa

texts.en: Agasa S., 42, is married with 8 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 410 Tala.  SPBD loans are Agasa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knives, spade, knapsack sprayer, axe, chemicals etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia K. is married, and has three children. She attended school all the way through her Senior year. Cecilia works as a groceries and soft drinks vender, and also specializes in construction items such as cement and slate. She operates her business near Cape Coast, and has done so since 2000. Her husband is employed as a contractor. Cecilia uses her income to pay for the family rent, her children’s school fees, as well as the purchasing of restocking supplies such as soft drink and more groceries.

Cecilia is now requesting a loan in order to expand her business, and continue to support her family.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy hails from D'BAN, Calamba, Mis. Occ. She is 49 years old and married with 3 children. All of her children are adults now. Presently they are operating a tailoring business. She is granted with a loan worth 25,000 pesos for the purchase of a sewing machine.

The family has been in the business for 10 years now. She earns at least 2,000 pesos per month. That's why they want to add an additional sewing machine unit so they can serve enough customers and that can add to their income as well. They aspire to have good business deals, augment their income and have good health always.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine unit

loans.name: Buvojon

texts.ru: Буводжон Рахимов 1985 года рождения , женат имеет 1 ребенка. Высшего образования не имеет.  В Чкаловске торгует на рынке овощами : капустой , морковью , чесноком и различными овощами. Иногда мать заменяет его на прилавке, когда он занят другими делами.  Первый кредит получил в 2008 году на расширение своей точки. На прилавок ему поставляли тоннами лук. После получения кредита разнообразил свой товар.
texts.en:
Buvojon R. was born in 1985, is married and has one infant. He does not have higher education. In Chkalovske, he trades at the vegetable market: cabbages, carrots, garlic and various vegetables. Sometimes, his mother takes his place at the counter, when he is engaged with other tasks. He received his first loan in 2008 for the expansion of his retail spot. A ton onions was delivered to his booth. After receiving the loan, he diversified his goods.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of food products

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel O. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high. Mabel is a distributor of a variety of cooking oils in Hohoe central market, which she has done since 1999. Mabel will use the loan to purchase cooking oil in large quantity to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mabel plans to invest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil in large quantity

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella G. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 68 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Estrella owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2000, Estrella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando U. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 42 years old. Armando is engaged and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Armando owns & operates a business providing video game services to local community. Armando has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Armando joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armando is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the video game units used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Armando from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair video game units used in her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is from the village of Maribojoc,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Erlinda is married. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Domitila De La Paz

texts.es: Domitila De La Paz P. R., reside en la capital de país San Salvador. A sus 33 años de edad Domitila es madre soltera de cuatro niños, todos aun menores de edad, Domitila afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su madre Doña María quien ayuda a cuidando a sus pequeños nietos; mientras Domitila tiene que salir a trabajar día a día, para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, que solo cuentan con el apoyo económico de ella. Domitila posee su propio negocio, es un puesto en el mercado central, donde vende variedad de ropa. El crédito que Domitila solita es para surtir con nueva mercadería, para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Domitila De La Paz P. R. lives in the capital of the country, San Salvador. She is 33, single, and has four children who are still minors. Fortunately, Domitilia can count on her mother, María, for help. María helps take care of her small grandchildren when Domitila has to leave to work day to day. She works for her children’s future; she provides their sole support. Domitila has her own business, a stall in the central market where she sells a variety of clothing. The loan that Domitila is asking for is to stock up on new merchandise to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Mrs. Yart Phin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank group loan is for 23 people living in Peam Prachum village in Kandal province.  Mrs. Yart P. is the group leader and has selected the other members who will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes.   Mrs. Yart P. herself is a pig breeder and needs to purchase pig feed for her growing pigs. Her husband, Mr. Kang Rith, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates both rice and vegetables.  Mrs. Yart P. is a 37-year-old mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local school.  The other two are still too young to work or study. 

Most group members will have monthly payment loans.  Nine members will have end-of-term (EoT) loans which means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are able.  Most clients start making payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Ta Ram Group

texts.en:
Here are Maseray K., Mariatu F. and Mabinty C.. They named their group "Ta Ram," a Temne phrase meaning “Let us pay back”. They are small-scale businesswomen from Makeni City who want a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them expand their businesses. This will be their very first loan from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses so that they can attract more customers, make better sales, earn more profits and improve their living standards. 

Maseray K. (on the left in the photograph) is the leader of the group. Maseray was born in a place call Masinra in Northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have four children. Maseray and husband work very hard to look after their children who still attending schools. All of their children attend primary schools, except for the youngest, who is still too young for school. Maseray sells market food: rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and much more. Maseray has been a businesswoman for more than eight years.

loans.use: Invest In Her Business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson Maundu is a 35 year old married father of two children. Nelson and his family live in Shanzu, Mombasa and he runs a food stall in the same area. He has been selling food for 3 year now.

Nelson is currently accessing his first loan from KADET. With the money he plans to refurbish his stall by buying new furniture and to improve his cooking by purchasing meat stock. His main clients are casual workers in the area who enjoy his services.

Nelson hopes to improve the condition of his working premises and run a bigger hotel (cafe) in Shanzu one day.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To refurbish his stall (buy furniture) and to also purchase meat stock to serve to customers

loans.name: Kareem

texts.es:
Kareem es un joven soltero de 20 años, vive en la casa de sus padres.
Hace algunos años atrás sembró los plátanos en las chacras de sus padres, ya que tiene pensado estudiar una carrera técnica en la localidad y para ello sabe que tiene que buscar una fuente de ingresos, y qué mejor dedicándose a la siembra de plátanos. 
Su idea es estudiar de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana dedicarse a tiempo completo a sus cultivos, él está seguro de concretizar sus sueños, ya que tiene el apoyo de su madre para los gastos de su alimentación.
Dedicarse a sus cultivos lo llena de enorme alegría y más aun sabiendo que gracias a sus siembras va poder forjarse una carrera, pues desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su madre y hermanos menores.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde viene haciendo un compromiso de pagar sus cuotas en las fechas señaladas, porque quiere contar son posteriores préstamos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Kareem is a single young man who is 20 years old and lives in his parents' house. A few years back, he planted bananas in his parents' fields as he was planning on studying for a technical carreer nearby and to do so he needed a source of income and nothing could be better than a banana crop. His plan is to study from Monday to Friday and on the weekends work in the fields. He is sure he can achieve his goals since his mother helps with food expenses. Working in the fields fills him with enormous happiness as he knows that the harvest will help him get ahead with his education and he would like to help his mother and younger siblings have a better quality of life. This is his second loan with MFP and he has been timely in his payments because he wants to be able to take out future loans. He will use the loan to buy chemical fertilizer to improve the soil in his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Fertilizer

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza A. is from the village of Ibung Villa Verde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old. Flordeliza is married. To make a living, Flordeliza owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 4 years.

In 2007, Flordeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Flordeliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ivania es una mujer trabajadora y con mucho deseos de poder terminar de construir su casa, tiene 39 años de edad, procreo tres hijos los cuales los tres cursan sus estudios, su esposo es contador pero esta desempleado y solo con la pequeña pulpería sean estado ayudando, pero se ha descapitalizado, es por eso con este financiamiento lograra invertirle en: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, leche, lácteos, pollo, golosinas, gaseosas y poder aumentar las venta como sus ganancias para poder subsistir y poder seguir apoyando a su esposo que espera que pronto logre ubicarse en otro empleo. Ya que son tres hijos los cuales hay que apoyar para que logren una buena educación. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que como muchas familias Nicaragüenses podemos a salir adelante cuando se nos presenta la crisis económica del desempleo, u otra crisis.
texts.en:
Ivania is a hard-working woman who dreams of finishing construction on her house. She is 39 years old and has three children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is an accountant by trade, but he is currently unemployed, so her small grocery store is their family's only source of income. Her business is currently understocked, however, so this loan will allow her to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, dairy products, chicken, candy and soda. She will then be able to sell more merchandise and earn more in profits so that she can sustain her family and support her husband while he finds another job. She has to support her three children so that they can get a good education. She is thankful to Afodenic for supporting many Nicaraguan families like hers through the current economic/unemployment crisis as well as through other past and future crises.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, dairy products, chicken, candy and soda in order to offer a wider variety of merchandise and sell more items

loans.name: Lizbeth Rocio

texts.es:
Lisbeth Rocio H. P. de 27 años de edad vive en casa de su tìa desde hace 3 años, ella no tiene padres y por ello se vino a Ica junto con su familiar. 
Vive en Valle Hermoso – Subtanjalla, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Toledo - Cercado de Ica. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y tuberculos desde hace 2 años y medio.
La cliente se encuentra con 5 meses de gestación pero no vive con el padre de su hijo por motivos personales. Es bien trabajadora, goza de buenas referencias de los vecinos y de parte de sus compañeros de trabajo.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que desea mejorar sus ventas para obtener un mejor ingreso que le permita ahorrar para la venida de su bebé.
texts.en:
Lisbeth Rocio H. P., 27, has lived in her aunt’s house for the last three years. She does not have parents, so she came to Ica together with her relative. She lives in Valle Hermoso – Subtanjalla. Her business is located in the Toledo market in the area surrounding Ica. She has been selling groceries and tubers for two and a half years. She is five months pregnant, but she does not live with the father of her child for personal reasons. She is a hard-worker, and she has good references from her neighbors and colleagues at work. She is asking for a loan to invest in her business. She wants to improve her sales in order to get better earnings. This will allow her to save for the arrival of her baby.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has worked as a hairdresser in her home since 2005. She receives clients in her house, where she has prepared a special room for this purpose. She is known by her village neighbors. She is 23 years old and married with a newborn baby. 

Today, Maria is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy beauty products and hair accessories needed to attract more clients and earn a good income to help her family.

loans.use: Buy beauty products and hair accessories

loans.name: Bolotova Rayma's Group

texts.ru:
Болотова Райма, является лидером данной группы.Ей 53 года, но все еще она активная бизнесвумен. Райма замужем, воспитывает единственную дочь. Ее дочери 20 лет, она студентка 3 курса строительного университета. Учится в столице Кыргызстана, в Бишкеке. Супруг пенсионер, и все свое время ухаживает за животными. Семья клиента занимается животноводством,  у них свое хозяйство состоящее из 5 КРС и 10 МРС. Кредит будет использован для закупа 1 коровы для откорма и последующей реализации. Как и большинство людей, она очень усердно работает, чтобы улучшить уровень жизни ее семьи. 

Омурбеку 45 лет. Он женат, имеет трех дочерей. Все дочери учаться в школе. Супруга домохозяйка. Сам Омурбек также занимается животноводством на протяжении последних 16 лет. Кредит будет использован для закупа 1 теленка. Стоит отметить, что до этого он никогда не работал с заемными средствами. Средняя прибыль в месяц равна 75 долларам.
 
Акин 55 лет, она замужем. У нее 1 сын. Супруг пенсионер, активно участвует в семейном бизнесе (животноводство), а также вместе с сыном дома изготавливают деревянные окна, столы, стулья и прочие. Она является казначеем группы и ответственна за собирание ежемесячной выплаты и погашения ее в Мол Булак Финанс. Кредит будет использован для закупа 2 голов КРС. 

Нурзат 30 лет, она замужем. У нее дочь и сын, оба детей дошкольного возраста. Супруг работает таксистом. Нурзат имеет свой собственный магазин по продаже продуктов питания. В этом бизнесе она три года. Кредит будет использован для увеличения товарооборота в магазине.

Гулбаре  55 лет. Она вдова. У нее семеро детей, самому старшему уже 37 лет, а младшему 13.  Старшие две дети на заработках в России. У нее есть собственное хозяйство, где она выращивает МРС и КРС, а также на земельном наделе выращивает картошку. Кредит будет использован для весенних полевых работ.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Rayma B. is the leader of this group. She is 53 years old, but still an active businesswoman. Rayma is married and is raising her only daughter. Her daughter is 20 years old. She is a 3rd year student at a construction university. She is studying in Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan. Rayma’s husband is retired and spends all of his time taking care of animals. The client’s family is involved in animal husbandry and has a household consisting of 5 cattle and 10 small livestock. The loan will be used for the purchase of 1 cow for raising and subsequent sale.
