Ella requiere un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir materia prima que me permita elaborar mas cenas tales como sopes, tostadas, gorditas, tortas, etc. lo cual me permitirá incrementar mis ventas

loans.use: Buy basic supplies.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
In the community of Villanueva, city of Chinandega, Reyna R. earns a living raising pigs. She has been doing this for five years now and from that she is able to provide for her two sons. Her two sons now need the most support from their mother in order to survive.

It’s very important to point out that Reyna has put in a lot of effort into her business. With much sacrifice, she has successfully run her business and has been able to provide for her family. For that reason today she needs a loan from Ceprodel. With this money she will purchase more pigs to be able to raise them and sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San R. High School, Kiva volunteer

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Reyna R. se dedica a la labor de crianza de cerdos desde hace cinco años con el cual alimenta a sus dos hijos que hoy mas que nunca necesitan de su apoyo para subsistir.

Es de suma importancia destacar que esta dama se ha esforzado mucho en el negocio de los credos por lo que ha logrado con muchísimo sacrificio suplir las necesidades de su humilde hogar de habitación. Para ello hoy en día solicita crédito en Ceprodel con el único propósito de adquirir los cerdos para su respectiva crianza y venta en su local de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Ruzihol

texts.en:
S. Ruzihol is 59 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is currently unemployed. That is why Ruzihol's business is the main source of income for her family. Ruzihol is a market vendor. For more than 8 years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables such as apricots, apples, tomatos, cucumbers and many others in the central local market. Her younger daughter, who is pictured in the photo, helps Ruzihol with the business.

Every day, in the early morning, she buys fresh fruits and vegetables from the local farmers and sells them in the market. In the market, she is known among people because of the attractive prices and her friendly characteristics. All this allows Ruzihol’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for her family. Now it is a good season and her goods are in great demand.

She wants to expand her business in order to earn greater income to be able to arrange the marriage of her darling daughter. For this reason, she is planning to purchase new fresh fruits and vegetables for selling. Ruzihol is requesting a loan of $1000 US that will allow her to do these things. She is promising to repay within 12 months. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her arrange the marriage of her daughter. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret U. is 31 years old and is married. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She runs a patent store (pharmacy) in her community. She learned this business in 4 years.

She needs a loan for $875 USD to buy more medicine to sell to the people in her community. Margaret is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for treatment and for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria I. is 45 years old and married with 4 children.  She sells provisions and foodstuffs.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She has been in this business since 2000.  She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Salha's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Salha, 26 and single, has been a shopkeeper since 2005. Working daily from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Salha is requesting a loan to buy more goods in order to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Ghaniya.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
El Sr. Ever Hilario O. nació en Asunción, vive con Mirian Encina con quien tuvo dos hijos, Oscar y Génesis con 5 y 3 años respectivamente.

Es constructor de obras desde hace mas de 10 años y gracias al financiamiento de la Fundación pudo adquirir una camioneta y diversos tipos de herramientas que lo ayudaron a crecer en lo laboral ya que dirigió importantes obras de construcción.

En esta ocasión el desea invertir en nuevas herramientas que lo ayuden a mejorar su calidad de trabajo, y es por ello que solicita un pequeño crédito para comprarlos.
texts.en:
Señor Ever Hilario O. was born in Asunción. He lives with Mirian Encina and together they have two children, Génesis and Oscar, who are three and five years old, respectively. He has been a construction worker for over ten years and, thanks to financing from the Fundación, he was able to acquire a small truck and various types of tools that help him grow in his business and receive more important construction jobs. This time, he hopes to invest in new tools that will help him improve the quality of his work, and it is for this reason he is requesting a small loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction tools.

loans.name: Nabeela's Group

texts.en:
Nabeela baji is the wife of N. I. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar of the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the last 2 years. She is the mother of four children: three daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Nabeela baji’s husband is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nabeela baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy an instrument for her musical group. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy a grinding machine to grind wheat. Shabana baji wants a loan to buy leather for her leather jacket making business. Majeedan baji wants a loan to buy leather for her leather shoe making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua E. sells foodstuffs like plantain, cassava, and tomatoes at Elmina. Efua has received no formal education.  She is a single parent and has 5 dependants. Efua has been selling foodstuffs since 1998. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business and to increase her income to enable her give a quality education to her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is 27 years old and single. He sells electrical materials like bulbs, wire, etc. Victor is a LAPO client. He needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase electrical materials for sell

loans.name: Sokh

texts.en: Mr. Sokh V. is a villager in Sdao Kanleng village in Kandal province, Cambodia. He is a blacksmith and his wife, Mrs. Dong Vin, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. They face a big problem because one of their three children needs an operation on a leg. Mr. Sokh V. decided to ask for a loan to pay for the hospital fees. He hopes his child will be well soon.

loans.use: To pay hospital fees.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr: A. Rosalie a 41 ans et elle s’est mariée avec EKEMON Theodore. Ils ont 4 enfants ensemble. Rosalie n’a pas eu la chance d’aller a l’école, mais tous de ses enfants sont scolarisés. Elle fait la restauration depuis 20 ans. Les autres crédits qu’elle avait reçu lui ont permis d’augmenter son niveau d’activité et d’aider son mari avec les frais de scolarisation des enfants. Dans l’avenir elle voudrait commencer par acheter les cossettes d’igname en gros. L'igname, c'est une nourriture locale sous forme de tubercule.
texts.en:
Rosalie A., 41, is married to Theodore Ekemon and they have four children. Rosalie herself did not have the good fortune to attend school, but all her children are in school. She has been working in the food service business for 20 years. Her previous loans have permitted her to expand her business and to help her husband with school fees for their children. In the future, she would like to begin buying cocoyam grits wholesale. Cocoyams are a root crop consumed locally.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs used in preparing cooked food

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Mrs. Annaliza G. comes from the beautiful province of Antique. She belongs to Caridad 36 of ASHI-Antique Southwest Branch. This 41-year-old woman is married and blessed with 5 children, 3 in preparatory and 2 in elementary school.

Ms. G. is engaged in tricycad (three-wheeled vehicle doing transport) services. The business was only an adventure for a year and was only a family service, but as time goes by, they have found that it is much better for this to be a business so that it will bring in an income. The people in the municipality of Hamtic serve as the passengers for her husband's tricycad.

Because of the effort, Ms. G. dreams that she will become a big-time businesswoman someday so that she will have her own lot and build a durable house to live in. She dreams also that her children will finish their studies. She is thankful to Kiva lenders who will sponsor her loan.

loans.use: tricycad transport services

loans.name: Allakanson Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Allakanson (toutes mariées) ont en moyenne 34 ans,  3 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koumantou Préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes qui font le commerce d’articles divers sont à leur premier prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) avec  Soro Yiriwaso. 
Ce prêt leur permettra d’acheter, 500 kg de céréales (mil, mais, fonio, haricot) et 200 kg de condiments alimentaires composés surtout de légumes. 
Elles s’approvisionnent les jours de foire à Koumantou auprès des paysans producteurs pour les céréales et des forains venant de Sikasso pour les condiments alimentaires. La vente se fait en détail, au comptant et à crédit à Koumantou tout au long de la semaine avec une clientèle  composée exclusivement de femmes.
Les membres de Allakanson espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000 à 30.000 FCFA qui servira à rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face à certaines dépenses du foyer.
Les femmes espèrent continuer le partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir satisfaire leur clientèle et faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The women of the Allakanson group (all married) have an average age of 34, 3 children, and live in traditional extended families in the village of Koumantou, Prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women sell various items and are on their first solidarity loan (group loan) with Soro Yiriwaso. This loan will permit them to buy 500 kg of cereals (millet, maize, "fonio"--a local grain similar to millet--and dried beans) and 200 kg of condiments, composed mainly of vegetables.

They buy their merchandise on weekly market days in Koumantou from farmers who produce the cereals and from merchants who come from Sikasso to sell at the weekly market fair, in so far as the condiments are concerned. They sell retail, for cash or credit, in Koumantou, all week long, to a clientele composed exclusively of women.

Each of the members of Allakanson group hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 to 30,000 F CFA with which they will repay the interest on the loan and pay certain expenses for their households.

The women hope to continue their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy their clientele and make more profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing various items for re-sale

loans.name: Iurie

texts.en: Iurie's business consists in seed retailing. Iurie purchases the seeds from the Ukraine and sells them to local farmers. He does this business alone as his wife is working abroad. This year he rented land in the village of Zagareanca where he grows tomatoes and cabbage. A loan of 25,000 MDL helped him expand his business. Now Iurie needs another loan for working capital – he will acquire seeds of tomatoes, cucumbers, melons, cabbages, carrots, etc.  He aims to build a greenhouse and plant vegetables inside. Now Iurie is traveling for business in the Ukraine and we wish him success!

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita L., 31, is married with one child. She has one year of experience in the handicrafts business. She sells retail and to the hotels four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (approximately $100).

She has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Makerita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan for business improvement.

loans.use: To purchase paints, cover papers, knives, needles,  etc.

loans.name: Thekla

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 37 year old Thekla M. from Dar es Salaam. She is single with one child, who is 10 year s old. Thekla has been running a beauty salon business since 2007. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Thekla currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase hair steamer and hair product. In the future, she plans to open another business. Thekla thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hair steamer and hair product.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is 53 years old and is married to Frenelinda. They were blessed with four children: Loren is 31 years old, Lea Amor is 25 years old and a college graduate, Rosalie is 21 years old, and their youngest, Merriam Mae is 17 years old and is a special child that requires a lot of attention. Cirilo and his wife hope that they will be able to give their youngest child a good and happy life despite her abnormalities.

Cirilo is hoping to borrow PHP 20,000 as additional capital for his rice farming activity. With the help of his wife, they are able to handle many of the things they need in life. However, they want to improve their livelihoods and have a sustainable business. So Cirilo decided to take out a loan as a means to achieve their family’s goals. Cirilo said, “We should be patient in order to have a productive lifestyle.”

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Mumindjon

texts.ru: Муминджон Турсунов  1957 года рождения, женат имеет 5 детей.  Имеет среднее образование. Он торгует в Чкаловском магазине запасными частями. Три года назад он торговал там же, но арбузами и лепешками. И первый кредит получил на приобретение арбузов и дынь. Теперь у него 2 торговые точки. И он успевает везде. В одной из точек  он посадил продавца торговать товаром, на  другой сидит он сам и торгует. Благодаря кредит от КИВА он прикупит  дополнительные запасные части и различные товары необходимые дляторговли.
texts.en:
Mumindjon T. was born in 1957, he is married and has five children. He has secondary education. He sells spare parts in the store in Chkalovsk. Three years ago he was selling watermelons and flat breads there. His first loan was for buying watermelons and melons. Right now he has two vendor locations and he has time to be everywhere. Mumindjon has hired a sales person to be at one of the locations and stays himself and sells at the second one. Thanks to the loan from Kiva he can buy additional spare parts and other items for sale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand inventory

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua E., who received junior high school education, has been selling tilapia and maize at Elmina since 1999.    She is married to a Mason and they have six dependents. Ekua is responsible for paying the school fees of her children as well as the utility bills. She is requesting the loan to buy more tilapia and maize for sale at the market and hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more tilapia and maize for sale at the market.

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Itohan is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She does tailoring, and she wants to add to the sale of her clothes based on the demand from customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. It will give her additional income. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en:
Mr. Thuch P. is a villager in the village of Pam in the province of Takeo. He is a farmer. He owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice for a living.

This is the rainy season, which is rice cultivation season. Therefore, he decided to ask for a loan in order to buy rice seeds and fertilizers. These are needed to support the field in order to make his crop more productive. In addition, he will use the rest of the loan to buy piglets and pig food to start a pig breeding business.

He is a widower with three children, two of whom are also farmers. The youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers to support the field

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: Mercedes Del Carmen R. M. reside en Apopa municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Mercedes tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y su hija Silva estudiante de 16 años de edad. Mercedes posee su propio negocio donde maneja una pequeña tienda con productos de consumo, y también un pequeño inventario en frutas, como si no es suficiente Mercedes todas las tardes elabora pupusas en su negocio de esta manera logra obtener mayores ingresos, el crédito que solicita Mercedes es para destino de surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes Del Carmen R. M. lives in the town of Apopa in the district of San Salvador. She is 40 years old, married, and has a 16 year old daughter named Silva, who is a student. Her husband works as a bricklayer. Mercedes manages a small grocery store where she sells consumer products and has a small inventory of fruits. If that was not enough, Mercedes makes pupusas in the afternoons in order to earn more income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Maricela Elizabeth

texts.es: Maricela Elizabeth G. D. Q., resiD. en Ilopango municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Maricela es una mujer casada con 32 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y su hija Johana D. 2 años D. edad. Maricela ha instalado una tienda en su casa, la cual le permite obtener ingresos y a su vez poder compartir y cuidar D. su hija todos los días. El crédito que solicita Maricela es comprar nueva mercadería para surtir su negocio y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maricela Elizabeth G. D. Q. lives in the municipality of Ilopango in the department of San Salvador. Maricela is married, 32 years old, and lives with her husband and 2 year old daughter, Johana. Maricela has opened a store in her house, allowing her to make some money and at the same time take care of her daughter everyday. The loan that Maricela is asking for would be used to stock her store with new merchandise and thus increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for sale in store.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad is a 48-year-old married man with 4 children who still went to school. He has owned a van since 2004 where he services the neighboring villages. Today, Imad is requesting to borrow $1,200 to perform maintenance in his van to be able to work properly and earn income.

loans.use: perform maintenance in his van

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
La señora Daysi M. se ha desempañado en la actividad de venta de perecederos como lo son frutas y verduras las que son comercializadas en el mercado Mayoreo en Managua donde a diario oferta las verduras y frutas a sus clientes que le visitan por ser ella una dama muy trabajadora y muy peculiar en su trabajo.

Ella solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las frutas y verduras por lo que espera que dicho crédito le sea proporcionado para así dar lugar a la compra del producto y mejorar las condiciones del negocio.
texts.en:
Daysi M. sells perishables like fruits and vegetables. She sells them in the Mayoreo Market in Managua. Everyday she offers fruit and vegetables to the customers who visit her. She is a very hard-working lady, and she is very particular in her work. She is asking for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables. She hopes she receives the loan so that she can buy the products and improve the condition of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora O. is 36 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. 
Gulnora breeds cattle. She buys the calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. Her husband also attends to this business. Gulnora works hard in order to make the business successful and to generate a stable income for the family. Today Gulnora is planning to purchase the cattle for her household to raise and sell. For this purpose she requests $800 US Dollars. Gulnora would like to thank everyone for support and promises to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 33-year-old divorced mother of five children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the western region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Grace is a trader. She runs a cold store in her community. She sells fresh fish and all kinds of fresh meat. Grace says she also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys the goods from big cold stores in nearby towns. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Oyeteju

texts.en: Oyeteju has a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers and also sells hair extensions and cream. This is the festive season and the demands for her goods and services will be high, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Oyeteju is 37 years old, married with two children, and has been in business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. Oyeteju  thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Gloria Irma

texts.es: La señora Gloria Irma M. S. es una clienta distinguida de Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva, se le hizo un refinanciamiento del crédito porque ella mostró ser clienta cumplida con sus pagos, se hizo la verificación del proyecto anterior y se pudo observar la mejora en su vivienda, nuestra clienta ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para invertir en su negocio, de nombre “Abarrotes Penny” establecida hace 5 años, requiere invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes para darles un buen servicio a sus clientes y tener en su negocio todo lo que el cliente solicita.
texts.en:
Gloria Irma M. S. is a distinguished client of the Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva. Her loan was refinanced because she demonstrated herself to be a client who completes her payments. They verified her previous project, and you could see the improvement on her house. She is now asking for a new loan to invest in her business, which is called “Abarrotes Penny”. It was established five years ago. She needs to buy grocery products to give her customers good service and to have everything that the customer asks for in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
LUZ Y PROGRESO

Este grupo de once personas se dedican al comercio minorista, por diferentes circunstancias tuvieron que buscar la manera de generar sus propios ingresos a través de sus negocios con el propósito de no faltar la economía en sus hogares.
Doris tienes 36 años, es madre de tres niños aún menores de edad (15,13,5 años). A los 29 años tuvo la iniciativa de preparar en casa comida típica de la sierra (sopa de trigo, tallarines con chanfainita, picante de trigo, chuño, yuyo) así iba con su canasta y ollas a ofrecer su comida a los vendedores y a los que transitaban en los mercados; estuvo así regular tiempo sus ventas eran muy buenas debido que no era frecuente encontrar este tipo de comida y a la mayoría de los comerciantes les agrada. Los ingresos de estas ventas solventaron los gastos de alimentación, educación en los momentos en que su esposo no contaba con trabajo. Posteriormente dejó de vender así porque tenía que dar los debido cuidados a su último hijo, pero no fue impedimento para empezar a vender abarrotes en su casa con el capital que ahorró de su anterior negocio compró: 1 saco de arroz, 1 ½ de azúcar, 1 Doc.leche, 1 Doc.atún, sal y detergentes. Los préstamos que recibió lo utilizó para implementar más su negocio y generar más ingresos que le permitiera comprar los útiles de colegio a sus hijos, matricularlos, de igual modo mejorar su casa, instaló un tanque para el agua potable, hizo una ventana de fierro. Este negocio paga los gastos familiares, ya que el sueldo de su pareja no es lo suficiente y Doris quiere para sus niños una mejor calidad de vida, terminar de construir su vivienda. El préstamo que obtendrá será para la compra de dulces, leche, aceite, papel higiénico, atún, gaseosas. 

Juana tiene 47 años, madre de dos hijos. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de pescado, ayuda a su madre en su puesto; para ello se levanta muy temprano 5:30 para comprar la mercadería que necesita en el terminal de Villa María (Lima) esto lo hace por lo menos tres veces por semana compra cuarenta a veinte kilos entre : bonito, jurel, mariscos, pejerrey, tollo, perico, sierra lo que se conoce como doble o simple. Los ingresos de este negocio es para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
El préstamo es para comprar bonito y jurel que son pescados de mayor demanda por los consumidores.
texts.en:
The group "Luz y Progreso" is made up of 11 people who work in various segments of retail trade. They had to look for a way to generate their own incomes through their businesses, with the objective supporting their households economically. Doris is 36 years old, and is the mother of three children aged 15, 13 and 5. When she was 29 she took the initiative to start preparing meals typical of the sierra region (wheat soup, noodles, spicy wheat, dried potatoes, yuyo); she took them in baskets and pots out to sell in the markets to the vendors and people passing through. She was there for a fair amount of time and her sales were very good; the traders liked her food as this type of meal was not generally available. The income from these sales paid for her food expenses, and for her children's education at the time when her husband did not have a job. Later, she stopped selling because she had to care for her last child, but this did not stop her from beginning to sell groceries from the house. With money that she saved from her previous work she bought: a sack of rice, 1 1/2 sacks of sugar, a dozen units of milk and tuna, salt and detergent. Loans that she received in the past enabled her to set up her business and generate more income so that she was be able to buy school supplies for her children and enroll them in school. In addition she improved her home, installing a tank of potable water and putting in an iron window. This business pays for her family's expenses, given that the salary of her partner is not sufficient to cover them. Doris wants a better quality of life for her children and to finish construction on her home. With this loan she will buy sweets, milk, cooking oil, toilet paper, tuna and soft drinks. Juana is 47 years old and is the mother of 2 children. She and her partner have a business selling fish from a stand. To do this she gets up very early at 5:30am to buy the merchandise that she needs at the fishing terminal Villa María in Lima. She does this at least 3 times a week, buying from 20 to 40 kilos of bonito, mackerel, swordfish, parrot fish, and other fish. The income from this business helps her husband with the household expenses. This loan will be used to buy bonito and mackerel, which are the types of fish that are most in demand by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies: groceries and fish

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 35-year-old retailer of molasses in Kakamega, Kenya. He has six employees and his business is located in a busy market center. He sells mainly to individual consumers, brewers of a special type of alcohol, and some companies. He faces constraints in acquiring molasses due to fluctuations in the availability of sugarcane. 

Paul is married and has two children and his hopes and dreams include securing a personal means of transportation. Eventually, he would like to sell molasses to big companies. He envisions himself as a risk-taker.

loans.use: To purchase more molasses

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús M. M. de 42 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a sus tres hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales con mucho esfuerzo por parte de su madre, se dedican a estudiar. Teresa posee un comedor en el cual se encarga de hacer desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales comercializa con trabajadores de las diferentes fábricas del lugar, así como también con habitantes de la zona del pueblo de San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella es una persona que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de los mismo comerciantes del lugar, ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora y esforzada, quien se ha dedica por completo al bienestar de sus tres hijos los cuales depende por completo de ella. Es por esto que Teresa solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda comprar más verduras, pollo, pan, bebidas, y todo lo que le permita elaborar más alimentos y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús M. M. is 42 years old and resides in the Municipality of Lourdes Colón, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her three children, all of whom are minors and attend school, which requires a great deal of effort on her part. Teresa owns a food stall where she is in charge of making breakfast and lunch. It is frequented by the workers of the different factories in the area and also by the residents of the town, San Juan Opico, located in the Department of La Libertad. She is greatly recommended by the business owners of the area, being a very hard-working and determined woman, whom has dedicated herself completely to the well-being of her three children, all of whom depend solely on her. As such, she is seeking out a loan, with which she will be able to purchase vegetables, chicken, bread, refreshments, and anything else she might need to be able to create more dishes and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, chicken, bread, and refreshments.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: San Patricio Group

texts.es:
The San Patricio Group is made of three woman entrepreneurs.  

Deysis del Carmen C. has been purchasing and selling fruits and vegetables in the market of her home town, Masaya, Nicaragua, since 1998. By the means of this business she has been able to raise 8 children, three of which are 16, 14, and 9 years old and live with her. Deysis said she will use the loan to purchase more godos to sell, and with the income it generates she will be able to repair her cart which is deteriorating.  

The other women in the group are Francisca U. who cultivates fruits and vegetables to sell, and Paulina Bermudez who has been selling fruits and vegetables since she was 12 years old, she has a small store in her home.
texts.en:
The San Patricio Group is made of three woman entrepreneurs. Deysis del Carmen C. has been purchasing and selling fruits and vegetables in the market of her home town, Masaya, Nicaragua, since 1998. By the means of this business she has been able to raise 8 children, three of which are 16, 14, and 9 years old and live with her. Deysis said she will use the loan to purchase more godos to sell, and with the income it generates she will be able to repair her cart which is deteriorating. The other women in the group are Francisca U. who cultivates fruits and vegetables to sell, and Paulina Bermudez who has been selling fruits and vegetables since she was 12 years old, she has a small store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ayangoke

texts.en: Ayangoke is an electrician and he is doing well in his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has been in this business for a long time. He is the only electrician in his community and the demands for his services are high. He is married with 4 children and he is 51 years old. His wife also works to support their home. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more materials to increase his business. He has a good relationship with Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to increase his business.

loans.name: Rosaline Sourou

texts.fr: Z. Rosaline Sourou est née le 14 Mars 1980 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Rosaline Sourou réside depuis sa naissance au quartier Djassin Daho, dans le troisième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Mariée à GBETOHO Godonou, un maçon, Rosaline Sourou est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Rosaline Sourou vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les différentes charges de la famille. Rosaline Sourou n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Depuis 15 ans environs, Rosaline Sourou vend du pain sucré à Djassin Tokpa à Porto-Novo, ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et d'apporter une aide financière à son mari. Rosaline Sourou s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rosaline Sourou voudrait élever le niveau de son activité afin de  mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et se faire plus de revenu. C'est la raison pour laquelle Rosaline Sourou sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Z. Rosaline Sourou was born on March 14, 1980 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Since birth, she has been residing in the Djassin Daho quarter, in the 3rd district of the city of Porto-Novo. Married to GBETOHO Godonou, a mason, she is the mother of four children, who are all in school. She helps out her husband with regard to the various family expenses. Rosaline Sourou never attended school. For fifteen years, she has sold sweetened bread in Djassin Tokpa in Porto-Novo. It enables her to support herself and to do her financial part for her husband. She gets her supplies from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin, and also from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rosaline Sourou would like to raise her level of business in order to satisfy her customers further and to earn more income. For these reasons, she's requesting a loan for the first time from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sweetened bread in bulk

loans.name: Harold Fermin

texts.es: El señor Harold Fermín tiene su negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Desde hace 6 años, que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado proporcionarle a su familia estabilidad económica. Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, ya que se aproxima la semana santa y el requiere de la compra de mas productos para su negocio. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y al crédito, sus compras las realiza a camiones repartidores y en el mercado, además recibe ayuda de su esposa la cual trabaja como tortillera. El sueña con mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Harold Fermín has had a grocery store in his home for 6 years; he has always enjoyed providing for his family. He is asking for new funding to invest in stock items for his store because Holy Week is approaching and he needs to buy several products for the store. His sales are both cash and credit; he buys his merchandise from supply trucks and in the market. His wife helps meet household expenses with her earnings as a tortilla maker. He dreams with improving his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Kimutai

texts.en:
Kimutai M. is a 26-year-old farmer near Litein town in the South Rift Valley of Kenya. He's been farming for five years and sells milk through the Kenya Cooperative Creameries. He also earns an income from the small-scale farming of maize. He says that the main challenges to his business are poor milk marketing and the high cost of transport.

Kimutai requested this first loan through Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this will help his family's overall income. In the future, he would like to process his own milk to sell at the local market, purchase more quality dairy cows, and buy more land for farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Awurade Nsesa Da Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Grace is a 39-year-old married woman with 4 children ranging in age from 6 to 21 years old. Her husband is currently unemployed thus making her the sole breadwinner for the home.  Grace describes herself as hard-working.  

Grace has been a hairdresser for the past 10 years.  In addition to her hairdressing business, Grace also sells food items such as rice and stew.  Grace will use the loan to buy hair pomades and rice.  She hopes to eventually expand her hairdressing business from a kiosk (a small wooden store) to a container store which will give her business more exposure.  Grace would also like to help her children get an education. 

Grace is the leader of the group named 'Awurade Nsesa Da', which means “God Never Changes” in Twi, the most common language spoken in Ghana.  There are 6 members in this group.  The other group members are involved in the retail business, selling groceries, 'kenkey' (maize balls), gari (cassava couscous) and beans.  'Kenkey' and 'gari' are traditional Ghanaian foods.  'Kenkey' is a maize-based starchy ball that is usually eaten with pepper and fried fish.

loans.use: Purchase hair pomade, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Sánchez es nuestra socia hace tres ciclos invitada por  su hermana a formar parte del banco comunal Mujeres de la Bahía, vive en la cuidad de Azogues esta ciudad se caracteriza por ser la capital de la provincia del Cañar, su clima es frió es propicio para el cultivo de frutas y legumbres de éste clima,  su gente se dedica a varias actividades como es la agricultura, albañilería, artesanías, entre otras y muchos de ellos han migrado en buca de mejores oportunidades para ellos y sus familias.

Nuestra socia es comerciante de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, esta actividad la realiza hace 35 años ya que cuenta con un puesto propio en un mercado de laciudad, trabaja todos los días sin descansar desde las  7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Doña Rosa tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y ha procreado 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 34, 32 30 y 26 años, sus tres primeros hijos son casados, dos de ellos viven independientes y  una hija casada vive en su casa y compartiendo los  gastos con sus padres y su último hijo que trabaja como guardia y aporta para tambien para la casa,  su esposo le ayuda en el negocio vendiendo la mercadería,  con el esfuerzo en conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

con su credito comprará casacas, pantalones, blusas, camisas, faldas, vestidos, etc.  y seguir surtiendo la ropa para su exigente clientela.

Su meta es incrementar con más mercadería su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Sánchez has been a member of this communal bank for 3 loan cycles. She was invited by her sister to become part of the communal bank "Mujeres de la Bahía." She lives in the city of Azogues, which is the capital of Cañar province, and is known for its colder climate, which is favorable for the production of fruits and vegetables. Its people are engaged in a variety of activities, such as agriculture, masonry, handicrafts, and others, and many of them have migrated in search of better opportunities for themselves and their families. Rosa sells clothing for men, women and children. She has been in this line of work for 35 years, and has her own stall in a market in the city. She works each day without rest from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening. Rose is 54 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 34, 32, 30 and 26 years of age. Her oldest three children are married, two of them live independently and one married daughter lives in her home and shares the household expenses with her parents. Her youngest son works as a security guard and also helps to support the household. Her husband helps her with the business selling merchandise. With a lot of effort, the couple has managed to build their own home. With this loan she will buy jackets, pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, dresses, etc. in order to have a sufficient inventory of clothing for her demanding customers. Her goal is to increase her business with more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy jackets, pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Née en 1968 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique, N. Colette vit depuis sa naissance au quartier Dogoudo à Allada. Colette est mariée à HOUEDANOU Paulin et est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Colette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Colette n’a pas été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins, Colette vend du maïs et du haricot à Allada et à Houègbo. C’est à Bohicon, dans le département du Zou, et aussi à Allada, que Colette achète ses produits. Colette exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans, et a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus importante de sa clientèle, Colette désire renforcer son activité et mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Colette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1968 in Allada in the Atlantique department, Colette N. has spent all her life in the Dougoudo quarter of Allada. She is married to Paulin Houedanou and has five children, all of whom attend school; the couple also has another child in their care. Colette lives with her children and husband, and the couple work together to see to their family's needs. Colette never went to school. In order to meet her family's needs she buys corn and beans from the Zou department and Allada, and sells them in Allada and Houègbo. She has been in this trade for five years and has already received two loans which have been repaid. With rising customer demand, Colette would like to bolster her business activities to better meet her customers' needs; for this reason she is seeking a third loan.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 15 bags of corn

loans.name: Thuli Maiya

texts.en: Mrs. Thuli Maiya L. lives in Khokhana-Dobato, Lalitpur. She is a farmer in Khokhana-Dobato, and grows different types of vegetables. Due to the lack of technology, most of the farmers in this area depend on seasonal farming. Mrs. L. sells her vegetables in the local market in the mornings and evenings. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She has two sons and a daughter all of whom are students. A few years ago her husband died so now she has sole responsibility for her three children.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria tiene 60 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera del Departamento de Morazán,  vive con tres nietos, Willber de 13 años, Ivania de 19 años y Benito de 1 año de edad,  ella posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, venta de productos lácteos y tamales.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos como son: café, aceite, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, y lácteos, queso, crema y dos veces por semana elabora tamales (producto de maíz con carne de pollo) este negocio es el apoyo económico para la familia. Apolinaria es una persona emprendedora que le gusta trabajar y tener su propio negocio. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar una plancha para elaborar pupusas (tortilla de maíz con queso, carne de cerdo), y también invertir una parte para abastecer la tienda con productos nuevos. 
Objetivo es manejar la tienda con productos suficiente para mantener el negocio a largo plazo, contribuir   para mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia.
texts.en:
Apolinaria, 60, lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department with three granchildren: Wilber, 13, Ivania, 19, and Benito, 1. She has a grocery store and also sells dairy products and tamales. She sells products like: coffee, cooking oil, sugar, corn, beans, dairy products, cheese and cream. Twice a week she makes tamales (corn meal stuffed with chicken meat). The business is the family’s source of support. Apolinaria is an enterprising woman who enjoys working and having her own business. She is asking for funds to buy a pupusa (corn tortilla stuffed with cheese and pork) press and also to invest part of the funds to stock the store with new items. Her goal is to stock the store with sufficient items for the long term to provide this family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pupusa press and stock the store with new items: coffee, cooking oil, sugar, corn, beans, dairy products, cheese.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. V. has been in the farming business for years. She raises various crops and pigs on her own land, from which she earns a living.

V. has been married for years and has three kids. Two of them are enrolled in school and other one is a baby. Her husband assists her with the farm work.

V. requests a loan to purchase wood to mend and decorate her old house.

loans.use: To purchase wood to mend and decorate her old house

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married woman and mother of three children who are attending school. She has ten years of experience working as a farmer. She has been running her own farm since 2004. She uses plastic tents to grow her products. These tents also allow her to better monitor product quality as well as grow her products for more months of the year. She works independently in her business. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase needed supplies for her agricultural work. She estimates that the loan will help her increase her profits by 15%. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for her agricultural work

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị (20201020056) is a 43 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  M. is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they both are responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm Xá nhóm 15 (Nhóm 15 ).

M. is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2.200.000 VND a month.

In 2009, M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase pig feed & other supplies. The loan will be the second taken out by M. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand herbusiness.

About the other borrower in the group:

Nguyễn Thị L. (0) is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


M. Nguyễn Thị (20201020055) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  M. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nghiêm Xá nhóm 15 (Nhóm 15 ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  M. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 2.200.000 VND.  Vào 2009, M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  M. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase pig feed & other supplies

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida J. is from the village of Brgy. Calaocan, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Nida is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Nida manages a vending business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Nida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is a married woman who lives in Purok Centro, Bgy.4, Roxas, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: canteen and farming businesses. Her husband Jose M., who is 62 years old, works as a cook in their canteen to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are 18 to 32 years old.

 Juliet joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Juliet has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 60,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to pay for more raw materials so that she can continue to save up for the future to get into the pig-raising business. 

Juliet M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

 About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Josue Manuel

texts.es:
Josué Manuel, es un joven de 19 años, soltero y vive con su madre, juntos poseen una tienda, residen el San Rafael Oriente, departamento de Usulután; Esta tienda se origino hace mas de 15 años siendo fundada por su madre pero hace 3 años paso a ser administrada por él, quien tiene experiencia en el negocio pues creció atendiendo a los clientes y ayudando a su mama con las ventas.
Él quiere invertir en la tienda pues quiere ir progresando y aumentando sus ingresos por este motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos que pondrá a disposición de los clientes el propósito de Josué Manuel es proveer para los clientes todo lo necesario para el hogar y aprovecha para fortalecer su negocio beneficiándose con más ingresos y ventas.
Las aspiraciones de él es darle al negocio una mayor estabilidad y generar los ingresos suficientes para ayudar a su madre con los gastos de la casa, así como en un momento ella lo realizo.
texts.en:
Josué Manuel is a young man. He is 19 years old, single, and lives with his mother. They own a store together. The live in San Rafael Oriente, in the Usulután department. This store opened more than 15 years ago and was funded by his mother. 3 years ago, he started to manage the store since he has experience in the business. He grew up working with customers and helping his mom with sales.
He wants to invest in the store because he wants to make progress and increase his sales. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy products that that will be available to his customers.
Josué Manuel’s plans are to provide his customers with everything they need for the home and to take the opportunity to strengthen the business through more profits and sales. His wishes are to give the business greater stability and to generate enough income to help his mother with the household expenses, like she did at one time.

loans.use: to buy basic food basket products

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Lkhavgaochir

texts.en:
Lkhavgaochir is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Lkhavgaochir's son Myagmardorj attends a local seconday school while his younger daughter stays at home with his wife during the day.
Lkhavgaochir runs a taxi service in his town and plans to operate a small knitting shop for his unemployed wife. He also hopes to save some money to build his own house and provide an education for his children. Lkhavgaochir is very energetic and has good communication skills. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a sewing machine and some raw materials for his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and raw materials for his wife

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Evelia es casada, se dedica a la venta de prendas deportivas remeras y otros atuendos, cuenta con local propio situado en el B° Loma Clavel de nuestra ciudad desde hace 10 años se dedica a esto y es reconocida en la comunidad por tener una distinguida clientela y de muy buena calidad sus prendas. Ella vive con sus dos hijos  y su esposo, tienen casa propia situada, así como medios de transporte( moto, auto) para realizar sus actividades.
Con la ayuda de a la Fundación Paraguaya espera crecer mas en su vida laboral y económica y así lograr el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Evelia is married and sells sportswear such as jerseys and other apparel. She has her own store in the B° Loma Clavel of the city. Evelia has been in business for ten years and is recognized in the community for having a distinguished clientele and offering high quality garments. She lives with her two children and her husband in their own home. They also have their own means of transportation (a motorcycle and a car) so that they can engage in their activities.

With the help of Fundación Paraguaya, Evelia hopes to grow more in her work life and in her finances as well as achieve well-being for her family.

loans.use: Purchase sportswear & jeans

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty M. is from the village of New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 30 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Betty owns a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Betty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Betty from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Cari Milagritos

texts.es:
Cari es una madre de familia de 20 años que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el caserío Punto 9 de Lambayeque, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura. Se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en uno de los ambientes de su domicilio. Ella suele ofrecer estos productos a los vecinos de la zona, los que siempre acuden a su establecimiento para agenciarse de productos de uso diario. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja vendiendo pescado en las zonas aledañas, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Cari desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda responder de mejor modo a la demanda que posee, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Cari is a 20 year old mother who lives with her husband and their young son in the hamlet Punto 9 in Lamayeque, a rural area where most people work in agriculture. The hamlet is more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 
She sells groceries and household supplies in a store in one of the rooms of her house. She mostly sells these goods to her neighbors in the area, people who always come to her establishment to get the goods they use daily. The income she gets from this work goes to her help her husband, who works selling fish in the surrounding area, with the family expenses.
Cari wants to grow her business by buying more popular products so she can respond to demand from her customers. For this, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of $375.

loans.use: To increase her business by buying more popular products so she can respond to demand from her customers

loans.name: Walter David

texts.es:
Walter David C. O. tiene 28 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con la hijo, vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos en la. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE se encuentra ubicada En el recinto Cachel y Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul., esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.
  
Walter David se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Agro Karlyta y vende su producto en la comercial Olivo.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder tener un terreno y un vehículo.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Walter David C. O. is 28 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and child in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The members of the NUEVO HORIZONTE (New Horizon) community bank are located in Cachel y Grande district, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work mainly in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, beans and pigeon peas.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Walter David is a farmer who grows corn, rice, beans and pigeon peas.  He buys his products in Karlyta agricultural market and sells his products in the Olivo shopping area.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing corn, rice, beans and pigeon peas.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as plant diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to own land of his own and a vehicle.  He likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 40 años, vive con su esposo Rogelio (45); y sus dos jóvenes hijos,  juntos habitan su casa propia en un paraje ubicado en la selva peruana.Marcelina se dedica al cultivo de cacao, coca, café y plátanos en el centro poblado de Palmapampa, distrito de Samugari y desde hace 30 años trabaja sola. Cada mañana con la salida del alba, Marcelina empieza su  rutinaria que consiste en desmontar, regar, tratar de que las plagas no perjudiquen sus cultivos. Y cuando es tiempo de cosecha necesita la ayuda de  peones, para poder hacerlo con mayor  cuidado; le encanta trabajar en su chacra porque le gusta mucho la naturaleza, a veces suele enojarse porque los peones no hacen el trabajo correcto sin embargo  los frutos que cosecha le son rentables porque sus ventas son normales y sus productos se venden bien  en el centro de acopio de su pueblo. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado  sembrar hoja de  coca porque es una planta bastante  rentable.Es su sexto préstamo con MFP, y asegura que no fallara con las fechas de pago, porque no quiere defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito.Marcelina tiene planeado invertir los dos mil soles solicitados en  la compra de abono, para preservar la calidad de sus productos, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 40 years old.  She lives with her husband, Rogelio (45), and her two young children, in their own home in the Peruvian jungle.  Marcelina grows cacao, coca, coffee and bananas in the village of Palmapampa, in Samugari district.  She has worked alone for 30 years.

Every morning at dawn, Marcelina starts her daily routine which consists of irrigating her land and making sure that pests do not jeopardize her crops.  At harvest time, she needs the help of laborers so that she can do her work more carefully.  She enjoys working on her plantation because she really likes nature.  Sometimes she gets annoyed because the laborers don't do their work properly but the fruits that she harvests are profitable because her sales are ok and her products sell well in the warehouse centers in her village.  As she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to start sowing coca leaf because this is quite a profitable plant.

This is Marcelina's sixth loan with MFP and she assures us that she will not fail to make her repayments on time as she does not want to let down the people who have made her loan possible.  Marcelina plans to invest the 2,000 Peruvian soles that she has requested in buying manure to preserve the quality of her products.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy manure to improve her crops

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes G. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 51 years old. Lourdes is married. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lourdes wants to be able to help her family financially, so she does her best to do so.

Lourdes joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizer. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lourdes from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 52-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a ready-to-wear clothing business. She lives in Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her ready-to-wear clothes business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. 

Rosita is  borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she could purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Simona De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Simona es mujer trabajadora, madre de dos hijos, casada, con el apoyo de su esposo.
Su trabajo que realiza desde hace más de veinte años es el lavado y planchado domiciliar, comenzando con necesidad de poder obtener ingresos para apoyar a su familia.
Por medio de financiamiento ha logrado hacer mejora  a su vivienda, lo que para su familia ha sido de mucha satisfacción. Con el crédito anterior comenzó un muro en la parte de enfrente, ahora quiere levantar pared en la parte de alado de su terreno y así pode cerrar toda su propiedad, para mejor cuido de sus hijos. Y que solo por medio de Afodenic lo esta obteniendo.
texts.en:
Simona is a hardworking woman, the mother of two children, and she is married. She has her husband's support. The business she has had over the past twenty years has been private laundry services. She started out when she saw a need to obtain an income to support her family. 

Through the use of loans she has been able to improve her house, a project that has been very satisfactory for her family. With the previous loan she started a front wall and now she wants to build the side wall to her land. She will be closing off the entire property and it will be a benefit to her children's care. And it is only through Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) that this has been possible.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a wall.

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta W., 33 years old, is from Murumba. She is married to Erick and they have three children aged 9, 7 and 5 years old.

Redempta has been selling fish for the past year. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a client. Redempta will use the loan to buy more fish to add to her stock. Her monthly income is KES 1,700 and she hopes that this will rise. The profits from the loan proceeds will be used to pay school fees for Redempta's children. She hopes to be able to open up another fish stall soon.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy, de 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Sergio de 46 años y su querido hijo Geremi de 11 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La panadería “La Estancia” de la ciudad de Tarma, es el lugar donde Edy trabaja todos los días, con mucha habilidad decora los pasteles que serán puestos a la venta, ya que tiene mucha creatividad y buen pulso para adornar las tortas. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también tiene una piñateria, la cual a dejado un poco de lado, por falta de materiales para la elaboración de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es decorar los pasteles, ya que se divierte mucho haciéndolo, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cumplir con todos los pedidos que hacen a la panadería. Con el tiempo, espera poder mejorar su piñateria, para así sacar adelante su negocio propio. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará materiales, para implementar mejor su piñateria.
texts.en:
Edy is 32 years old.  She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 46 year-old Sergio, and her beloved son, 11 year-old Gerimi, who are the motivation behind all her efforts.

'La Estancia' bakery in the city of Tarma is where Edy works every day.  With a lot of skill she decorates the cakes that will be put on sale since she has a lot of creativity and a good hand for decorating cakes.  In addition to this business, she also has a piñateria (piñata business) which she has left a little to one side because of a lack of materials to make her products.

What Edy most likes about her work is decorating the cakes since she really has fun doing it.  She has been in this business for 6 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to fill all the orders that they make at the bakery.  Over time, she hopes to be able to improve her piñateria so that she can make progress in her own business.
